results.description:
This is a class in technique although, when you've conquered a song technically, then I will coach musicality and performance. Class size is limited. Fee is $20/per. You may audit the class once (without participating) for $10. Let me know when you sign up if that's your intention.

    People at the front desk are helpful and friendly and the Cafe on the floor has great coffee and cookies, sandwiches, <a>pizza</a>, etc.

    I've been asked to post this:

Dear Members:  I am Mr. Harrington's agent/rep. Mr. Harrington teaches privately coaching established actors and singers. For years his private rate has been $120/hr for this service. He started teaching through Meetup earlier this year and has as his goal to bring professional level instruction to the public at a rate that leaves no one behind. This demands tight scheduling of both his time and the room rental with Ripley-Grier Studios.For these reasons, I will be insisting to him that "no shows" be dropped from the group. The policy is this: If you RSVP you better show up. If you cancel you better do this by 4:00 pm the previous day.A word to the wise...Michael T. Harvey
results.how_to_find_us: Room assignment is posted on the 16th floor electronic billboard.

New York, NY

results.description:
Eileen McCarren, Tournament Director 

Eligible:   All members and guests with at least some experience. 
PLEASE PLAY!  More players equal more fun. No first-time players.

Cost:  Free.

Registration: Each player must register on Meetup by midnight 3/4. This will help Eileen and the committee set up teams in advance. 

4:30 PM Set-up, check-in, and team formation. 

5:15 PM Games begin. Anyone not at the pool by 5:00 PM may be disqualified, as it is very difficult to juggle team makeup and keep them balanced.  PLEASE do not be late.

Team Formation The Tournament Director and Tournament Committee will make up teams, probably each captained by an A or B player, and aim for roughly equal strength teams with each team having a variety of skills.  We’ll play five-person teams if 20 or more people register; 4-person teams if fewer.

Maximum 1 goal per half per player Unless all players on team have scored in half

Goalie Limit A-team quality goalies cannot be primary goalies (may defend against fast breaks only). Tournament director to categorize.

Goal Multiplier – for all rounds Each player suggests their own category - but Tournament Director has final determination.

 A & B team levels: each goals = 1 point

 C Team level: each goal = 2 points

Tackling Each player may announce if they wish to be capsized.  Players who do not wish to be capsized may not capsize others.

ROUND-ROBIN

3 points for win; 1 point draw; 0 points loss

Playoff seeding: Points; Goal differential (max. 4/game); goals

PLAYOFFS - Handicapping 

4 plays 1; 2 plays 3

Consolation and championship games playoff handicaps: Teams get ranking differential (4th minus 1st means 4th place team starts with 3 points; 3rd place team starts with 1 point against 2)

Tournament Director is sole arbiter of rules, and may interpret or make up additional rules, for fun or fairness, as she sees fit.

Prizes for Round-Robin & Playoff Champions

results.description:
Hello Lovely Ladies!  Below are the details for our next circle :-)

**In order to attend this circle you must email me at [masked]**

You are invited to join a sacred circle for an evening of meditation, sharing, support, and setting intentions for the next moon cycle.  This new moon will be in Pisces; the sign of mysticism and spirituality.  We will be exploring our beliefs surrounding God (or whatever you choose to call your higher power) to strengthen that which unifies us with the Divine and releasing anything which keeps up in separation.  This will be a time to let go of any Dogma or beliefs that do not serve you, or that may have never been yours to begin with.  Allow yourself to be held in the energies of the Divine Feminine as you connect to the spirit of the heavens; a heaven that is uniquely yours.  Women of all ages and spiritual beliefs are welcome.  Space is limited so email me at [masked] to reserve your spot in the circle. 

When: Saturday March 5th, 5pm-630pm
Location: Reflections Yoga Center, 227 E 24th St, New York, NY 10010
Exchange: $15 cash or through venmo app (@stephanie-jaggers)
Bring: Journal/paper and your favorite pen
Optional: personal item to put on altar (will be returned)

**There will be a smaller gathering on Mon March 7th, 7-830 for the women that can't make it on Sat.  If you would like to attend on that date, email me for details.


For more info visit http://www.stephaniejaggers.net/womens-circles/

Hope to see you there!

Much Love,
Stephanie

results.description:
Calling all women ballers that are looking to play some basketball with their fellow gals.

12 spots will be available for women and half the gym will be used strictly for women's only games.  The other half of the court will be used for a co-ed game.  If you're looking to play only with women, RSVP to this meetup event.  If you're a woman and would prefer to play the with both genders, please RSVP to the other meetup event on this same day.

Other than that, the idea will be basically the same:

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we have to be out of the gym by 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later! Don't forget:

* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* You will be asked to sign a waiver for 2016 as we're not a litigious group. If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers an email.

Here are the basic rules we follow for games: 1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Make it - take it.

3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

5. Walls, half-court line, and ceiling are out of bounds. 6. Subs will enter the game no later than 6 points in (once one of the teams reaches 6 points). The sub will start the following game. Teams will regulate themselves but let's make sure everyone plays.

See you on the court! B-)

***NOTE***

In an effort for us to reduce overcrowding and to maintain a more accurate estimate of how many people to expect, please sign up online if you intend to play. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. We ask that you please just do not show up unannounced as you will kindly be asked to turned away. Also feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your nails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour that includes an ice breaker and prizes, light appetizers, and is topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates."

SEE THE VENUE:

http://www.boccaeast.com

HOW IT WILL WORK:

5-5:45pm - Happy Hour complete with light appetizers (meat & cheeses - $8 select red & white wine) , a fun ice breaker, and  prizes awarded to the two people who get the most matches.

5:45pm - You'll be seated for your first speeddating round.

5:45-6:45 - You'll have approximately* 7-10  three to four minute "mini-dates"

6:45 - Turn in your dating cards to the host and mingle. Matches will be emailed to you within 48 hours.

On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$32  - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2016atwysnycspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's  more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. 

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 28-40 --3F/1M SPOTS LEFT

1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Make it - take it.

results.description:
This promises to be an amazing and engaging multi-dimensional experience centered on women. And it's FREE! I'm hanging in for the drummers for sure! Film at 8:00 PM (see below)


"She Knows No Bounds"
March 5, 2016
Brooklyn Museum

More about the event: Target First Saturdays

PROGRAM SCHEDULE:


Music

5:00 p.m.

Brooklyn-based Honeybird explores womanhood through multicultural soundscapes.

Dance

6:00 p.m.

The Erica Essner Performance Co-Op presents Reflex 2015, a dance of chain reactions, where touch is an analogy for the power of language. A Q&A with the dancers follows.

ASK + EXPLORE

6:00–9:00 p.m.

Explore the Museum tonight using our ASK Brooklyn Museum app. We'll give you a special guided experience around themes of women, art, and society. You'll need an iPhone, but Android coming in April!

Pop-Up Performance

6:00–7:00 p.m.

Tom Tom Magazine's acclaimed female drummers take over the galleries. Follow beatboxer Ashley “SAYWUT?!” Moyer for an immersive storytelling experience celebrating women drummers.

Storytelling

6:00 p.m.

Queer Memoir's aim is high: to make sure all queer stories are heard. But their show is simple: a queer human, a story, and the people who listen. Tickets (25) available at the Admissions Desk starting at 5 p.m.

Hands-On Art

6:30–8:00 p.m.

Explore printmaking techniques used by activists and print a postcard acknowledging the important women in your life.

Pop-Up Gallery Talks

6:30–8:30 p.m.

Enjoy ten-minute discussions about art around the Museum.

Drummer Talkback

7:00 p.m.

Between gallery performances, join Mindy Abovitz, editor-in-chief of Tom Tom Magazine, and women drummers to explore the complex, undocumented history of female drummers.

Music

7:00 p.m.

Genre-blending duo Denitia and Sene perform complex melodies reflecting vulnerability, intimacy, and emotive power.

https://youtu.be/EJHunx2Y07c

Film

8:00 p.m.

Sign Painters (Faythe Levine and Sam Macon, 2013, 80 min.) celebrates an often-overlooked art. A talkback with Levine and sign painter Marcine Franckowiak follows.

SIGN PAINTERS (OFFICIAL TRAILER) from samuel j macon on Vimeo.

https://vimeo.com/samueljmacon/signpainters

Pop-Up Performance

8:00–9:00 p.m.

Tom Tom Magazine's acclaimed female drummers take over the galleries. Follow beatboxer Ashley “SAYWUT?!” Moyer for an immersive storytelling experience celebrating women drummers.

Music

9:00 p.m.

Dynamic soulstress Yahzarah cradles powerful messaging in warm and inviting vocals.

results.description:
How to be unconditionally happy?

A mind that is calm, without anticipation and agitation is the birth right of all individuals. A mind that is in the present moment will be happy.


What can get you to that state?

The rest you gain by reposing in yourself is deeper than the deepest sleep. The deeper your rest, the more dynamic your activity is. By being peaceful and happy you can turn your body into a power-house by generating an inner source of energy.


Meditation is simple and is a practical way to recharge and rejuvenate; empowering you to do more of the things you love.

Come join us for free guided session and experience the power of meditation.


Workshop Contents:

- Understanding the nature of the mind!
- Relaxing Breathing Techniques
- Guided Meditation
- Introduction to the Happiness Course and Sudarshan Kriya

results.description:
The first Saturday of every month we meet at 5 pm, instead of the normal weekly Saturday meeting time of 2 pm.

After our meditation program, which ends by 7 pm, we enjoy a healthy potluck dinner.  Please join us!  It's really a great way for us to get to know each other better. 

Log onto www.perfectpotluck.com to let us know what you'd like to bring. Type in Administrator: Fitzpatrick, password: Ananda. You can see what others are bringing to help you decide! Call Linda Fitzpatrick at[masked] if you have any questions or need help entering your food selection on the perfectpotluck.com site.

The potluck goes on until about 9 pm; although you can leave anytime you like.  It's all very informal and friendly.

We meet at the Wilson House of the First Baptist Church, 456 North Street (corner of Bryant Ave.) in White Plains. Email Merrill Harmin, [masked] if you have questions.

Our typical agenda:

- We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives.
- Then we meditate together chanting mantra followed by the beautiful sounds of a gong.
- And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can.

The group has been meeting for some time before Meetup began. The Meetup page is not a reflection of the group's attendance as it shows only the Meetup members that are planning to attend a particular meeting. The special potluck meeting we hold the first Saturday of each month has an average attendance of about two dozen members.
results.name: American Meditation Society  - Monthly Meditation and Potluck Dinner

results.description:
This is where it all started! In honor of our first Meetup, let's go to The Double Windsor, the bar that inspired me to start this group. Our mission is simple: let's have a few awesome beers in this chill, candlelit bar. See below for more info about the venue.

Getting there:
Take the F/G to 15 St. Prospect Park

Note:
This bar is cash only, so bring cash if you can. They do have an ATM on site.
More venue info here:
http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-double-windsor-brooklyn

New York mag review of the bar (a critic's pick!):
Located just off the southwest corner of Prospect Park, the cozy wooden space is a haven for beer lovers: There’s a rotating selection of $5 to $9 microbrews on tap, as well as a variety of local and imported bottled and canned beers, listed on a chalkboard behind the bar. There are candlelit dark-wood tables spread liberally along the brick walls and a long beer hall–esque fourteen-person table down the middle. The result is a low-key space that feels full, but never crowded. — Molly Finkelstein
Credit: http://nymag.com/listings/bar/double-windsor/

results.description:
Meet for a Sichuan chinese dinner at Cheng Du 23. BYOB! It's off Route 23 South near the AMC Movie theater and next to Home Goods near Willowbrook Mall.
Menu: www.chengdu23.com
Meeting: Meet in the front of the restaurant, I'll have a Meetup sign.
Bring your own wine or beer. Payment- Bring exact change, but I'll try to get individual checks.


"Chinese cooking files food into a series of tidy taste classifications such as sweet or sour. Sichuan cuisine, known more commonly in the West as “Sichuan,” claims a category all their own: mind-numbing.

Sichuan food has always been famous for its well deserved stereotype “ma la” (tongue numbing and spicy）dishes. When a person from Sichuan asks if a person likes spicy food, that person should consider their answer. Natives of China’s spiciest province do not joke when it comes to liberal usage of hot red chili pepper, wild pepper and garlic.

The prevailing Sichuan food consists of popular dishes eaten by common people and characterized by pungent, hot, spicy, and above all, ma (tongue numbing) — a sign of “culinary machismo” flavors."
results.name: Dinner @ Cheng Du 23 in Wayne

results.description: The heroes learned about the Silver Marches region, its rulers Alustriel Silverhand, Taern Hornblade and Jorus Azuremantle and some important NPCs Voroaghamanther the alchemist and Eldenser the Wyrm who Lives in Blades. They also heard about shadowy organizations that are enemies of Silverymoon, the Arcane Brotherhood of Luskan and the Drow of Menzoberranzan. The heroes escorted a supply caravan to Sundahar successfully defeating a Hezrou demon and Hill Giant on the way. Evidently, clouds are gathering and the talk everywhere is of a coming war with orcs and their allies. The party concludes the invading force is likely orc foot soldiers with demon shock infantry, but the top leadership has yet to reveal itself.

results.description:
During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in Long Island and New York City, with his concentration in securities law.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.

Speed dating is a fun low pressure way to meet eligible singles, This event is for Singles ages 28-38

During the check-in we encourage everyone to grab a drink and mingle.

Once everyone is checked in daters will be given guideline on where to sit, how to rotate, etc.

You will have a few minutes to chat with each of your dates and then rotate until you've met everyone.  You will register the names of those you are interested in. Mutual matches will be notified within 24 hours.  No information is exchanged unless you both express interest in each other.

results.description:
On a day just like today in March of 1836, a few folks in Mexican Texas got together and were like, "Dude, WTF?!"

The Texas Declaration of Independence officially declared independence from Mexico and created the Republic of Texas. Hooray!

Oddly enough, New Yorkers know how to celebrate this holiday better than a lot of Texans do. The 8th Annual Salute to Texas Independence Day at Terminal 5 honors our roots with a kickass concert featuring Pat Green, the Randy Rogers Band, the Casey Donahew Band, and Wade Bowen.

BONUS: Anyone with a Texas-related tattoo or wearing an article of clothing with a logo from a Texas College on it will receive one complimentary drink (must be 21+).


Tickets can be purchased through Ticketmaster ($35 advance / $40 day of show). Doors open at 6pm and the show starts at 7pm.

NOTE: This is an unhosted event. Please purchase your own tickets for the concert using the Ticketmaster link.

If y'all want to meet up early for drinks or want to coordinate post-show activities, please use the comments section (below) on this event page.

http://www.ticketmaster.com/8th-annual-salute-to-texas-independence-new-york-new-york-03-05-2016/event/00004F77C5604408

Join Melissa and meet some of NYC & NJ’s most eligible single women for speed dating and networking! Would you rather make friends instead? Come join the fun – there is no pressure. Make romantic, friendship, and even business connections. You can speed-date, speed-friend, or speed network!  

$20 if you preregister for a speed dating seat or 
$25 to sign up at the door (both includes entrance to our singles mixer)

and we provide you with everything you need including pen, clip board, score card and optional questions! 

ATTENTION: Speed Dating rounds start at 7pm SHARP! Arrive no later than 6:30 to receive your materials. 

$7.00 Specialty Cocktails Specials! 
$7.00 Beer!! 
$25.00 Hookah!!! 
Yummy Tapas Menu!!!! 

It’s okay if you’re feeling nervous about speed dating because I will guide you from start to finish and give you all the tools you need to succeed! 

<a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=LWZGN3X2EER9E">

Preregister now by clicking here!!

*This is not just a speed dating event - This is a singles mixer too!!*

$5.00 cover to attend mixer only 
6pm - 10pm

Don't want to speed date but still want to have fun? Join us at our singles mixer where we will drop our inhibitions and go out on a limb for love! While the women are speed dating, you can mingle with one another and see what all the speed dating fuss is about! I will be there to help break the ice and make introductions. You never know who you'll meet! Once speed dating rounds are done, we ALL GET TO PARTY TOGETHER and dance the night away! 

If you're nervous about attending a singles event, don't be! Fearless women from all spectrum of the rainbow attend my events and make fun, quality connections - Why Not You?! 

Let's dance the evening away and make lasting connections at this beautiful space tailored for a grown and sexy FUN time! 

**Free admission to our After-Party at the Lengendary Henrietta Hudson!!!! What?! Password will be provided** 

How it works: 

• Rounds will last approximately 3-5 minutes depending upon the number of participants. 
• Scorecards and assigned numbers will be handed out to all speed dating participants. In addition, suggested questions  will be provided to help the tongue-tied and we encourage you to ask your own! Be creative with your questions and more importantly HAVE FUN! 
• At the end of the event submit your scorecards to Melissa. She solely will review scorecards. 100% private & confidential! Client privacy is of top concern. When two singles indicate the same level of interest toward each other (2nd date, friendship, business), we will provide each with the other’s contact information via email.

and Voila! 

This event is being cross-promoted over several meetup groups and all over Facebook. The RSVP represented here is NOT indicative of actual participation!

Speed Dating seats sell out quickly - Preregister via Paypal today to ensure your seat is reserved by visiting 

</a><a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=LWZGN3X2EER9E">https://littlegaybook.com/events/lesbian-speed-datingnetworking-2/ 

How would you like to go on 30+ micro dates in one night? Oh, the possibilities! Spend your evening with me while I guide you through each round of dates. 


</a>

Join Melissa and meet some of NYC & NJ’s most eligible single women for speed dating and networking! Would you rather make friends instead? Come join the fun – there is no pressure. Make romantic, friendship, and even business connections. You can speed-date, speed-friend, or speed network!  

$20 if you preregister for a speed dating seat or 
$25 to sign up at the door (both includes entrance to our singles mixer)

and we provide you with everything you need including pen, clip board, score card and optional questions! 

ATTENTION: Speed Dating rounds start at 7pm SHARP! Arrive no later than 6:30 to receive your materials. 

$7.00 Specialty Cocktails Specials! 
$7.00 Beer!! 
$25.00 Hookah!!! 
Yummy Tapas Menu!!!! 

It’s okay if you’re feeling nervous about speed dating because I will guide you from start to finish and give you all the tools you need to succeed! 

<a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=LWZGN3X2EER9E">

Preregister now by clicking here!!

*This is not just a speed dating event - This is a singles mixer too!!*

$5.00 cover to attend mixer only 
6pm - 10pm

Don't want to speed date but still want to have fun? Join us at our singles mixer where we will drop our inhibitions and go out on a limb for love! While the women are speed dating, you can mingle with one another and see what all the speed dating fuss is about! I will be there to help break the ice and make introductions. You never know who you'll meet! Once speed dating rounds are done, we ALL GET TO PARTY TOGETHER and dance the night away! 

If you're nervous about attending a singles event, don't be! Fearless women from all spectrum of the rainbow attend my events and make fun, quality connections - Why Not You?! 

Let's dance the evening away and make lasting connections at this beautiful space tailored for a grown and sexy FUN time! 

**Free admission to our After-Party at the Lengendary Henrietta Hudson!!!! What?! Password will be provided** 

How it works: 

• Rounds will last approximately 3-5 minutes depending upon the number of participants. 
• Scorecards and assigned numbers will be handed out to all speed dating participants. In addition, suggested questions  will be provided to help the tongue-tied and we encourage you to ask your own! Be creative with your questions and more importantly HAVE FUN! 
• At the end of the event submit your scorecards to Melissa. She solely will review scorecards. 100% private & confidential! Client privacy is of top concern. When two singles indicate the same level of interest toward each other (2nd date, friendship, business), we will provide each with the other’s contact information via email.

and Voila! 

This event is being cross-promoted over several meetup groups and all over Facebook. The RSVP represented here is NOT indicative of actual participation!

results.description:
Please note change in date. The bar is also walk-in only but I'm hoping there are not that many people crazy enough to start drinking at 6pm :)

The Book: Wuthering Heights

Wuthering Heights is a wild, passionate story of the intense and almost demonic love between Catherine Earnshaw and Heathcliff. The action of the story is chaotic and unremittingly violent, but the accomplished handling of a complex structure, the evocative descriptions of the lonely moorland setting and the poetic grandeur of vision combine to make this unique novel a masterpiece of English literature. 


The Whisky: Bowmore Devil's Cask

Rich peat and succulent dark fruit flavors collide like the unstoppable force meeting the immovable object, but the only thing that'll give is your taste buds' resistance to this astounding whisky. With an alcohol content as big as its taste, it does run a little hot when taken neat. It's nothing that a few drops of water can't cure, though it does bring out the sherry notes at the expense of the peat.


The Bar: Death & Co.

Death & Co won Best American Cocktail Bar and World’s Best Cocktail Menu at Tales of the Cocktail Spirited awards. Death & Co continues to receive worldwide recognition as a cocktail industry leader.


The bar stocks an array of rare, aged brown liquors. Woody, understated classicism may be the intended look when the owners tucked suede banquettes under black-granite tables lit by crystal chandeliers, but the cocktails and cuisine don’t hew as closely to speakeasy traditions.
results.name: Wuthering Heights + Bowmore Devil's Cask

results.description:
Not one of "our" events, but Michael Alan throws some WILD happenings, and this will definitely be one of them! Be sure to get your tickets through the links provided below. Meetup RSVPs will not be honored.

Mike Alan Alien has continued to produce massive live happenings of bodies as living, breathing artworks for 15+ years in a spectacular live show known as THE LIVING INSTALLATION.

The sights and sounds are something to behold, the artist himself rapping poetic words over otherwordly mixes, spray painting on canvases, creating works within works on bodies and paper, creating a while new world writhing within 17 Frost Gallery.

March 5th, he returns to 17 Frost Gallery with THE HUMAN PUPPET THEORY, described as "a dark satire on how as humans, we are puppets and how to break free."

Michael Alan, the drugged puppet, will work with 9 models on stage and build them and move their bodies as they do the same to him, flesh and heads, and they will learn what real freedom is!

Eat him or care for him! Or kill goats!
...a wild surreal drama.
There are no words to truly describe the action. It's a must-see to satisfy your curiosities...

Featuring live music by Tim "Love" Lee, Michael Alan, and Ramsey Jones!!!!!

Hosted by Erica Imbasciani aka MiMi Mummy

results.description:
Please join The Animals’ Battalion in protesting Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus. at the Barclays Center arena- LET’S SHOW THEM THAT ANIMAL ABUSE IS NOT WELCOME IN NEW YORK!

www.ringlingbeatsanimals.com



WHEN: Saturday March 05, 2:00PM – 3:00PM,  6–7PM

WHERE: In front of Barclays Center, 620 Atlantic Ave., Brooklyn, NY 11217 accessible by the 2,3,4,5 trains (See this map.) http://goo.gl/maps/IVX0G

Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus is known for its long history of abusing animals. In 1929, John Ringling ordered the execution of a majestic bull elephant named Black Diamond after the elephant killed a woman who had been in the crowd as he was paraded through a Texas city. Twenty men took aim and pumped some 170 bullets into Black Diamond's body and then chopped off his bullet-ridden head and mounted it for display in Houston. Ringling Bros.' cruel treatment of animals continues today.

Elephants in Ringling's possession are chained inside filthy, poorly ventilated boxcars for an average of more than 26 hours straight—and up to 100 hours at a time—when the circus travels. Even former Ringling employees have reported that elephants are routinely abused and violently beaten with bullhooks (weapons that resemble a fireplace poker) in order to force them to perform tricks.

To learn more about Ringling's lengthy history of abusing animals, check out PETA's factsheet. http://circuses.com/pdfs/RinglingHiddenTruthFSetc.pdf

There will also be protests every day Ringling's will be at the Barclay Center.
results.name: The Animals’ Battalion: Ringling Brothers Circus Protest @ Barclays Center

results.description:
Come and learn the chemistry of saponification and learn how to make natural soap from scratch that does NOT contain ingredients like petroleum-based oils (like mineral oil), animal fats (like sodium tallowate, lard, or lanolin) and synthetic detergents (like sodium laureth sulfate) that can be harsh on delicate skin.

By making your own soap, you can tailor it to suit any skin type as well as insure that only the most beneficial ingredients go into your finished soap.

The class will cover the following. Learn how to make a 4-pound batch of soap (about 12 bars) using the cold process method:

• Brief history and basic chemistry of soap making 
• Necessary materials, supplies and equipment 
• Safety considerations when working with sodium hydroxide 
• Taking accurate measurements & proper mixing temperatures 
• Preparing your molds and molding options 
• Insulating, cutting, curing and storing your finished soap 
• Each student will receive some hands-on experience, an information-packed class handout with instructions, recipes and valuable supplier list. 
• Review oils for soap making, fragrance oils vs. essential oils, superfatting, exfoliants, coloring, molding and curing. 
• Students will receive soap recipes and a list of my favorite places to buy soap making supplies and equipment as well as take home 2 bars of natural soap for you to enjoy!

More info and tickets here - https://goo.gl/ZqCP0O

*Please not that this Meetup listing may not have accurate information - the people who have RSVPed may not have PAID/SIGNED UP. Please check attached link for the most accurate details!
results.name: Learn to make soap from scratch!

results.description:
Take A Risk: SEX! is an experiential event where you take a risk to share and explore an aspect of your sexuality . 


When we experience ourselves as sexual beings, open to our full flow, pulsing with life energy through our body, we become more creative and feel more deeply connected to ourselves and to others. In this dynamic, interactive evening combining individual work with group process, you will learn techniques to liberate this energy and access more pleasure in your life. These techniques will be demonstrated through individual body readings with select participants who choose to take the risk of revealing a sexual issue and are willing to work through it in a supportive environment with expert guidance. 

Dr. Kincaid uses the teachings of Integral Evolutionary Tantra and the principles of Core Energetics to open up physical blocks and places where life energy doesn’t move. In Integral Evolutionary Tantric teachings and in Core Energetics -- a powerful body-based process -- sexual energy and life force energy are one and the same. Join us with body readings, deep truth, wild goodness, radical personal transformation and, if you dare, the evolution of your own personal enlightenment.

Note: This workshop is for both couples and singles. It does not include nudity or explicit sexual touch. All genders and sexual preferences welcome.

Led by Kristina Kincaid in conjunction with

The Institute of The Integral Evolutionary Tantra

Assisted by Tara Urszula Pietrzykowska

Admission: $20 

Tickets: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/take-a-risk-sex-with-dr-kristina-kincaid-tickets-21597797594

When you register or attend, please make a point to tell the facilitator that you heard about this event from the Pleasure Without Borders Meetup.


Dr. Kristina Kincaid is the Director of The Institute of Integral Evolutionary Tantra, New York City. Kristina is on faculty at The Institute of Core Energetics and holds an M.A. in Energy Medicine and a Doctorate in Theology from Holos University. She is also a graduate of the Institute of Core Energetics and Barbara Brennan School of Healing. Her journey has taken her into deep explorations and healing around sexuality. She has a healing practice in NYC.

Connect with us:

http://www.meetup.com/integral-evolutionary-tantra/

http://integralevolutionarytantra.com/

results.description:
With PonyCon out of the way, now seems as good a time as any to follow it up with a movie meet-up! :D

A lot of group members have expressed interest in the upcoming Disney movie Zootopia, coming out March 4. 

I am personally excited for this bec. it is going to be the first animal based animation Disney has made in a long time. The last animal based movie they made was 8 years ago with "Bolt" in 2008. Zootopia is looking to be a very good modernized animation, with throwbacks to the old classic cartoons that alot of us grew-up with back in the day. 

This looks to be Disney going back to their roots and doing exactly what Disney has traditionally done best - talking animal cartoons. 


AMC Village 7 is the NEW chosen venue.  

I just double checked google.  The Regal Union Square movie theater will not be featuring Zootopia on March 5. Instead, I have chosen AMC Village 7 movie theater, which is still in the general area of Union Square and is only 3 blocks down from Regal. 

AMC Village 7 is at 3rd Ave at the corner of 11th st.


UPDATE: In coordination with the Trotting Crusaders of NYC meet-up, we will be taking the 7pm show time for March 5.

This is part of Bit Gamer's duel fun package extravaganza! Anyone who joins the Crusader meet-up will also have plenty of time to be able to join the movie meet-up in the evening. 


https://www.amctheatres.com/movie-theatres/new-york-city/amc-village-7

March 5 was chosen as the date bec. a monthly meet-up is being planned for the 12th.

The movie is 1 hour and 48 minutes long. 

We will all get together at the main entrance. If you plan on getting your ticket in the theater, please come early to account for the time it takes to purchase a ticket. 


After the movie, we can always find a place to eat and hang out around there also.

IMPORTANT (NOTES ON SEATING AND RESERVATIONS):

In order for us to organize to sit as close together as possible, you can order and reserve a seat for the theater in the website below.

https://www.amctheatres.com/movies/zootopia#[masked]


Make sure to select "reserved seating" in the scroll down menu after selecting the correct date.

You can view the seating arrangements after selecting the correct date and time on the right hand panel. When selecting ticket prices, you should see a magnifying glass image with the words "view seats" beside it. Click it and it will show you a layout of the theater and the available seats.  

I will be reserving seat "D9". So you guys can make your reservations in the seats around me and general vicinity of D9.

You select your desired seat at the checkout.

The sooner you can get your tickets the better. Get them before they are taken by someone else! :D
results.name: Movie Meet-up for Zootopia (2016)

results.description:
Please be 100% committed to attending if you RSVP.

In the comment section please let us know if you will bring something savory or sweet so that we don't end up with nine courses of dessert!

Since these are always so much fun let's do it again. Since I don't have as much table space in my new apartment three people will be able to sit in chairs at the table, and I have space for six to sit on pillows Asian style around the coffee table. If you are adamant about not sitting on the floor please let me know in advance.

For those of you who are unfamiliar with dining in the dark: dark dining takes away your sense of sight so your forced to use your other senses,  creating a uniquely different dining experience.

How this event will work:

1. While I wish we could keep our apartment pitch black that will probably result in a lot of broken items, so we will give everyone a blindfold and trust you guys not to  peek! (Blindfolds will be provided but feel free to bring your own).

2.  If you wish to drink with us please contribute a bottle of wine or a cocktails (what is a party without it!).

3. Everyone will bring a prepared dish to this party. You can make whatever you want, but we encourage you to bring something with a combination of flavors that people usually would not think to combine.

We will not reveal what we made until the end of the dinner. If you have dietary restrictions please let us know so that you will not be served anything that you can not eat.

At the last dining in the dark dinner party we learned that 8 courses is a lot of food! Please prepare so that there is only a tapas size portion for every one. It is more than enough. Also make sure to come hungry!

4. Everyone will be a server once. We will serve everyone's dish one at a time. When it is time to  serve  your dish you will remove your blindfold and serve everyone.

The fine print:

Cancellations: Please be 100% committed to attending this event, and cancel 48 hours in advance. There is limited space and each member puts in a lot of time, effort, and planning into each of these events. Late cancellations affect the group as a whole. If you cancel with less than 48 hours notice, or are a no show you could be removed from the group.Additionally if you regularly RSVP yes to events to hold a spot and then cancel you will also be removed from the group.

*I have a small 7lb Yorkie Poo named pepper. He is hypoallergenic and super friendly. If you have a problem with dogs please refrain from attending this event.
results.how_to_find_us: Additional Details will be sent to those attending
results.name: Dining in the Dark Take 5

results.description:
Music Makers “Reserved”  jam sessions are a unique opportunity to get together for the enjoyment of playing music in a group setting.  We offer 5 to 7 jam room, each with a playing level, style of music and a Music Makers Jam Coordinator leading the way.  Each jam session accommodates 1 to 2 vocals, 3 guitars, 1 keyboard player, 1 bass, 1 drummer, percussion, miscellaneous wind instruments.  Jam sessions can include a combination of some or all of the listed instruments.  Every jam room has a limited number of participants, your slot is guaranteed, no instrument rotation therefore advance registration is required. If you'd like to register you can do so via our website, please click here for registration.

Music Makers extensive library of easy to follow charts make it easy for all level players to participate. Please click here to view a list of some of the songs you will find in our library.  You do not need to read music to participate in our jams .

Our jams are held in our professionally equipped studios conveniently located around the corner from Madison Square Garden at 251 West 30th Street, 3rd floor, Suite 3rw (btwn 7th & 8th Ave).   Please visit our website to learn about all of our events for recreational musicians.   Should you have any questions, please feel free to email [masked] or give us a call at[masked]-7054.

We welcome you to come join us.
results.how_to_find_us: 251 West 30th Street, 3rd floor, Suite 3RW, (btwn 7th & 8th Ave)
results.name: Rock & Blues Reserved Jam Sessions

results.description:
QUEBEC TRADITIONAL SUPERGROUP "DE TEMPS ANTAN"
DANCE & CONCERT
SATURDAY, MARCH 5

DANCE INSTRUCTIONAL SESSION - DAVE HARVEY  7-7:50 PM
DANCE & CONCERT - DE TEMPS ANTAN  8-9:45 PM

Hello Folks!  

Next Saturday, March 5, the fabulous Quebec traditional music trio, De Temps Antan, will be performing in NYC. They are well-known among fans of French-Canadian music, and their fiddler, André Brunet, in addition to being a leading exponent of Quebecois fiddling, is a veteran of the NYC Barn Dance in its early days at the Hungarian House.

I will be teaching Quebec square dances from 7-7:50 pm, preceding the band's performance, followed by the band's performance from 8:00 until 9:45.  The venue is strongly encouraging dancing during the event itself, so I will spend most of the time on the dance floor leading dances off-microphone.  The band plays a mix of dance tunes and songs, so the event will be a dance/concert mix.  Like the dances taught at NYC Barn Dance, the dances will be easy to learn, and, for those who have come to the barn dance, many figures and dances are similar to those we do there.

The tickets are very reasonably priced for this event at $14.80 general admission / $12 student/member (service fee included!) when using the discount code "ART20" provided to us by the venue (a 20% discount!) and purchasing online at the link below.

We are also fortunate that the event is being held at the beautiful Town Hall theater in Flushing.  It is a gorgeous space and we would love to have more traditional dance events there! (It is only 45 minutes door-to-door from Grand Central via the 7 train). 

More info HERE or see the publicity below!

PURCHASE TICKETS HERE!

NYCBarnDance.com
NYC Barn Dance on Facebook
results.name: SPECIAL EVENT!  QUEBEC TRADITIONAL MUSIC DANCE & CONCERT

results.description:
Hi Ladies!
I'm hosting a DIY Product Making Party. I've done this once or twice and it was so fun! We will be making body products (think lotions, toothpaste, face cream, conditioner, shaving cream, etc...) and a few simple but effective home cleaning products.
The easiest way to do this is for me to buy a majority of the ingredients and containers and simply charge everyone around $20 when they come. That being said, feel free to bring anything else we can use! Essential oils, carrier oils (avocado, castor, fruit, anything), containers, coloring for cosmetics or henna, etc.... I don't have anything set in stone so feel free to post recipes you want to make! I'll be odering everything a few days before. Bring wine And food! We can do bloody Marys if everyone is down.
results.name: DIY Product Making Party at Olivia's!

results.description:
Hello everyone, I am a member of this meetup and want to share with the other members an wonderful event of traditional Quebec music and participatory dance taking place this weekend, Saturday, March 5, at Flushing Town Hall. I will be providing instruction in basic Quebec square dance from 7-7:50, and the concert/dance will run from 8-9:45, with me leading dances from the floor as the band plays songs and dance tunes. The band is De Temps Antan, a fabulous trio, that has traveled far and wide sharing their energy and enthusiasm for the French culture of Canada. The cost is under $15 with the discount code ART20. Click on the link below to see more details about this event and to buy tickets, or go directly to the Flushing Town Hall website. The meetup event is sponsored by NYC Barn Dance on behalf of the music venue.

http://www.meetup.com/squaredance-4/events/229136893/

results.description: Dean Sluyter (www.deansluyter.com) -- author of *Natural Meditation *and other books -- will lead a meditation and kirtan at Neolyth, a spiritual center and event space in Montclair. Dean has taught natural methods of meditation since 1970 and given talks, workshops, and retreats throughout the United States and beyond -- from Ivy League colleges to maximum-security prisons. The evening will include natural meditation practice, discussion of the experience, and kirtan -- joyful devotional music making in which all are invited to participate.

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

The New York Social Network (NYSN) has been planning events in and around the city since 2004!  There is something to choose from almost every night and several options each weekend!  It can be hard to figure out which ones may be best for you, especially if you have never been out before.

If you are new to the group or a long time member, this is a fun night to meet others and find out what what we have planned in the coming months. NYSN founder Dave Cervini will be on hand with our staff to welcome all New Members and introduce you to our long time members.  You will enjoy drink specials,  complimentary hot and cold appetizers and lot's of room to socialize network and connect.

This will also be a great opportunity to see what we have in store for 2016.

The World Bar is a nice lounge with lot's of room to sit or wander around while meeting others.

Other Meet Up and Social Networking groups/organizations often invite their members so you also get to network with people from similar groups.

The night will include:

- Complimentary hot and cold appetizers until 9pm

- Drink specials until 9pm

- Music played at conversational levels

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending tend to come on their own.

What to expect: 60-80 people fairly even split of men and women ages 20's -40's, singles and some couples. Most are there to network and connect.

What to wear: trendy, neat, business casual

How do I get there? take any of the green line trains to 42nd Grand Central or 51st street. Then a short walk towards the East River

How long does it go? We usually start breaking up around 11:30-Midnight

General Admission is $5.00. Please bring exact change at the door.

Once again, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: New and Existing Members Welcome Party

If you are new to the group or a long time member, this is a fun night to meet others and find out what what we have planned in the coming months. NYSN founder Dave Cervini will be on hand with our staff to welcome all New Members and introduce you to our long time members.  You will enjoy drink specials,  complimentary hot and cold appetizers and lot's of room to socialize network and connect.

This will also be a great opportunity to see what we have in store for 2016.

The World Bar is a nice lounge with lot's of room to sit or wander around while meeting others.

Other Meet Up and Social Networking groups/organizations often invite their members so you also get to network with people from similar groups.

The night will include:

- Complimentary hot and cold appetizers until 9pm

- Drink specials until 9pm

- Music played at conversational levels

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending tend to come on their own.

What to expect: 60-80 people fairly even split of men and women ages 20's -40's, singles and some couples. Most are there to network and connect.

What to wear: trendy, neat, business casual

How do I get there? take any of the green line trains to 42nd Grand Central or 51st street. Then a short walk towards the East River

How long does it go? We usually start breaking up around 11:30-Midnight

General Admission is $5.00. Please bring exact change to the door.

Once again, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.description:
Interested in speed dating on a Saturday Night? This event Saturday night is for men and women at The Wheeltapper Pub.  

At present we need men and mainly men (aged 35 to 45 although there's a little flexibility in the age range). Also don't worry if only a few people sign up on the Meetup as people will be attending from different sources.  

Grab friends and come along to The Wheeltapper Pub to meet other energetic NYC singles, and pick out those you feel a connection with and would like to meet again. This promises to be a lot of fun, so you're highly encouraged to come down. To get your spot, you must:

(a) RSVP on the MeetUp site

(b) please also e-mail me directly at

<a>[masked]</a> to say you want to come and kindly give your age and first name.

As this is a speed-dating event, and the balance of men and women is very important, I will need to correspond with you briefly by e-mail to confirm your attendance.  Please note that you are only confirmed once you get a reply from me (i.e. from [masked]) ; also tickets are free for a limited time but at anytime you can register at the New York EasyDates website for $25 with promo code MEETUP-25.  

If you're looking for more details about this event, please visit the New York EasyDates website. Hope you can make it!

Regards, 

Daniel

Doors open at 7:30pm.

results.description: Beginners' workshop starts at 7:30; the dance begins at 8 PM. This evening's dance is sponsored by Bob Isaacs to celebrate his 60th birthday. Admission is free and dancers of all experience levels are welcomed. Bob's former calling students will call the dances to music by Nor'easter: Cedar Stanistreet on fiddle, Max Newman on mandolin & guitar, and Julie Vallimont on piano & accordion. Donations are encouraged to support Swingin' Tern.

We are teaming up with The Salsa Latin & Ballroom Dance Group (and 6 other Meetup groups) to bring you a night of spicy salsa dancing!

Doors open at 7:30 PM. Dance lesson begins at 8 PM. The DJ will play Latin music at first, then mix in Top 40 later on. Stay as little or as long as you like. There will be lots of people attending, so you’re sure to have a good time.

****Please note: I cannot salsa. It takes a lot for me to even get on the dance floor. So if you can't either, please don't let that stop you from coming. There will be a dance lesson and plenty of great company. We'll figure it out together :)

* Reserved Section By The Dance Floor

* Drink & Food Specials
* Salsa Lesson At 8 PM Provided By 46 Lounge
* Reduced Cover Price for Meetup Members (Only $5 until 10 PM!)

* Tons of drink specials

We will have red balloons & Meetup signs so you can find us!

results.name: Saturday Night Volleyball

results.description:
Let's get together to celebrate the Leap Year of 2016 (1 week late) at Al & Phil's lovely home in Maplewood! After all, we won't see another year with 366 days for 4 more years!

To help leap into the leap year, we are asking each guest to bring:

1. The beverage of their choice (We will provide vodka--my beverage of choice.) :-)

2. A small side/munchy for the group. Chips or salads are always a good choice--lettuce, bean, pasta... or a sweet dessert.

Phil & Al will be serving sandwiches for our delight.

NOTE: A poker game among some guests may ensue if our veteran players attend. Please come prepared, if interested in participating ($10 buy-in).
results.name: Leap Year Festivities

results.description:
Looking to meet new people in a friendly and casual environment? Join us for this private multi-group social for all new and existing members.

Forget about overcrowded bars, long lines to get in and people with attitudes. This will be one of the most friendliest and social Meetups you'll experience!

We will have our staff there to welcome all members and help introduce you to each other. It's a fun and laid back event that creates the perfect opportunity to make new friends.

*PREPAY ONLY EVENT (TICKETS WILL NOT BE SOLD AT DOOR) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/37/dates/Mar-05-2016_at_0800PM

What to expect:

• Complimentary Hot & Cold Appetizers (8-9pm)

• Drink Specials (8-9pm)

• Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling

• Socialize, Network & Connect With Other Members

PREPAY ONLY AT THIS LINK (1st 10 tickets are $10):  https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/37/dates/Mar-05-2016_at_0800PM

No tickets sold at door (Price goes to $20 as event gets closer) 

Can I come alone? Yes, about 80% attend on their own. 

Why does your RSVP say +50? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We will actually have 75+ members attending! 

Is this age/ethnic specific? No. We'll have a wide range of ages attending. All are welcome 21+. 

How should I dress? Neat casual. No sweats, hats, etc. Jeans ok 

*How do I attend? RSVP w/ group and purchase ticket here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/37/dates/Mar-05-2016_at_0800PM
results.how_to_find_us: Private for members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided

results.description:
Single? New in town? Just looking to get out and meet new people?

Join us for our multi-group member happy hour! ATWYS along with New York Social Network organizes a monthly Saturday night get together for all of our new and existing members.

If you are new to our Meteup group or a long time member, this is a fun night to meet others and find out what what we have planned in the coming months. Event Host, New York Social Network  founder Dave Cervini will be on hand with our staff to welcome all New Members and introduce you to our long time members.  You will enjoy drink specials,  complimentary hot and cold appetizers and lot's of room to socialize network and connect.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off a speeddating event as well as $5 off our Dec 12 Mix & Mingle Happy Hour. Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.

$10 in advance only

Prepay here: http://atwys2013member.eventbrite.com/

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


The night will include:

-complimentary hot and cold appetizers until 9pm

-Drink specials until 9pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending tend to come on their own.

What to expect: 60-80 people fairly even split of men and women ages 20's -40's, singles and some couples. Most are there to network and connect. 

What to wear: trendy, neat, business casual

How do I get there? take any of the green line trains to 42nd Grand Central or 51st street. Then a short walk towards the East River

How long does it go?  We usually start breaking up around 12:30-1am.
results.name: Private Member Happy Hour - Ages 21-50

group.name: ...And That's Why You're Single Speed Dating Parties

results.description:
TIX ARE 37-80 BUCKS

i'm in section 205 seats 1 and 2 those tix are 69.0

level above stage right section on map,


____________________________________________________________________


CineConcerts, CBS Consumer Products and Paramount Pictures will launch

Star Trek: The Ultimate Voyage

,

a North American concert tour playing performing artscenters in more than 100 cities. The tour will make a stop at

The Theater at Madison Square Garden

on

March 5, 2016

. Show time is 8:00pm.

Star Trek: The Ultimate Voyage is produced by CineConcerts, known for its popular live to projection, symphonic concert experiences including The Godfather, Gladiator and soon to be premiered Breakfast at Tiffany’s.  Original content productions such as A Christmas Dream also tour internationally.


Justin Freer, Producer and Founder of CineConcerts said, “The Star Trek franchise has for many years been an important and meaningful part of our culture in so many ways. This exciting concert experience featuring the greatest music and visuals spanning five decades will be an extraordinary and memorable event.”


This lavish production includes an impressive live symphony orchestra and international special solo instruments. People of all ages and backgrounds will experience the franchise’s groundbreaking and wildly popular musical achievements whilethe most iconic Star Trek film and TV footage is simultaneously beamed in high definition to a 40-foot wide screen. The concert will feature some of the greatest music written for the franchise including music from Star Trek:The Original Series,Star Trek: The Motion Picture, Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan, Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home, Star Trek: Insurrection, Star Trek: The Next Generation, Star Trek: Deep Space Nine, Star Trek: Voyagerand much more.This never-before-seen concert event is perfect formusic lovers, filmgoers, science-fiction fans and anyone looking for an exciting and unique concert experience.


CineConcerts Co-Founder and Producer Brady Beaubien said, “When a story has renamed aircraft carriers, NASA space shuttles, and the first names of thousands of children in hundreds of countries, you realize these characters go beyond entertainment, but are more like family. Star Trek breaks every boundary of judgment or expectation. It inspires, challenges, and re-thinks. Star Trek is who we want to be.
results.name: TREK MUSIC CONCERT!

results.description:
Step back in time to the reign of famed Tudor monarchs like Henry VIII, and Elizabeth I, as England broke away from the Roman Catholic Church, Shakespeare composed his sonnets, and explorers like Sir Walter Raleigh began the conquest of the New World.

Diners can expect dazzling dishes from the tables of Hampton Court like Cockentrice, a stuffed suckling pig joined with a roast turkey to represent a mythical beast. Also on the menu, traditional mince meat pie and wine poached pears with spices sourced from the depths of the enchanted East. Expect stories of court life, love and murder, tales of Elizabethan London and what it was really like to work in a Medieval kitchen.

Check out this awesome article about it in Edible Brooklyn:

http://www.ediblebrooklyn.com/2016/edible-history-tudor-feast-bushwick/

THIS IS A TICKETED EVENT
Price is $130.00 which includes wine and may be purchased here:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/a-tudor-feast-tickets-20951485457

results.description:
Let's wander off to the Metropolitan Opera in New York to see the iconic Giacomo  Puccini's Madama Butterfly. The opera takes place in the Japanese port city of Nagasaki at the turn of the last century, at a time of expanding American international presence. Japan was hesitantly defining its global role, and Nagasaki was one of the country’s few ports open to foreign ships. Temporary marriages for foreign sailors were not unusual.


Anthony Minghella's breathtaking production has thrilled audiences ever since its premiere in 2006. Kristine Opolais reprises her acclaimed portrayal of the title role, opposite Roberto Alagna as Pinkerton, the naval officer who breaks Butterfly's heart. Hei-Kyung Hong, Roberto De Biasio, and Gwyn Hughes Jones star in a second set of performances. Karel Mark Chichon conducts.

We are co-hosting this event with the  Central Jersey Lovers of All Things Italian! What Italian doesn't love an opera! I know many of our wanderers are members of both meetups (including myself). You do not need to signup for both meetups. Either one will do. 

TO RESERVE YOUR PLACE:

Everyone will be on the wait-list until I receive your payment for the ticket.  When payment is received, you will  be placed on the YES list. I have secured fabulous prime balcony seats at a wonderful group rate of $78.50 which includes the service fee.  I have to pay for the tickets by January 12th so I will only be accepting payments for the tickets until January 12th. After that date this meetup will be closed. 

 Tickets:  Tickets are $78.50.  You can either mail me a check (message me and I'll send you my mailing address) or you can use PAYPAL. You can PAYPAL me as a family or friend to [masked] no later than January 12th!

DINNER

For those of you who would like to join me for dinner prior to the Opera I will be making dinner reservations at Lincoln Ristorante which is located in Lincoln Center. Of course we need do dine at a fabulous Italian restaurant prior to a Puccini opera. You can check out there menu here: https://www.patinagroup.com/lincoln-ristorante/menu#Dinner

If you would like to join us for dinner please let me know ASAP. I will be making reservations for dinner by January 17th!
<a href="http://www.benoitny.com/sites/default/files/menus_pdf/BBNY%20-%20lunch%20%26%20dinner%20menu%20%28truffle%29%20102615%20WEB%20Dinner.pdf"></a>

I'm looking forward to sharing this very special day with you in NYC!

The 2016 election is coming up and we already know that many of you won't vote "simply out of principle" but you know what, we think that voting is important if change will ever be made. We've endorsed the only candidate committed to end the war on drugs Senator Bernie Sanders and several of his supporters will be on hand. We will have voter registration forms for those of you who are not registered to vote. We will not be pressuring anyone to vote for Bernie, but we will have forms on hand for those who are interested in being registered to vote in the upcoming Presidential election!

Our advocacy event will feature tremendous performances from Dj No Request! Also performing...

None other than NYC's finest Psychedelic Rock band The UCM Trio!

In addition we will have DJ No Request on hand, cutting it up on the 1 and 2's!

We will have several impressive speakers featuring Mr. Rob Robinson the founder of the Damn Sam upstate NY harvest festival, 19 years in the making!

Also on hand will be Vanessa Maria Director of the East Coast Cannabis Coalition!

And last but certainly not least CEO of Whiskers Holistic Petcare, disabled Veteran, and medical cannabis patient for over 50 years Philip Klein will treat us to a talk on the impact cannabis has had on him as a patient and an advocate.

 Doors open at 9:15, event begins at 9:30pm. Please do not come before 9:15pm, wait outside the building if you come early.

To submit as a speaker or performer please contact [masked]

DJs will be SSC resident Phast Phreddie the Boogaloo Omnibus and special guests Gene Merideth (Scooters Originali) and Sheila B (WFMU’s “Sophisticated Boom Boom”) who will be spinning vintage, vinyl 45s to keep you dancing all night! {more info below - scroll down}


THE SUBWAY SOUL CLUB has been New York City's premier sixties soul dance club since 2001. The event will take place at Lucille's Bar & Grill, located at the celebrated B.B.Kings Blues Club, known for live performances of such soul greats as Aretha Franklin, Darlene Love and James Brown. Of course it wouldn't be SUBWAY SOUL if we didn't have a gorgeous wooden dance floor and groovy Sixties big-screen projections. Lucille's also offers ample comfortable seating so you can dine on Lucille's tasty soul food before you dance to fabulous soul music! So get your dancing shoes on and join THE SUBWAY SOUL CLUB on the dance floor at Lucille's Bar & Grill at BB King's Blues Club, presented in conjunction with the good people at CAVESTOMP who have kindly swung it for us to have some discounted drinks specials eclusively for our lovely people !

results.description:
GREAT NEWS: $69 Super Early Birds for March Madness. 

FREE PARKING at nearby municipal parking lot at Queens bus stop and FREE street parking near Manhattan bus stop on SUNDAY. $2 daily parking at the parking garage at New Jersey bus stop on SUNDAY.

We will return to our favor mountain - Hunter Mountain. It is closer, and has more and better trails. "As the Catskills' premier winter destination, Hunter Mountain celebrates renowned terrain, award-winning facilities and luxury mountainside accommodations together creating a smile on any snow lover's face! Discover Hunter's impressive array of mountainside amenities, including lodging at the Liftside Condominiums and the new four seasons, slopeside Katskill Mountain Club, plus a dozen unique mountain eateries speckled throughout the resort, two full service retail stores and plenty of programs for adults, children, and families."


*** Trip plan email via Eventbrite will be sent out 2 to 3 days before the event providing the details. ***


Date: March 6th, 2016 Sunday. Please arrive 30 minutes earlier. 


Depart 5:45 AM from Queens: (Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel)[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Map)


Depart 6:30 AM from NYC: (Garden City Deli) Northwest corner of 43rd St & 9th Ave New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Depart 7:10 AM from NJ: (NJ Transit Ramsey Route 17 - In front of parking garage entrance) 1 Spring St, Ramsey, NJ 07446 (Map) $2 daily parking at the parking garage on a weekend day.


Return: Depart from Hunter at 4:30 PM and expect to arrive at NJ at 6:45 PM, NYC at 7:30 PM & Queens at 8:00 PM.

Cost: Includes all mountain lift ticket + round trip bus transportation - This is $27 to $30 off comparing to other bus tours.
* Super Early birds $69 for first 10 spots
* Early birds $79 for first 20 spots
* Regular $89 for last 20 spots.


Additional Cost:
* $30 to upgrade lift ticket to Beginner Package which include lower-mountain lift ticket, rental (skis or snowboard) & group lesson.
* $39 for Ski or Snowboard Rental Package. Ski Rental Package includes skis, boots, poles & helmet; Snowboard Rental Package includes snowboard, boots & helmet.

Maximum: 55

Transportation: Bus is included.

Buy Ticket Here: http://mar062016hunter.eventbrite.com You can also Chase Quickpay me at [masked] to avoid transaction fee. (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) When Quickpaying, please indicate your boarding location and cell #. Your spot is NOT confirmed unless your payment is received 

Refund Policy: 


* Full refund minus $20 processing fee if cancelled 14 days in advance.
* 50% refund if cancelled 7 days in advance. 
* Afterward, no refund for cancellation or no show.
*100% refund if the event is cancelled.


What to Wear & Other Info: Click this link for more info.

Check out more at http://www.huntermtn.com/

Group Ski/Snowboard Video: http://youtu.be/CLV84xRXANQ

http://youtu.be/CLV84xRXANQ

Meetup: http://www.nyskiclub.com/events

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul
