results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8, no subs. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.
results.name: Sunday at McLaughlin park 8:00 AM

results.description:
NEW CLASS STARTS TODAY

http://1877scubausa.com/images/pop

Check out the Pay One Price Option

This is pool session one for new students starting their diving course.

Your Journey to Adventure starts today. After a brief presentation we will gear up and get started in the pool.

If you have not yet enrolled, please contact the Dive Center to get started [masked]

RSVP required

New Students, If this is your first pool session, you must: 
1. Complete the required academics before the pool session;

Online Students must complete Chapters 1 -6

CD Rom students must complete Sections 1-5

2. Bring a bathing suit and a towel. There are lockers in the changing room so bring a lock if you like.

3. Drink plenty of water before class

4. Don't forget to print out and bring your skills checklist.

5. Print out a copy of the Hand Signals to review and bring with you.

6. If you have not yet completed a "Student Folder" at the store.  Please print out, complete and bring the following three forms to the pool;

1. SDI General Liability Waiver Fill in ALL the blanks:

"Instructors": Kelley Scharf, Andre R.

"Facility": 1-877-SCUBA-USA",

"Agency" : SDI" 

Others": Pablo M. Jay K.

Sign and date at bottom

2. SDI Medical Info Waiver "Instructor": F. Ventura,  "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA ,"City of" Paramus "state of" N.J.

3. Student Information Form</a>

If you have answered YES to any of the medical question; Please print out and have your MD complete the following <a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/SDI_Physician_Sign_Off_2013.pdf">Physician Sign-Off Form

What equipment is required?

A mask, snorkel, fins and a weight belt suitable for SCUBA* and dive boots. A wetsuit is optional and recommended. We have special pricing for our students. Let us know when you would like to come in to be fitted for your student equipment package. Most important is that you will get the "Right Gear, the Right Fit at the Right Price" *Note: Snorkeling equipment is not always suitable for SCUBA activities.

Please arrive on time, late arrivals are subject to rescheduling and fees.

If you have any questions please email or call the shop

results.description:
Thanks to the amazing turn out last week. Couldn't have been better! Awesome weather, no drama games, and the majority of the games were very close.

It will be colder this Sunday, probably in the 40's with some potential snow. If you can't handle it then please don't RSVP unless you are sure you will show up! If you're a warrior then come join us.

Yours truly,

Miketator

***************

 
Attendance will be strictly enforced. No-shows will be marked and posted on the subsequent meetup. First time offenders will be given the benefit of doubt, second time offenders will be warned (consider your name in this email and the number of times you no-showed as warning) and those who miss a third time will be banned,permanently! Those that show up without RSVP to circumvent this will be warned as well. We need to know how many people will show up in order to decide if we have enough people for a game that week.

All new members are allowed to play for free the first three games. If you decide to continue with us then please remit the membership fee. Our season starts on 9/1 and the $10 is good for all games for the year.

By attending our games you agree to assume any and all risks involved in these games.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Information


Come enjoy a nice hike along the Long Path (section 12) on a stroll through the Basha Kill and Wurtsboro Ridge. Full details of the Long Path can be seen by clicking HERE


Parking Locations

We will meet at Ferguson Road (still called Roosa Gap Summitville Road on some maps), 0.7 miles west of Shawanga Lodge Road). There is limited parking just to the west of the trail crossing. [masked]°, [masked]°)

We will then shuttle to the start at the DEC boat launch parking area. [masked]°, [masked]°)

Trail Maps


http://nynjtc.org/files/ShawangunkRidgeTrail-Map2_2013.pdf 

http://nynjtc.org/files/ShawangunkRidgeTrail-Map3_2013.pdf


Description


This will be a moderately-paced hike, aimed at about 2.5 mph, with time to stop for photos along the way. Be sure to bring plenty of water, and either lunch or snacks as needed. Well-behaved trail dogs welcome, as I will likely be bringing my super-friendly German shepherd.

*** While I'm no speed-burner, because this is a traverse with a shuttle, please know your hiking speed. Hiking at 2.5 is an overall average, which means more like 3 mph on flat ground. I hope to be done in less than 4 hours, but I put 5 to account for shuttle times and "worst case" scheduling.

This section starts along the Basha Kill Rail Trail. The trail follows the abandoned "Kingston Line" of the New York, Ontario & Western (O&W) Railroad. While the walk along the Basha Kill is straight and level, it is a wonderful area, with many fine views across the Basha Kill, one of the largest wetlands in southern New York. After leaving the Basha Kill the trail follows roads for about 2 miles through the Village of Wurtsboro on its way to the Wurtsboro Ridge. Upon leaving Old Route 17 (Sullivan County Route 171), the Long Path quickly gains the ridgetop. This ridgetop trail section is one of the most dramatic in southern New York, with many spectacular views in all directions. 


HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER

Waiver of liability

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader- This is YOUR hike.

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

90min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank

Whether you want to play competitively, hit around, or even just check out the hot guys and girls, you've come to the right place. I will try to host the badminton events on bi-weekly basis in order to provide you with an badminton experience where you can get your daily exercise in, improve at the game of badminton, and socialize with other fellow badminton-ers, all at the same time!

After the badminton event, we will have lunch together at Flushing.


To have a good play experience, we will put a cap of  8 on the attendee.
Please only RSVP when you are sure you will show up.

Sport cloth and sneaker.

Badminton racquets and birdies, bottles of water, towel and clothes to change.

New York Badminton Center,[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 ( enter 34th Ave from College Point Blvd )
New York Badminton Center (NYBC) is designated badminton facility with 6 international tournament standard Badminton floor mats on top of 3″ high wood floor elevation for maximum shock absorbing and pressure reduction to knees and ankles.  Center also equipped with Table Tennis, Weights room, kids room, and spacious resting area, large bathrooms. Center opens 7 days all year around. It offers the convenience for players to play on any of the days they prefer. Center is close to public transportation (about 10 mins walking), street parking is also available.   

For more info about NY Badminton Center, check the link in the reference section below.

results.description:
This run starts at the "Wild Duck Pond" area of the Saddle River County Park in Ridgewood. We will start at the beginning of the mile markers which is near the exit, not near the entrance. There's parking close to the beginning of the path. If you cannot park in the lot nearest the beginning of the path, you'll need to reenter the park and park in the next closest lot. The driving area of the park is U-shaped so to get to the parking lot closest to the start of the run, you essentially drive around the "U" and approach the exit to the last lot on the right (by the dog park).


We will start at the "Wild Duck Pond Area" and will turn around at the 2 mile marker. If you'd like to run more or less, you are certainly welcome to do so as the mile markers make it simple to track your distance. If you wish to run at a slower pace, I am more than happy to run with you at your preferred pace. Nobody gets left in the dust. This is a fun run, not a competition.

If you RSVP "Yes", please do your best to be on time. With the cold weather, we will get rolling on time so that our runners don't get too cold waiting for others to show. 

If you have questions, comments, or doubts, feel free to email me.

results.description:
“…to be successful in life you need values, you need integrity, you need a vision, you need energy, and you need dynamism. And spirituality is the one thing that gives it all to you. If you are healthy, you can see better, you can eat better, you can speak better, you can hear better and you can run better. All this depends on just one thing. Similarly that which enriches your spirit is so essential to enrich all other aspects of life.” -Sri Sri Ravi Shankar, Founder, Art of Living Foundation

Whatever we do in life, it is all directed towards being happy. Why do we even do some service to somebody? It is because it gives some happiness to us. So anything we do in our life is directed towards achieving happiness, greater happiness, and even greater happiness. That’s how the mind goes. Yet, are we happy? Yes, some times. But often not!

This free seminar examines what comes in the way of our happiness. There will be a discussion on tools that can lead us to happiness – tools that every human being is privileged to learn and use. Come, relax, refresh and smile.

results.description:
MEET EVENT LEADER: Marcia Sheldon (leader change)
Meet at 10 AM at Trailside Nature Center parking lot on Coles Ave. A 4+ mile hike at a moderate pace. Rough terrain due to some ground erosion. Boots required. Traction devices also required if there is snow or ice on the ground. Watch this site on the morning of March 6 for last minute changes/cancellations. Please bring water and a snack.
If this is your third meetup event with TSR we kindly ask that you join the club for $15 yearly membership with full access to our schedule which allows you to attend hikes and other outings 6 days a week. As a dues paying member of TSR you do not need to sign up for events and you do not have to be entered onto a waiting list. You can attend all events. Visit our website at tsr.nynjtc.org for an application and schedule preview.
DIRECTIONS:
WATCHUNG RESERVATION, Mountainside ,NJ
1. Trailside Nature Center, Coordinates: N40° 40.97', W74° 22.38'
1.1. FROM LIVINGSTON: Take John F. Kennedy Parkway past the Short Hills Mall keep left, following signs
to SUMMIT and River Rd. Proceed 0.5 miles at light by Novartis, turn left onto Morris Ave. Continue 1.9 miles past Overlook Hospital as road bends to left. After passing the hospital, take the first right onto Glenside Ave. then in 0.1 miles bear left onto Baltusrol Rd (signs says US 22) road name changes to Summit Rd. After 1.1 miles, at light, turn right onto Summit Lane. At traffic circle, take the second right and proceed 0.5 miles further to a right turn onto New Providence Rd. Parking lot is on the right.
1.2. ALTERNATIVE: VIA US ROUTE 22: Take Mountainside/New Providence Rd. exit (turn right from westbound lanes; jug-handle from eastbound lanes). Proceed uphill northwest bound for 0.7 miles (name changes to Deer Path) to the 5th right onto Ackerman Ave. In 0.4 miles at Tee intersection, turn right onto Coles Ave. Proceed 0.2 miles to Trailside Nature & Science Center parking lot on the left.
1.3. ALTERNATIVE: VIA I-78 EAST: Take Exit 44 (New Providence/Berkeley Heights). At light turn left onto Glenside Ave. Go 1.3 miles and turn right into the Watchung Reservation (CR 645 - W.R. Tracey Dr). Proceed past Lake Surprise, uphill and straight past loop picnic area. Bear left and continue 1.3 miles to traffic circle. At traffic circle take the first right and proceed 0.5 mile on Summit Lane. Turn right onto New Providence Rd. Parking lot is on the right.

NON-COMPETITIVE CO-ED SOCCER GAMES @RIVERSIDE PARK

                                      Check our Facebook page:

                   facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer 

                             NO CLEATS OR PLASTIC STUDS ALLOWED

</a>

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nzhrn3ldY4U

GAME DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

Game Format:

We'll play three simultaneous games of 8 on 8, with small goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play three games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check our meetup message board on Saturday night or before 9:00 am on Sunday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

1-First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field!

2-Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

3-No power shots allowed.

4-If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

5-If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.


6-Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board on Saturday night or before 12:00 PM on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location:

Riverside Park at West 107 & 108 Street

Take the 1 RED Line Train to Cathedral Pkwy an walk two blocks down, to 108th Street and Riverside Dr.

The field is down the lower level near the river. You can easly access the field from 108th Street. Remember, the field is not visable from the street level, you have to walk down the stairs from Riverside Dr & 108th Street. and you will see the newly renovated fanced-in soccer field next to the river.

Call me if you can’t find the field - [masked] Manny S. 

What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes(No CLEATS), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.50 when you RSVP. This $9.50 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll head to Royale for brunch and a Pint or Two:

                                       <a href="http://www.yelp.com/biz/lions-head-tavern-new-york">Lion’s Head Tavern 

                                     995 Amsterdam Ave

                                      New York, NY 10025

results.description:
Another warm-up ride before the season of longer rides since weather will be colder and conditions may be a bit iffy!  Always nice to have the option to bail on subways if the weather turns sour.

So we have a bit of everything in this ride.  It's more of a social ride for the most part, but it's easy to zip ahead and meet back up with the group at the three major stopping points.   It's about 35 miles of street riding if you do the whole round trip except for the Kissena Velodrome and Prospect Park if anyone is up for a loop or two, add some mileage for that.  Sprinkled in there is a stop at the Jackson Hole diner that is right near Laguardia and a quick stop at Plane View park to watch the planes come in to land at Laguardia right over your head (that's pretty cool if you've never done it before, they come in one right after another).  After Prospect Park those who want can grab a beer!

 Here's a brief summary and an option or two for those who want to sleep in later or head right over to the Velodrome.

Starting at 10AM from Union Square we head uptown then into Queens and Ditmar Ave up to Jackson Hole Diner (about 10 miles only but better to eat before than after the ride!) for a late breakfast and some fuel for the Velodrome and ride home.  We probably won't get out of the diner until about 12:30.  So if you want to skip the food just get to the diner at 12:30 and you should be fine.  (Send a message at[masked], or leave a message here if you decide to do that)

After that we head over to the Plane View Park which is very close by and we'll check out the planes for about 15 minutes or so.

Then its 7 miles to the Kissena Velodrome (I can't guarantee it will be open and/or usable but I've been there a few times and it has always been and it's never been too busy).  You can use any kind of bike you want on it.  It's something you should really do at least once if you have a bike and you are in NY.  A lot of folks don't like it at all and others love it!  If you want to just head over to the Velodrome and then join us on the ride back figure you need to get there at about 1:30. (Send a message at[masked], or leave a message here if you decide to do that)

Then we head over to Prospect Park, for another 12 miles.  Anyone wanting to do a loop or two can, anyone wanting to grab a beer or two can.  At this point you can do one or two of anything I won't stop you.  It's another 6 miles back to Union Square but I sort of assume that folks will be heading off to different destinations at this point!

Here's the cue sheet of the roundtrip.

https://www.google.com/maps/dir/Union+Square,+Manhattan,+New+York,+NY/Jackson+Hole,+Queens,+NY/Kissena+Velodrome,+Flushing,+NY+11355/40.6729035,-73.9692888/Union+Square,+Manhattan,+New+York,+NY/@40.7276167,-73.9769927,12z/am=t/data=!3m1!4b1!4m67!4m66!1m10!1m1!1s0x89c259989e14aa8b:0xcd00afc9db20caa4!2m2!1d-73.9910835!2d40.7358633!3m4!1m2!1d-73.9166989!2d40.7803769!3s0x89c25f5c279ff7b9:0x394c3ec2a3f7d2d2!1m10!1m1!1s0x89c25f721c981d3f:0x9cf983b923fd8523!2m2!1d-73.899308!2d40.7675517!3m4!1m2!1d-73.8870563!2d40.7665238!3s0x89c25f9ddc075895:0x426c575bd5be5b9f!1m25!1m1!1s0x89c26045d3bd5c01:0xc45a1b166b2c4246!2m2!1d-73.809366!2d40.744725!3m4!1m2!1d-73.8144661!2d40.7424659!3s0x89c26043110d1b61:0x42e05a606498d2b6!3m4!1m2!1d-73.8147427!2d40.7362541!3s0x89c2605c3011b135:0x95a7154ae762e286!3m4!1m2!1d-73.8896036!2d40.7026026!3s0x89c25e80043a3b89:0x760e661470ea2c27!3m4!1m2!1d-73.9308895!2d40.697476!3s0x89c25c08b18b76b7:0x35f330bf9bcc6e5b!1m10!3m4!1m2!1d-73.9683572!2d40.6790543!3s0x89c25ba42cad1447:0x6b9a384ac392a541!3m4!1m2!1d-73.9977989!2d40.7068308!3s0x89c25a3aef3b0475:0xc68f41b0652af69a!1m5!1m1!1s0x89c259989e14aa8b:0xcd00afc9db20caa4!2m2!1d-73.9910835!2d40.7358633!3e1?hl=en

results.description:
Hiking, Waterfalls, Gold Mines, Fun in the sun!

We will hike into the trail, do some exploring rock hounding and searching for an old gold mine and bring back some Quartz rocks with gold in them. 

We are not legally allowed to dig or use a metal detector at this location. 

If you dont have a car, text me at[masked], we will try hook you up with a Driver

We will meet at the trail head at or around 10:00 am SUNDAY 3/6/16 call 

[masked] 

http://www.newtownforestassociation.org/Alstrailmap.html

***************************************************

Some Instructions at Bottom, SCROLL DOWN !

WE NEED DRIVERS !

YES< YOU CAN BRING YOUR FAMILY !

IT WILL BE A LITTLE COLD ! Bring a Gold Pan !

George

[masked]

********************************************************

Instructions

1

Choose a river or stream that has produced gold in the past. Look for a waterway that is fast-moving, featuring waterfalls and rapids.

2

Check the surrounding hills for signs of quartz and mineralization. Both gold and quartz begin their formation as veins inside large rocks. Remember that gold will be present only in a mineral-rich area.

Locate a section of the river that is deep enough to completely submerge your pan. Watch the strength of the current as well. You need a steady water flow that will move silt downstream, but not so rapid that it interferes with panning.

4

Find a promising spot by looking at the river's natural features. Large tree trunks, gravel bars, moss and bends in the river are prime locations for panning.

5

Work a few test pans from the spot you've chosen. Look for black sand as you pan; gold will not appear where there is no black sand. If you're not having any luck from the initial pans, move on and try another spot.

Read more: How to Locate a Spot to Pan for Gold | eHow.com http://www.ehow.com/how_11416314_locate-spot-pan-gold.html#ixzz2FhxHgOkY
results.name: Exploring an old Gold Mine  Day Trip to Connecticut

results.description:
A two hour timed, out & back run on the Palisades Park Long Path.

Where: South entrance of the GW bridge sidewalk on the Manhattan side.

When: 10 am

Trail Details: We'll run over the GW bridge, to the Palisades long path. Then we run for 1 hour, turn around and run back. How far is that? Depends on your pace and skill level. Total run time should be 2 hours. Perhaps a bit longer, if you are tired on the way back. Perhaps a bit less, if you conserve your energy on the way out. This a great time to build your aerobic base and keep your heart rate low. This is a mild trail, great for beginners. Keep in mind though, it does tend to get more technical the farther north you go. As always, we encourage all speeds to join, no matter how fast or slow. Can't run for two hours? No worries, simply turn around sooner and we'll see you back at Le Chéile.

Public Transit: Take the A train to 181sth Street. Le Chéile is Located on the corner of W 181st Street and Cabrini Blvd 2 blocks from the south entrance of the GW bridge sidewalk.

Bag Drop/Etc: We drop our bags at Le Chéile. After we are finished hitting the trails, we head back to Le Chéile, change out of our sweaty clothes and have eggs!

By Car: Put 839 West 181st Street, Ny 10033 in your GPS

Everyone must run! No brunch bombing allowed.

This is our indoor circuit Training session to prepare NJDBC members for the 16th Annual indoor paddle regatta competition on Saturday April 2nd 2016 as well as for the 2016 Dragon Boat season on water and any competitive regatta races from April to October.


The circuit training session will be conducted by our team captain Dave L. OPEN TO ANY GUY OR GAL in good physical condition who would be interested in paddling, meeting new people, and joining NJDBC.


Circuit training will include several workout stations such as burpees, weights, push-ups, planks, paddling, etc. A couple of the circuit stations will be a paddle machine. This will allow you to get a taste of paddling in a Dragon Boat, outrigger, or canoe! The workout will conclude with a fun 2000 meter Paddle Erg team relay race.


Please have a light breakfast well before the workout and bring a drink & towel. We will provide introductions and demonstrate proper form before we start.


We work hard together, paddle hard together, eat together, & have fun together!

Disclaimer:


Consult your physician before starting this or any other fitness program. You should be in good physical condition and be able to participate in exercise. Though we practice proper form, safety, and caution, you the user, will assume all risks of injury. If you engage in this exercise program, you agree that you do so at your own risk, are voluntarily participating in these activities, assume all risk of injury to yourself, and agree to release and discharge NJDBC and LPPOA from any and all claims or causes of action, negligence, known or unknown.

results.description:
Anthony van Dyck (1599–1641), фламандский живописец, один из самых значительных мастеров портрета.

van Dyck начал свое художественное образование в возрасте 10 лет в мастерской Hendrick van Balen, определившего направление фламандской живописи 17 века. В течении нескольких лет он был главным помощником Peter Paul Rubens, переняв его стиль и в чем то превзойдя своего учителя. Путешествуя и работая в Италии на его стиль оказали влияние работы Paolo Veronese и Titian. Великолепная техника живописи, личное обаяние и вращение в аристократических кругах помогли занять достойное место королевского художника Habsburg Governor of Flanders. Вершиной творчества художника стала работа при дворе английского короля Charles I, большого любителя и покровителя исскуства. Музей Frick представит Вашему вниманию около 100 работ , наиболее полную выставку знаменитого живописца в Америке за последние 20 лет.

Ваши знания живописи, замечания и дополнения будут очень полезны.

--------------------------------------------------------------------

Anthony van Dyck (1599–1641), one of the most celebrated and influential portraitists of all time, enjoyed an international career that took him from his native Flanders to Italy, France, and, ultimately, the court of Charles I in London

Lenders include the Palazzo Pitti in Florence, the Kunsthistorisches Museum in Vienna, the British Museum and National Gallery in London, the Prado Museum in Madrid, and major private collectors such as the Duke of Devonshire and the Duke of Buccleuch.

http://www.frick.org/exhibitions/van_dyck

--------------------------------------------------------------------

Directions:

1 East 70th Street

New York, NY 10021

---------

5 Ave & 70 St NY, NY

http://www.frick.org/visit

Transportation

Lexington Avenue Subway No. 6 local to 68th Street station. Buses M1 – M4 southbound on Fifth Avenue, northbound on Madison Avenue or crosstown M72 bus, eastbound to 72nd Street and Madison; westbound to 69th Street and Fifth Avenue.

------------------------------------

Admission

Special Exhibitions and the Acoustiguide audio guide are included in this price.

Adults: $20

Seniors (65 and over): $15

Students (with valid identification): $10

Children under ten are not admitted to the Collection

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
http://www.nysec.org/sites/default/files/styles/medium/public/images/306555-brain-power.jpg?itok=IbTBUk5C Andra Miller

Carol Van Deusen presides 

You find yourself humming a tune. Or an old friend from the distant past pops into your head. These are some of the countless unbidden thoughts that come from the deep hidden parts of your brain. 

In fact, decisions you think you're consciously making have already been made down in that secret place. How the brain works has ethical implications including: How free is free will? How guilty are the guilty? What makes us helpless in dealing with our problems? And, ultimately, it makes clear something we already know -- that we can't get through life without occasional "outside" help.

Entry to our 100-year-old building and meeting rooms is available for most wheelchair users with prior arrangements. Please call ahead  [masked] x 107) for setup of our portable system and plan to arrive one hour before start time.

results.description:
This is a classic 8.5 mile loop hike in Harriman State Park. We'll hike a section of the Appalachian Trail and climb to the summits of Green Pond and Island Pond Mountains, to the shore of scenic Island Pond, go through the narrow Lemon Squeezer, and pass the historic Boston Mine. We'll get off to a bit of a later start Sunday morning at the 'Elk Pen' Parking Area off Route 17 at Arden Valley Road in Tuxedo, NY. The trail is typical rocky and rolling Harriman terrain and is rated at Moderately Strenuous.

The rock formation known as the Lemon Squeezer is one of the most interesting features in Harriman State Park. Here, the Appalachian Trail climbs through a very narrow passage between the rocks and then goes up a steep rock face, where you will need to use both your hands and your feet. Those who are physically able to negotiate these challenges will probably find them to be a highlight of the hike. But if the climb is too difficult, it is possible to bypass the Lemon Squeezer by following a path to the left.

Length: 8.5 mile loop Time: 4 hours +/-

Difficulty: moderately strenuous, some steep rocky sections.

Route Type: Loop Map: NY/NJ Trail Conference #119 Pace: Moderate - after the initial climb up Green Pond Mountain, the climbs are not tough. We will take a few breaks and will keep the group together.

Driving Directions

Take I-287 North - merging briefly onto the NYS Thruway (toward Albany) but immediately exiting at 15A onto Rte 17 north (turn left at light). Then take N.Y. Route 17 north through Sloatsburg, Tuxedo and Southfields. About two miles north of Southfields, turn right onto Arden Valley Road. Cross the bridge over the New York State Thruway, then make the first right at a sign "Hikers' Trailhead Parking." Park in the newly paved parking area to the west of a large meadow, known as the Elk Pen.

Après Hike Rhodes, Sloatsburg
results.name: Island Pond Loop from Elk Pen - Harriman SP

results.description:
Title: Finding the Play Button

Presenters: Rev. Je' Hooper, Rev. Clare Hammoor

Description: For all ages! Bring yourself, your kids/grandkids, to actively engage with play and creative activities. 


About the Presenters: 


Rev. Je' Hooper is a creative and dynamic educator, interfaith minister, and visual artist who is excited to teach Ethics for Children! Jé has experience teaching all ages in a variety of settings, including Montessori and Reggio Emelia. He received a BFA and a Master of Professional Studies from the Pratt Institute in arts-based learning and administration. He is also a graduate of the Union Theological Seminary and New Seminary with a concentration in interfaith dialogue. Jé is currently pursuing a Ph.D. in Creative Practice at Plymouth University/Transart Institute. He is a sacred activist for the United Nation’s UNICEF program and a humanitarian for social justice.

Rev. Clare Hammoor is a theatre practitioner who collaborates with communities in public spaces, private schools and prisons. His work often questions queerness, ritualization and utopia. Clare teaches drama and performance at Blue School and holds a M.A. in Educational Theatre from NYU.

results.description:
More of What's in a Character? (Part 2)

(**YOU CAN ATTEND THIS WORKSHOP EVEN IF YOU DID NOT ATTEND PART 1**)

This is the second workshop that will focus on character work. You will learn techniques that will enable you to discover the voice, body, emotional life and history of a character with ease. You will learn to "get out of the way" of the character so you can discover, rather than contrive, who the character is.

A fun safe and non-competitive environment is created in which each participant will learn how to work through inhibitions and tap into their imaginations.


Suggested Donation: $15* 

*free drink with $15 donation

*most improv classes in NYC cost $35-$50 per session or more. 

___________________________________________________

THE BENEFITS OF IMPROV


Improv can help you reduce stage fright, perform with more ease, increase your emotional range, build rapport with your scene partners, and have more fun on stage.


Many actors get “stuck in their heads” and as a result feel paralyzed and/or disconnected when performing. Improv skills give the actor tools that will get them out of their heads and into the scene.
results.name: What's in a Character? (Part 2)

results.description:
Since I first bought my first (but not last) ND filter, I have loved the effect of shooting with really long exposures. Clouds spread out forever and rough water turns smooth as silk. It took a lot of video watching, gear purchasing and tons of trial and error. After a few years of practice, I thought I'd share the wealth (of knowledge , that is) and have a workshop to go over the gear, the settings and the technique used to take phenomenal long exposure photos. 

The great people at Adorama will be hosting us again for two sessions. For the first session (12:00PM - 1:30PM), we will go over all of the gear used for shooting long exposures. For the second session (2:00PM - 3:30PM), we will go over the settings and techniques used. There will also be a Q&A portion so we can go over misconceptions that are commonly spread. If you're like me, you learn from experience, so part two of the workshop will be held outdoors. Stay tuned to the NYC Photographers MeetUp for the next event where we will take everything discussed during the Adorama workshop, and put it to use outdoors. 

And to top it all off, we're going to have a raffle! Raffle, not waffle (although that sounds good too). Yes indeed, at the end of the second session, we will discuss how to enter the raffle for an Adorama gift card and pass around a sign in sheet for those up to the challenge. NOTE: You can only enter the raffle if your name and e-mail are on our sign in sheet, so make sure you get there!

Please be sure when you RSVP to this event, to also RSVP on Adorama's Eventbrite Invitation.  You should receive a confirmation ticket(s) via email: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/long-exposure-meetup-part-i-workshop-at-adorama-tickets-22113665569
results.name: Long Exposure MeetUp Part I: Workshop at Adorama

results.description:
Join us for a discussion of the life, times and legacy of Marcus Tullius Cicero, arguably the most accessible and best known personality of late antiquity. Cicero's voluminous surviving correspondence reveals a witty, vain and quirky individuality. A Roman to his fingertips, he was perhaps only one of a handful of active Roman leaders of the last century BC for whom honor, power and fame was not the be-all or end-all of life. As orator, consul, lawyer and moralist Cicero, the New Man from Arpino, enigmatically embodied more of the traditionalist ideals than most of his Old Guard peers. More than any other Roman of his era, Cicero embodies and deserves the Latin adage Respice, Adspice, Prospice --Look back, look now, and look ahead.

Suggested Reading:

Imperium - Robert Harris

Cicero: The Life and Times of Rome's Greatest Politician -Anthony Everitt
results.name: The Life, Times and Legacy of Cicero

results.description:
Fulfill your New Year's Resolution of doing something you've never done before!

The Penguin Plunge is a fundraising event for three local families whose children are battling serious medical conditions. Five-year-old Bridget Kunz of Congers was diagnosed with leukemia this past May and is facing all the challenge of chemotherapy. Twelve-year-old Aiyanna Faria is from Haverstraw and has the extremely rare condition of Dyke-Davidoff-Masson Syndrome which causes multiple seizures a day and is characterized by a unilateral atrophy of the cerebral hemispheres. Fourteen-year-old Heather Matthews suffers from more than 15 seizures a day as a result of having a virus as a toddler that caused traumatic brain injury and left side paralysis.

-----------------------------------------------

The Penguin Plunge will be held in Memorial Park , 12PM - 2PM. We will be meeting at Art Cafe at 12PM, and then walking over to Memorial Park for the event. If you miss us at the Art Cafe , I will have a giant blue canopy (looks like this: http://www.wsdisplay.com/assets/images/products/Casita-10-ft-Stock-Blue-Canopy-Blank-Package-Hardware-Blank-Canopy_1.jpg?resizeid=5&resizeh=1000&resizew=1000) in the Park so you can easily find us.


-----------------------------------------------
IMPORTANT: You DO NOT have to give money to participate in the Penguin Plunge! Whether you are able to donate or not, we would love to have you at the event! If you donate $20 or more, you will get a wonderful t-shirt. There will be opportunities to purchase food and there is a 50/50 raffle.

-----------------------------------------------


FOR THOSE DOING THE PLUNGE:

• The program starts at 12PM sharp (rain or shine) and the actual plunge is at 1:30PM.

• Break out your swimming suits! Wear beach shoes or sandals as the ground can be rocky and muddy.

• The water temperature is expected at about 40 degrees.

• You DO NOT need to go under the water. Some people like to dunk themselves, but the water most likely would not be over your head. It is a shallow area.

• As long as you like, though most people will be in much less than 5 minutes. There will be firefighters assisting at the event to ensure everyone's safety.


Can't wait to see everyone freeze their butts off! :)


-----------------------------------------------


For more information about the Penguin Plunge and this event, please like them on Facebook www.facebook.com/penguinplungeNY or visit www.penguinplungeny.com

results.description:
Please join us for a very special event offered as part of the annual St. Pats for All parade in Sunnyside and Woodside. We will enjoy a traffic-free Skillman Avenue with a series of very casual group runs. This event is appropriate for all ages and fitness levels. Green attire is optional but strongly encouraged, as are Woodside-Sunnyside Runners shirts, if you have them.

When: 

   Sunday, March 6th at 12noon 

Where: 

    Skillman Avenue & 49th Street 

Who: 

   All are welcome - Family, friends, coworkers, neighbors and everybody else 

What: 

   An "Irish Mile" (2.05km, a wee bit over a regular mile) community run that is casual, friendly and smile-filled.

We’ll have an experienced leader to help guide the kids, another for very casual runners and yet another for faster runners. The goal is to get outside, meet other members of our community and enjoy some exercise. No previous running experience is required. 

Our running adventure will end at approximately 1:00pm, when pre-parade speeches will commence, near Skillman Avenue and 43rd Street. The parade is scheduled to kick off at 2:00pm. 

After the run you are welcome to join members of Woodside-Sunnyside Runners marching in the the St. Pats For All parade, where we are officially entered.

After the  parade, it’s likely that many of us will seek snacks and/or beverages at a neighborhood establishment. The more the merrier! 

If you are not part of the Wooside-Sunnyside Runners, we are a very casual socially focused neighborhood running group that has been around since 2009. We offer multiple varied group runs per week and love meeting new people. And, we periodically organize charity fund-raising events such as our infamous annual Halloween Pub Run. Membership is free as are our group runs. Visit us at 

www.woodsidesunnysiderunners.com

for more details.

In this season's OF COURSE, we will have an enlarged course of seven carefully prepared sections which integrate perfectly with an entirely new theme for the season: Code and brunch. In the 2016 Springtime OF COURSE，we will not only bring a range of high quality courses, but in each section of the course we will also provide a delicious brunch for our participants. We will select some of the tastiest brunch spots (Miriam, Char No4, Cafe Luluc, etc.) to satisfy participants appetite, while our carefully prepared curriculum will ensure that participants are provided with a full, comprehensive and lasting understanding of our course topics. The following is our 7 themes for the course:

#1 Intro to Openframeworks/C++ 

- March 6: Presents a brief introduction to writing code in c++, followed by an immersion into using OF

Sign up here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/intro-to-openframeworksc-tickets-21469860932

socket.io for synchronous communications.

Sign up here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/connection-and-networking-tickets-21689361464

Next the instructor will teach students how to embed circuits with conductive materials such as conductive thread, sewable LED and conductive fabrics. We certainly hope OF COURSE can help many more Creative coding hobbyists and lovers, and wish that you can helps us get the word out to your friends, to let more people know about us.

Its a Day of Drones at the Liberty Science Center in Jersey City, NJ! This event corresponds with the NYC Drone Film Festival and will have screenings of the winners, and drone based events all day like Drone Wrestling, FPV Racing Demonstrations, Seminars, Speak to the Pro's and much, much more. All ages, reduced admission for DUG members.

Fun, thrills, and a carnival-like atmosphere make this the drone event you don't want to miss!

RSVP here does not constitute entry to LSC. You must pay at the door.

UPDATE:

All DUG Members will receive a US$5.00 discount at the door. Drone Warriors/Drone Runway participants get free admission. Those that accompany warriors/runway also get the discount.

Sign up sheets for Drone Wars and The Drone Runway events can be found here: 

</a>Drone Wars: 

<a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1-2RgOT5mUafjuEuY5VIu5moRy639NX6xC2tpbNJuOII/viewform">https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1-2RgOT5mUafjuEuY5VIu5moRy639NX6xC2tpbNJuOII/viewform</a>

Drone Runway:

<a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1M44ONoej1KpaMQ-6HlwjC0ymKBoz92TZwQDxng8dY90/viewform?c=0&w=1">

http://goo.gl/forms/bKmNPvlPTi

You will be provided with a time slot in which to compete. There will be tables to prepare your aircraft to do battle. This will be a single elimination tournament with prizes awarded to the top 3 finishers. Last drone flying wins!

Rules are simple - 2 drones enter, one drone leaves. If you both hit the ground at the same time, whichever aircraft can still fly is the winner.

All calls by judges and announcer are final. This is for fun and bragging rights!

The Drone Runway will take place between the overall Drone Wars competition and the Semi-Finals/Finals.

Do you have a drone that no one has seen before? Built a dodecacopter out of a Tweaker 250? Fly with a TV Remote control as your input device? We want to see you strut your stuff on the Drone Runway!

You must sign up for a slot and provide details about your craft to be considered. If it will fly in a smallish space, lets see it in action!

Liberty Science Center

results.description:
John Goodman's full-throttle performance as a William Castle-inspired schlockmeister propels Joe Dante's delightful and charming comedy Matinee. The film takes place during the fall 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis, a time when America's innocence began to crumble. Goodman plays film producer Lawrence Woolsey, who is in Key West to premiere his latest horror epic, "Mant," the story of a man who turns into a giant insect ("Half Man! ... Half Ant! ... All Terror!"). He's busy rigging the local movie theater with all manner of gimmicks, such as Atomo-Vision and Rumble-Rama, and stationing a buxom nurse -- played by Woolsey's girlfriend and leading lady Ruth (Cathy Moriarty) -- in the lobby to assist potential heart attack victims. Amidst all the hubbub, a quartet of local teenagers gear up for the big premiere: Gene (Simon Fenton), a Navy brat whose father is on alert for the duration of the crisis; Stan (Omri Katz), Gene's friend who has a furious crush on Sherry (Kellie Martin); and Sandra (Lisa Jakub), the daughter of two beatnik free-thinkers. As the premiere of "Mant" gets closer and Soviet-U.S. tensions increase, the four teenagers' problems and desires also mount to the boiling point.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u4CaxFU56iI


You can purchase tix in advance here: 

http://metrograph.com/film/film/31/matinee

results.description:
SIGN UP HERE

Since I first bought my first (but not last) ND filter, I have loved the effect of shooting with really long exposures. 

Clouds spread out forever and rough water turns smooth as silk. It took a lot of video watching, gear purchasing and tons of trial and error. After a few years of practice, I thought I'd share the wealth (of knowledge , that is) and have a workshop to go over the gear, the settings and the technique used to take phenomenal long exposure photos. The great people at Adorama will be hosting us again for two sessions. For the first session (12:00PM - 1:30PM), we will go over all of the gear used for shooting long exposures. For the second session (2:00PM - 3:30PM), we will go over the settings and techniques used. 

There will also be a Q&A portion so we can go over misconceptions that are commonly spread. If you're like me, you learn from experience, so part two of the workshop will be held outdoors. Stay tuned to the NYC Photographers MeetUp for the next event where we will take everything discussed during the Adorama workshop, and put it to use outdoors. And to top it all off, we're going to have a raffle! Raffle, not waffle (although that sounds good too). Yes indeed, at the end of the second session, we will discuss how to enter the raffle for an Adorama gift card and pass around a sign in sheet for those up to the challenge.

 NOTE: You can only enter the raffle if your name and e-mail are on our sign in sheet, so make sure you get there!
results.name: Long Exposure Part I: Workshop at Adorama

results.description:
Updated March 5, 2016

WINTER (Dec-Feb)

As the city gets cold we play two times a week. We use Riverside Park with Morningside Park as a backup.

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd & West End) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd & West End)

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

Damien 

[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the C local (B on weekdays) to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball/softball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

results.description:
Over the years this one (or this series of 4, actually) has been suggested to me by several different very smart people.  Not usually my first-choice genre, but at under 300 pages, seemed like a good escapist endeavor for the cold winter months.


"The time is the eve of the World War II. The place is Alexandria, an Egyptian city that once housed the world's greatest library and whose inhabitants are dedicated to knowledge. But for the obsessed characters in this mesmerizing novel, their pursuits lead only to bedrooms in which each seeks to know—and possess—the other. Since its publication in 1957, Justine has inspired an almost religious devotion among readers and critics alike." - Goodreads

About the Author:

"Born in Jalandhar, British India, in 1912 to Indian-born British colonials, Lawrence Durrell was a critically hailed and beloved novelist, poet, humorist, and travel writer best known for the Alexandria Quartet novels, which were ranked by the Modern Library as among the greatest works of English literature in the twentieth century. A passionate and dedicated writer from an early age, Durrell s prolific career also included the groundbreaking Avignon Quintet, whose first novel, "Monsieur "(1974), won the James Tait Black Memorial Prize, and whose third novel, "Constance "(1982), was nominated for the Booker Prize. He also penned the celebrated travel memoir "Bitter Lemons of Cyprus "(1957), which won the Duff Cooper Prize. Durrell corresponded with author Henry Miller for forty-five years, and Miller influenced much of his early work, including a provocative and controversial novel, "The Black Book "(1938). Durrell died in France in 1990." - Amazon.com

 ____________________________ 

** NOTE : I WILL BE EMAILING MEMBERS ASKING YOU TO CONFIRM YOUR "YES" RSVP A FEW DAYS BEFORE THE MEETUP, WITH YOUR REPLY DUE NO LATER THAN APPROXIMATELY 24 HOURS BEFORE THE EVENT SO WE CAN GET A PRETTY ACCURATE HEADCOUNT. PLEASE REMEMBER TO CHANGE A "YES" RSVP TO A "NO" IF YOUR PLANS CHANGE, SO MEMBERS ON THE WAITING LIST HAVE A CHANCE TO READ THE BOOK. AND REMEMBER TO SEE THE "PAGES" LINK FOR THE NO-SHOW POLICY, IT'S STRICTLY ENFORCED. THANKS

results.description:
Are you looking for a complementary training to ENHANCE your overall well being on and off the track, to be more FLEXIBLE and RELEASE physical, mental and emotional tensions?


Are you looking for RELIEF from joint wear, tightness, pain, and/or discomfort?

$5 FOR FIRST CLASS TO CROSS TRAIN...

_________________________________________________

About Yin Yang Yoga...A typical Yoga class is ‘Yang’ in style and focuses on active heating and muscular contraction - by starting with ‘Yin’, a more passive, nourishing, and cooling practice, this uniquely designed class WILL enhance your alignment, performance, and overall sense of balance!


Why For Runners/Athletes? - Lengthening and releasing effect from repetitive movements on sheets of connective tissue can overtime shorten and tighten it in ingrained patterns around the muscles. This fascia restriction can make one more prone to having injuries, abnormal posture, and inefficiency, as well as asymmetrical weakening. By targeting rotated key areas in weekly Yin Yang Yoga For Runners class, one can experience tension release, fluid movement, and benefit from improved posture, circulation, injury prevention, as well as increased respiratory control and mental focus...

Each Yin Yang Yoga for Runners class begins with a series of held Yin/floor postures. While surrendering into the edge of each pose (for 2-5 minutes), students are guided to experience the discomforting stagnant energy and its release around the hips, thighs, and lower back, and be connected to the present moment. The Yang flow sequence designed to follow will allow students to integrate the newly released energy, joint spaces for greater circulation and achieve new level of flexibility and energy.  Guided Relaxation provided at the end will promise to be YUMMY!

__________________________________________________

Testimonies x3: "Jennifer is an awesome instructor. Her sessions are informative and her teaching style is patient, clear and inspires me to attain increased fitness. I look forward to attending her class. The very next day I was able to push through my usual 3-4 miles to complete a 6 mile run." Sandra

"I ran my best time running a 18 mile course the day after..." Lori

“ I started taking Jennifer's Yin/Yang Yoga for Runner's Class over the summer, and it was fantastic. I had never practiced yoga regularly before, and was pleasantly surprised at how it helped to improve my flexibility, running, and overall fitness. Jennifer is a great, hands-on teacher, and really knows how the body works. I highly recommend this class! ” Theresa

________________________________________________________

By Cash or Check

Did I Already Mention----FIRST CLASS FOR ONLY $ 5!!

Class Card $130/10-Class Card, or $13/class *****BEST DEAL!

Please dress in layers (cool to start) and it's okay to eat prior.  Please message any questions and pass this invite to your friends. Thank you and see ya you on the mat!


Namaste, Jennifer, RYT-500hr

results.description:
This is a weekly introductory improv class taught Sundays from 12:30-2:30pm.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

This class is $10.  If money is an issue for you, let me know and we can work something out.  The cost goes to pay for the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  

Hope to see you there!


Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater. He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.
results.how_to_find_us: 22 west 32nd street (between 6th & 5th ave) 10th floor, room I.

results.description:
Note: Only RSVP if you are planning to show up.

First Timers, READ details before you RSVP. 

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY

When: We usually climb between 1:00pm and 4:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizer(s) tries their best to be there around 1:00pm. We will pair off around 1.15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY  (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a>

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late or can't find the group leave a message in the Comments section.  Food/drinks apres-climb at John Brown Smokehouse next door (or whichever resto the group decides). Even if you only want to have a beer with us, that is also acceptable :)

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them). This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day. Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC <a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/">http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;)
results.name: Weekend Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

This Sunday, we are going to have again an event we had last year that we enjoyed a lot. It is a peculiar event that comprises our defense of the rights of women and also our love and respect towards Nature.

We are going to have art, music and literature both in English and in Spanish.

The entrance is free and you will be able to enjoy our appetizers at no cost.

Contact: [masked]


ESPAÑOL:

El domingo día 6 de marzo se cierra otro ciclo en uno de nuestros eventos que el año pasado disfrutamos mucho y que contó con una gran participación tanto sobre el escenario como de asistencia. Se trata de nuestro evento singular en el que homenajeamos a las mujeres con motivo del Día Internacional de la Mujer el próximo día 8 de marzo y lo volvemos a hacer mirando a la naturaleza, promoviendo el respeto y cuidado que merece.

Vamos a contar con arte, música y literatura en español e inglés.

Se trata de un evento gratuito en el que también podrá disfrutar nuestros aperitivos.

Contacto: [masked]

results.description:
Hi TRUs!

We are going Back to Nature!

We have been tour!

Now we are returning to The Museum of Natural History. Every Month. Same Time. Same place. Until further notice.

Our monthly Museum Walk and Talk is still the first Sunday of every month! Same time at 1pm under the lobby dinos (at or near...they did some renovations...). At 1:30 we move to the downstairs cafe to nosh and chat. Then we start exploring at 2:30. I usually have a blue New York Atheists hat on and a small brights button.

Generally, we try to keep it cheap and educational. The Museum of Natural History's admission is by donation.


Bright Cheers Evolving (BCE),
Charlie [masked], mobile)
Acting Director of The New York Brights

 

"In general people are not born stupid. True stupidity
is achieved only through great effort, such as the Creation Museum in Petersburg, KY"

-Giddian, a Brights Leader, is http://itanjo.com/... and Atheist Axioms at Cafe Press

p.s.
Again, ANBU-TRU is a registry for groups (individuals may sign up as official liaisons and tell their respective groups about it)

There is no formal meeting yet. We explore parallel to The Brights and The Guardians. Just write me for info.
results.why: It is a safe place to test and develop our ideas about community compared to similar groups.
results.name: Allied Non-Believers United- The Reality Union Monthly Meetup

results.description:
June 8, 2014

Witches Many Rituals & The Degrees

The Many Rituals in Life for a Witch What is a First Degree? What is a Second Degree? What is a Third Degree? What is an Apprentice Adept? What is a High Priestess? Summer Solstice/Litha Briefing $25 in person/$27 via paypal - PLEASE bring your receipt to class.


Academy of Pagan Studies offers the most comprehensive, well-planned and affordable training available anywhere. We have a very interactive community based program. We provide many sources of learning that go into each and every class, which surpasses others when learning about Wicca / WitchCraft in New York City. We offer First through Third Degree training. Additionally we have many other Witch Crafting Classes & Workshops including: Herbal Intensive Series, Starlight Vision Series and much more, such as tarot, pendulum use, candle craft, magickal herbs, spell craft, runes etc.

What is wonderfully unique about WFT Academy of Pagan Studies is that it allows you to set the pace of your learning experience and provides you with an affordable way to grow within a structured Wiccan learning environment. You will be challenged and we do invite those who welcome this challenge to our Wiccan Academy. We take your education very seriously, and in turn you should be serious about your education and training in the Path of Wicca / WitchCraft. Before considering enrollment and training at WFT Academy of Pagan Studies keep in mind that it is a life-path commitment.

Within our Academy there is an enormous amount of Community Interaction through the use of meetups, myspace, groups and now our newly formed blog and forum etc., further enabling you to increase your knowledge and learning as well as providing you the ability to network with other like-minded individuals in a safe and supportive environment.

The Academy is truly a Spiritual Home and we welcome you to make it your own!

We have Degree-specific Study to discuss challenging lessons, facilitate rituals celebrating the Sabbats and Esbats as well as for healing and self-empowerment, all in a friendly and open atmosphere. We also hold Wiccan Degree dedications marking the stages of your training as you move through the Academy*. We have found that many of our Students find it wonderful to be in a group learning environment that they can consider a Community Home.

We are all very proud of our Academy and what we have accomplished so far. But ever mindful that it is each and every one of the Students that make it what it is. If you are reading this, we are confident that you would make a wonderful addition to our Circle and do hope that after reading you will decide to join us as a Wiccan Academy Student and member of The Wiccan Family Temple.

We strive to provide a comprehensive selection of training programs and as such offers many other Elective Craft courses and training opportunities for seekers of knowledge and magickal expertise. We encourage you to visit our CURRICULUM PAGE & CRAFT CLASSES PAGE for a complete list of current and future programs.

We welcome you to begin your studies by going to our ADMISSION AND PRICES (where you will find applications) page and submit your enrollment to the Academy today. We look forward to having you join us as a new Student of the WFT Academy of Pagan Studies.

WE ARE ALWAYS IMPROVING UPON WHAT WE OFFER STRIVING AND PROMISING TO ALWAYS KEEP RAISING THE BAR ON WHAT WE OFFER.

WE ARE THE MOST COMPREHENSIVE AND AFFORDABLY TAUGHT WITCHCRAFT ACADEMY WITHIN THE NEW YORK CITY AREA.

IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO FIND OUT FURTHER INFORMATION REGARDING THESE CLASSES, PLEASE GO TO www.freewebs.com/wftacademyofpaganstudies. YOU WILL FIND REGISTRATION INFORMATION, PRICES AND OUR FULL CURRICULLUM. YOU CAN JOIN IN THESE CLASSES AT ANY TIME, AND CATCH UP WITH THE CLASSES YOU MISSED NEXT TIME IT COMES AROUND.

IF YOU HAVE NOT DONE SO, PLEASE DO BRING YOUR APPLICATION FILLED OUT WITH YOU WHEN YOU COME TO CLASS. ALSO, BRING A NOTE BOOK AND PEN OR PENCIL.

The most comprehensive and affordably taught WitchCraft Classes in NYC
$25.00 per class/$27.00 via paypal, to cover cost of spaces and paper expenses (it is a requirement).

There is a one time fee per year of $25.00 registration fee.

If you pay online please bring a receipt of payment as we do not always have time to check paypal the day of the class, or we will expect you pay at the class or gathering.

FOR MORE INFORMATION ON CLASSES, EVENTS ETC. PLEASE VISIT US AT:
www.wftacademyofpaganstudies.webs.com
www.wiccanfamilytemple.org
www.thenycpagancouncil.webs.com
www.romanctichandfastings.webs.com
www.charmedbystarr.com for all your ritual and pagan items.

results.description:
Here is our schedule:

1:00 to 1:30

Introductions and Discussion

1:30 - 3:00

Prompt/Scenario Session

Several people have requested we do one of  these again.  In the past it has made for some great sessions.  Personally I have added some of the content I've written in these sessions in some of my work.

Here's how it works.


For this session we will be doing something a bit different.  We will all be work working with the same prompt, then reading our work (this part is optional).  In the past it has been interesting to see how much people's work varies.  Usually we fit in about three prompts per session.

For this session we will be in room 2

results.description:
Orientation: Sun. March 6th, 1pm – 5pm
Location: TRS 40 Exchange Pl, 3rd Flr.
Cleanse: March 12th – 20th
Fee: $125

PLEASE NOTE:
A $50 Non-Refundable deposit is due by Sun, Feb 21st
A $10 Late Fee is applied after Sunday, Feb 21st

All participants must be present at the orientation on Sunday, March 6, 2016.

SPECIAL:

We are currently offering a bundle deal - Purchase All Four of the Seasonal Cleanses for $400 and save $100!

FOR MORE INFO:

To register: please visit: http://www.ethoh.org/?tribe_events=spring-equinox-cleanse-4

To learn more about our Seasonal Cleanses please visit:
http://www.ethoh.org/?page_id=2622

FEATURED HEALER: Deidre Ann Johnson

A licensed massage and physical therapist, Deidre Ann Johnson has been both a licensed massage and physical therapist for the last 20 years, (Swedish Institute of Massage Therapy/Downstate Medical Center). She is currently working at a private orthopedic practice in Chelsea where the majority of the patients she sees suffer from musculoskeletal disorders (MSDs) as a result of poor posture and/or inadequate work station set ups on the job or at home. She also practices massage from her home in Bronx, New York.

ABOUT THE CLEANSE:

Immerse yourself in 9 days of purification and transformation as you discover and discard physical, emotional and spiritual energy that no longer serves you.

The focus of this season’s Cleanse is the purification of our HEARTS and the unworthiness, low self-esteem and self-destructive behavior that keeps us from experiencing the Pure Love, Light, Peace and Joy that we are!

The Cleanse will consist of taking an herbal tincture of Hawthorn berries, leaves and stems, probiotics and a gentle herbal laxative daily (all included in the price). In addition, various body workers will be available to assist with continuing to release feelings of unworthiness, self-pity and irresponsibility from our bodies at a deeper level (additional fee).

Throughout the Cleanse you will receive daily emails for encouragement and inspiration as well as integrate daily meditations, affirmations and exercises (dance and yoga) to help support your healing process.

Additionally, various healers will be available to support your Cleanse process: Massage, Reiki, Colon Therapy, Private Meditation and Acupuncture (additional fee).
results.how_to_find_us: www.ethoh.org
results.name: Entering the Holy of Holies of Your Heart:  A Spring Equinox Cleanse:
