results.description:
Hey everyone! Join us for our monthly introspective meetup, where we look into ourselves and try to figure out how to be better profeminist men. This month we'll look at two topics that were tabled last week and discuss them for 30 minutes each:

***1. Feminism and the 2016 Presidential election***
Is feminism informing your choice of candidate for the 2016 Presidential election? If so, whom are you supporting? On the Democratic side of the race, TIME Magazine claims that Bernie Sanders is winning feminists (http://time.com/4220427/bernie-sanders-wellesley-hillary-clinton-femisim/) while The Nation points out that electing a female President could help animate the conversation about gender inequality in the way that electing Barack Obama brought to the surface the enduring power of racial animus in the United States (http://www.thenation.com/article/why-this-socialist-feminist-is-for-hillary/).

***2. Interacting with the world: Nicholas Kristof***
During our last meeting, we compiled a list of model male profeminists and the very first one to come up was New York Times columnist Nicholas Kristof. Several news outlets, including The Feminist Wire (http://www.thefeministwire.com/2013/03/op-ed-nicholas-kristof-and-the-politics-of-writing-about-womens-oppression-in-darker-nations/), Buzzfeed (http://www.buzzfeed.com/annanorth/the-anti-nicholas-kristof-backlash#.igjgJY04yX), and The Guardian (http://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/cifamerica/2012/mar/26/nick-kristof-anti-sex-trafficking-crusade), have been critical of Nicholas Kristof's methods as being counterproductive, simplistic, and having unintended consequences. Is there any truth to these criticisms? If so, what can we learn from them about the ways to productively, maturely, and deliberately address the oppression of less privileged groups than our own?
results.name: Introspective

venue.name: The American Museum of Natural History

results.description:
Hi Brights, locals and visitors, out of state and international!

Also, to those who are curious about The Brights (the-brights.net) or who we are allied with. You are welcome to explore natural reality with us too!)


As Always: The Museum of Natural History. Every Month. Same Time. Same place. Until further notice.

(Please Note: To further our efforts at remembrance of those like-minded friends who have past away, we are exploring ideas to entrench and revisit their inspirations by creating a fund to set up benches, plaques, fountains and other things in our city. This will be an ongoing discussion until implemented.)


Our monthly Museum Walk and Talk is perpetually on the first Sunday of every month! Same time at 1pm under the lobby dinosaurs (at or near, in the round). At 1:30 we move to the downstairs cafe to nosh and chat. Then we start exploring at 2:30. I usually have a blue New York Atheists hat on and a small brights buttons.

Generally, we try to keep it cheap and educational. The Museum of Natural History's admission is by donation. several of us are members and therefore we take people in as guests as we can. The museum itself is by donation so it is very accessible to everyone. Never avoid coming if you feel you cannot afford it. Just let me know in confidence.


Other events are planned ad-hoc and the city and tri-state  is our oyster...

RSVPs are appreciated but not required unless specifically stated.

Bright Cheers Evolving (BCE),
Charlie [masked], mobile)
Acting Director of The New York Brights

"In general people are not born stupid. True stupidity
is achieved only through great effort, such as the Creation Museum in Petersburg, KY"

-Giddian, a Brights Leader, is http://itanjo.com/... and Atheist Axioms at Cafe Press
results.why: Our Bright Walk and Talks are explorations of science, culture and reality with informal chat between like-minded, respectful people.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet under the lobby dinos 1-1:30 then we will move to the lower cafe for an hour before exploring. I will have a blue New York Atheist hat on wearing various buttons and pins as well.
results.name: The New York City Brights Meetup Group Monthly Meetup

results.description:
Have you always wanted to try art journaling?  

Or are you someone that has more paints, papers and sprays than you want to admit? 

Are you looking for a creative, artsy community? 

http://designmemorycraft.typepad.com/.a/6a0134896f7ad2970c01a51171a0cf970c-800wi

*We will meet to create together and learn from each other! Heidi will share techniques as we go along but this event is more for the social aspect of making art together. There are no "set" projects or techniques-work on what you want to. Heidi will be creating art, too! 

*You will have access to Heidi's stencils, paints, sprays, etc. ($10 fee)

Please bring these supplies each week: 

*art journal

*adhesive-Matte Medium/gluesticks

*gesso

*something for color-acrylic paints, watercolor crayons, collage papers, watercolors, spray inks

*permanent pens/markers

*paintbrushes

*pencils for drawing

*stencils 

Check out Heidi's ART on her blog at: Gotham City Stampers

Hello Artists! Do you have those packs of paper with tons of sheets that you will never use up? How about great napkins with 100 in the pack? Tons of collage that you can't possibly use up? 
I thought it would be fun to bring along things that you want to share with the others at our ART JOURNALING CLUB EVENTS. (You certainly don't have to!) New art journalers are trying to build up their stash of goodies. Those of us that have been doing it for a bit love getting our hands on new things! You could also bring those supplies that you don't use-see if they can find a new home with someone from our group. 
I recently picked up two awesome packs of napkins that I love to use as background layers on my pages. I can't possibly use them all so everyone will be getting some. 
Again, no pressure to bring something but I wanted to put it out there as something fun to add to our already great time together!
results.name: March Art Journaling Club (read description carefully)

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: 

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
The Stilt-Sands are destroyed, and a terrible leviathan has awoken to plague the Ten Isles once more. All that remains of hundreds of sails and thousands of sailors are two ships and three hundred souls. Precipice Port is a fortnight away, the only destination for hundreds of miles of ocean, and you must reach it. Not all is as it seems amongst the sailors and refugees, however. Someone or something has slipped aboard, and its intentions are surely murderous. Can you reveal the hidden evil before it is too late?

Fortnight of Fear is the fourth chapter for the WildPig Exclusive Campaign "Sailing Against the Wind" by Noah Anderson. New and returning players are welcome. Characters are 7th level, with a limit of 8 players per session. There will be time for character creation a half-hour before the first session. Seats are limited, so please register ahead of time.

results.description:
A finales del siglo XVIII, cuando dos miembros de la Real Academia Española, el bibliotecario don Hermógenes Molina y el almirante don Pedro Zárate, recibieron de sus compañeros el encargo de viajar a París para conseguir de forma casi clandestina los 28 volúmenes de la Encyclopédie de D'Alembert y Diderot, que estaba prohibida en España, nadie podía sospechar que los dos académicos iban a enfrentarse a una peligrosa sucesión de intrigas, a un viaje de incertidumbres y sobresaltos que los llevaría, por caminos infestados de bandoleros e incómodas ventas y posadas, desde el Madrid ilustrado de Carlos III al París de los cafés, los salones, las tertulias filosóficas, la vida libertina y las agitaciones políticas en vísperas de la Revolución francesa.

Basada en hechos y personajes reales, documentada con extremo rigor, conmovedora y fascinante en cada página, Hombres buenos narra la heroica aventura de quienes, orientados por las luces de la Razón, quisieron cambiar el mundo con libros cuando el futuro arrinconaba las viejas ideas y el ansia de libertad hacía tambalearse tronos y mundos establecidos.

results.description:
I would love for you to join me in the third instillation as we begin to use meditation and improvisational movement as a means to encourage a conversation and cohesion between our rational and everyday thinking with our intuitive, spiritual, and woman selves. I am continually inspired by the connection between this kind of work and a deeper dialogue with our body-minds.

Any woman with a calling to work in this way is welcome to attend! By just showing up with a willingness to be present in the work, you have already opened your heart and you are already a dancer.

I reserved the beautiful space Eden's Expressway through Movement Research, and I am charging $10 a person (No one will be turned away for lack of funds. Feel free to contact me.)

I can only accept a maximum of 15 women, so please RSVP as soon as you can! If you can't make it this time, I will be offering 2 more sessions through March.

I so look forward to meeting and moving with each of you!! If you have any questions/concerns/excitements/anything, please message me. I would love to hear from you!

--caitlin

Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

"That was absolutely amazing! I don't think I have ever fully let go and quieted my mind like that before. I feel so inspired. By the end of the session I was filled with so much love - love for myself, for others, and love coming from Source. Unconditional, pure love. Thank you." C.L.

"Instead of the 'knowledge gained', I find it appropriate to give a 5 star to 'raising my vibrations' during the meditation.... the energy of the group was Amazing and ZINGING! Thanks... " - S

"Thank you Tracy for a wonderful start to the day. Amazing calmness capturing everyone's energy on the class. Look forward to attending the next on-line class. Thank you." - B.J

"Very enlightening and a positive way for those that can't make it physically to do so remotely.""Thank you, the second section moved me the most. I had a real moment of knowing who I was, am and always be. Also, I have in the past trained in yoga and meditation but not practiced for a number of years - I felt all the beauty of it flowing connecting through my source once again aaaahhh bliss." - A.S.

"Truly inspirational, loved it, thank you ." - Anonymous

"Really loved being able to just switch on and meditate." - L.M.

"So relaxing and cleansing." - T.H.

"Awesome meditation Tracy! One of the most powerful sessions I have ever had. Wow." - G.R.

"I absolutely loved the meditation. The music was one that I truly enjoyed. Thank you so much for this. Many blessings to you." - S.

FOR DETAILS OF ALL UPCOMING 'MEDITATION 101 LIVE' SESSIONS PLEASE CLICK HERE.

Follow Meditation 101 Live on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn.

results.description:
Disclosure Network New York

Date: Sunday, March 6, 2016

Location: CAP 21 Studios, 18 West 18th St., (Between 5th Ave. & 6th Ave., South Side of Street), elevator to the 5th Floor, Room 505, NYC

Time: 2pm-4pm,Please be on time, as late arrivals may disrupt the meeting. Enter the room assigned at 2pm. Ask the Welcome Desk person for “Nick Curto's room assignment” if you need help in finding the room. Please be on time, as late arrivals may disrupt the meeting. Enter the room assigned at 2pm.

Topic:“THE KENNEDY ASSASSINATION: Cover-Up/Consequences”

Featured Guest Speaker: EDWARD I. SCHWARTZ

Program (Live Event): Ed will apply a two-part approach to his talk: In Part 1, he will review his book. In Part 2, he will discuss the new book he is writing with the former girlfriend of the falsely accused Lee Harvey Oswald and will present circumstantial evidence to prove that Oswald did not shoot and kill President Kennedy.

Bio: Edward Schwartz graduated from Lehman College in the Bronx, NYC in 1966. He was trained for combat duty in Vietnam in a basic training program at Fort Dix, NJ in the early months of 1965 at the time when President Lyndon Johnson sent a Marine invasion force to Vietnam. In 2007 Ed wrote a book on “The Kennedy Assassination - The Betrayal of the John Fitzgerald Kennedy Presidency”. In 2013 Ed revised the book after realizing that the 1991 Gulf War in Iraq orchestrated by President George H. W. Bush was unjustified. Ed is currently working with Judith Vary Baker, author of “Me & Lee” and “David Ferrie” as co-author on a book about the Kennedy assassination. The theme of this new book is, “The Kennedy Assassination: The Cover Up and the Consequences”.

Please plan to attend what is bound to be one of the most interesting DNNY meetings to date and invite your interested friends to join us.

Meeting Details: Admission $10 per person. Children 12 and under admitted free. Our treasurer will collect your admission fee in the meeting room door before the program begins.


R.S.V.P. now to guarantee you one (1) reserved seat! (30 seat venue room limit.) Provide your full name, e-mail address and cell phone number.

E-mail: [masked] (Questions: Contact: Nick Curto, DNNY Director/Co-Founder: Phone:[masked])

3 Important Notes:

1. No food or beverages are allowed in any rooms of the venue except bottled water that may be brought into the venue. You can also purchase chilled bottled water at the Welcome Desk in the Lobby for $1.
2. Please silence your cell phones when entering the meeting room.
3. No photos may be taken or sound recording is ever allowed at any of the DNNY meetings.

Visit: www.dnny.info

results.description:
Date Walking is kind of like speed dating except not as awkward, not as frantic and a heck of a lot more relaxed. When you come to a Date Walking event, you will take a casual stroll with anywhere from 5 to 15 wo/men over the course of an hour or two. Once you've met everyone, we usually get food and/or drinks somewhere. It's a really fun and relaxed way to meet someone special or multiple possibilities face-to-face.

Dear people who do not like walking in sub-zero temperatures, 

The Winter Garden is a spectacular 3-story barrel-vaulted glass atrium, offering panoramic views of the World Trade Center and Lower Manhattan at one end, and showcasing a majestic bay window with magnificent views of the Hudson River on the other. The central feature of the Winter Garden is the grand semicircular staircase, fashioned of Italian marble, which opens to a grove of 45-foot palm trees. Let me tell you, this place is amazing! It's perfect for Date Walking in the winter and/or on rainy days too. 

Check out some photos from one of last Winter's events at this venue here. 

The exact meeting spot is where the 40’ palm trees are. You can’t miss it. Look for the tallest guy there. That will be Beau, your Date Walking Organizer, or you can call me at[masked] and I'll wave you over to where we're at.

The meeting time is 2 PM and we will wait 20 minutes for everyone to arrive. 


After our Date Walk, upstairs is an AMAZING food court called Hudson Eats with so many options it will make your head spin + there's TONS of seating and SPECTACULAR views of the Hudson River!! They also serve wine and beer up there so like OMG it's going to be AWESOME!! Trust me. 

If this is your first time doing a Date Walk have no fear. It's like the easiest and least awkward way to meet people. You just walk and talk. 

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call or text at [masked]

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 
  Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook | Twitter 

Please be aware that while an equal number of men and women is preferred it is not always the case.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet under the 40' palm trees or call 347-225-3516
results.name: Age is Just a Number: Date Walking in The Winter Garden Atrium

results.description:
Please join The Animals’ Battalion in protesting Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus. at the Barclays Center arena- LET’S SHOW THEM THAT ANIMAL ABUSE IS NOT WELCOME IN NEW YORK!

www.ringlingbeatsanimals.com



WHEN: Sunday March 06, 2:00PM – 3:00PM,  6–7PM

WHERE: In front of Barclays Center, 620 Atlantic Ave., Brooklyn, NY 11217 accessible by the 2,3,4,5 trains (See this map.) http://goo.gl/maps/IVX0G

Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus is known for its long history of abusing animals. In 1929, John Ringling ordered the execution of a majestic bull elephant named Black Diamond after the elephant killed a woman who had been in the crowd as he was paraded through a Texas city. Twenty men took aim and pumped some 170 bullets into Black Diamond's body and then chopped off his bullet-ridden head and mounted it for display in Houston. Ringling Bros.' cruel treatment of animals continues today.

Elephants in Ringling's possession are chained inside filthy, poorly ventilated boxcars for an average of more than 26 hours straight—and up to 100 hours at a time—when the circus travels. Even former Ringling employees have reported that elephants are routinely abused and violently beaten with bullhooks (weapons that resemble a fireplace poker) in order to force them to perform tricks.

To learn more about Ringling's lengthy history of abusing animals, check out PETA's factsheet. http://circuses.com/pdfs/RinglingHiddenTruthFSetc.pdf

There will also be protests every day Ringling's will be at the Barclay Center.
results.name: The Animals’ Battalion: Ringling Brothers Circus Protest @ Barclays Center

results.description:
"Sad, middle-aged Greg Feely, whose only companions are a dying cat and his collection of porn videos, learns he is actually Ned Slade, top agent of the Hand, an organization dedicated to maintaining the social status quo by eliminating unhealthy variations - biological, technological, or sexual. As another agent observes, the Hand 'wipes the arse of the world': the likes of Spartacus Hughes - an artificially grown personality who occupies various bodies, Anders Klimakks - an amnesiac porn star with super pheromones, and Max Thunderstone - a sociopath with drug-induced superpowers. Greg/Ned constantly struggles to reconcile his two wildly contradictory personalities."


http://www.amazon.com/The-Filth-Grant-Morrison/dp/1401200133


We're heading back to Central Bar for this Meetup.

I know it's been a while, but hope to see you all there!

Click the link below to purchase tickets to this event:


http://www.eventbrite.com/e/ny-adventure-club-behind-the-scenes-united-palace-wonder-theatre-tickets-21722457455?aff=meetup

Join New York Adventure Club for a behind-the-scenes experience at the United Palace Theatre, one of the five New York Metropolitan area's five 'Loew's Wonder Theatres' built by the Loew's Theatres chain between 1929 and 1930. This 3,000+ seat movie palace, built in 1930, is considered one of the most impressive architectural masterpieces in all of New York, boasting over nine different architectural styles. 

This special access experience, led by the United Palace House of Inspiration historian, will take us through the historic lobby, hallways, balconies, stage, and backstage, before ending with tea and crackers courtesy of the United Palace House of Inspiration (UPHI), who has owned the theater since 1969.

Click here to see pictures from our last visit to United Palace!
results.name: NY Adventure Club: Behind-the-Scenes @ United Palace 'Wonder Theatre'

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

Come get creative while getting to know yourself and a few others along the way. 

No-pressure setting to do a little self-exploration and some writing.

-----------

I recently found myself in a situation where I was made to really consider where and of what I am from. 

In the same circumstance, I was encouraged to write a creative anything about it and share it with a complete stranger (you would only share by your own volition). 


It sounds terrifying but it was a fun exercise - you get to really reflect on where/what you're from and put a few words to it.

**There will be an acoustic band playing live after we wrap up, feel free to stick around and invite friends!

results.description:
If you've not come to one of our meetups before, it's a group of fun nerdy gays playing casual games of MtG. It's a great place to learn and have fun in a low pressure friendly setting. Whether you're a regular tournament player or a first-timer, you'll fit right in.

This time we're trying something new for Gay Planeswalkers. We're going to do a booster draft of Dragons of Tarkir (three packs of Dragons - we will not be using Fate Reforged). If you've not drafted before, it's lots of fun. You will get to build a deck strategically and bring it home with you. Dragons is not rotating out of Standard until December so if you regularly play Standard, you might pick up some new cards. If you don't know what any of that means, don't worry about it. The biggest takeaway is you'll get cards to build a deck and it's fun.

If you signup, it's $12 which pays for three booster packs (sales tax included). This will be limited to eight people so it will be at my apartment (where I have large tables for drafting). I'll provide the address for those who sign up as it gets closer. There will be no prizes. Per usual, we're getting together to have fun in a casual setting. Everyone's welcome to bring beer or wine. I'll have one or the other to kick things off.

If you sign up and then cannot make it, we won't be able to play so please be sure you can attend before you click that RSVP button. ;)

Here's some more specifics on the format:

At the start of booster draft, each player opens a booster pack and picks a single card. (Don’t show the other players what you pick!) Then everyone passes the rest of their pack to player on their left, each player then picks a card from the pack they just received before passing again. This process continues until all the cards in those packs have been drafted. Then each player opens a second pack, but this time, you pass the pack to your right. After all those cards are drafted, you do the same with the third pack, passing to the left again.
results.name: Let's draft Gay Magic the Gathering - Dragons of Tarkir

results.description:
This is a reschedule of the original Shamanic Writing Room scheduled for January 24th.

For this meeting, we will have some people who are not part of BSFW - it is a joint meeting of BSFW and the shamanic writing workshops I am doing separately from BSFW. Because of this, I will be teaching you how to journey so, when you RSVP, I'll be writing to you individually about journeying - once you RSVP, shoot me an email at [masked], or I will email you through the meetup site.

Following is the description I sent out for the original meeting, along with some updates.

Please feel free to let me know if you have any questions.

As some of you in the group know, I have practiced shamanic journeying for the past 13 years and I have been doing intensive shamanic training for the past two years. My training has been in what is called core shamanism, practices and healing methods distilled from different shamanic traditions around the world. These methods are used for healing, guidance, and gaining insight, inspiration and creativity for oneself and others in the community.

My offering to our BSFW community is this workshop, in which we will be utilizing shamanic practices to facilitate creativity and to add a new dimension to your writing process.

In this Shamanic Writing Room meeting, we will do exercises and writing prompts based on the practices of guided journeying (guided meditations) to open up access to deeper creativity. To enter a meditative state, I will lead you by my oral instructions and/or a drumbeat.

On your guided journeys, you can meet beings and creatures, both human and non-human, who will inspire you, lead you into other worlds, give you new storylines and ideas, and offer helpful advice. You may see a story unfold or you may personally be involved in the story.

To begin our afternoon, we will introduce ourselves and you will set your intention and personal goal for the meeting. This could be, for example: I want to write more during the week, I want to break through a block I am experiencing in this story/novel/project. We will set up a special collective place with all of our inspiration objects (see below in list of things to bring with you).

We will enter into a meditative place with some stretching and deep breathing.

I will teach you how to journey and guide you through the first journey to meet your power animal and your writing guide.

After, you will write down your experiences and then will be able to share, if you’d like (you don’t have to).

If we have time, we will do a second journey.

The meditations (journeys) will be done with my guidance and instruction in a safe and supportive environment.

After we do the journeys, we will all write together, just as in the traditional Writing Room.

There will be absolutely no drugs (except coffee!). I will provide coffee and some snacks and you can also bring snacks. I have two cats, in case anyone has allergies.

Please bring, if you have these:

eye covering (a scarf works well)

blanket

notebook & pens

coloring materials

an object, poem, quote, excerpt that inspires you (inspiration objects)

Following is some background and information about shamanism:

Shamanism is an ancient spiritual path and practice that has existed for 100,000 years all over the world. What I have studied and what I practice is core shamanism, which distills the integral practices and methods from all traditions.

It is helpful to remember that it doesn’t matter whether you believe in other worlds or use shamanic language in your own belief system. What is conducive to inspiration is your openness and willingness to try something new. Inspiration occurs in different ways and there is usually a mysterious and unknown aspect to it. If you get a great idea, feel expansions and shifts in perspective, are able to write in a way you never have before, that is what is important. You have your own unique faith and define it for yourself. It is important to honor that in yourself and trust yourself as to what you need, even if you may not know or understand all of the details involved.

Looking forward to seeing you,

Arielle
results.name: Shamanic Writing Room

results.description:
Deadline for submission of stories to be critiqued is Monday of the week preceeding the Meetup. On Tuesday, an email will be sent, listing the stories to be critiqued and in what order. Print out and mark up your copies in advance or read and mark up electronic comments.

Stories can be any length up to approx. 7,000 words. Flash fiction welcome.

You can submit your story to me (Marcy) directly, or submit to Dropbox per the Procedures (see below). My email is [masked].

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. Read through our Short Story Group Procedures for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.

Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure to make sure critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, so writers leave with a clear idea of what to do next with their stories.

We also spend time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know!

Flash pieces: If there is time (and there usually is), we can critique one or two last minute flash pieces that weren't submitted. Best method is to print out a copy for each participant. We will read the story there and give on-the-spot critiques.
results.name: Marcy's Short Story Meetup

Please join us on Sunday for meditation instruction and sitting practice. Developed for beginners as well as experienced meditators, this afternoon session will include guided instruction by an experienced teacher, and discussion and opportunity for questions and comments. More details:http://www.theidproject.org/events/2015/05/03/sundays-weekly-introduction-meditation 

Recent scientific research suggests that meditation practice is an effective means to lessening stress and depression, boosting bodily immune and respiratory functions, increasing happiness and cultivating compassion and joy within one's life.

Please arrive by 2:50 to settle into your seat for the program. Chairs and cushions will be available. We request a $5-$10 donation to support our organization, though no one will be turned away for lack of funds. 

Note we are located on the 2nd Floor of a walkup building.  We have no elevator. 

The Interdependence Project 
302 Bowery 3rd Floor, Middle Buzzer 
Between Houston and 1st Street

results.description:
Open play for Advanced Beginners and Intermediates.

Here is our schedule on Sundays:
3:15 pm: arrival, changing, stretching and warm ups.
3:30 pm hitting and servicing practice
3:45 pm game starts

Gym Rules:
Up to 7 players per team, 3 teams max
Once cap has been reached, any players coming after can wait for opening spots (if someone leaves).

IMPORTANT - Skill Level Required for Open Play

Know how to rotate on the court, serve, pass, set, spike and block. Know how to hold your position on the court during defense and offense.  This is meant for players that have experience playing.

Rules will be enforced to protect all players from safety and fun.

Recreational players and beginners can practice on the side or come watch for FREE. We also run a skills clinic to improve your game. Please ask!

If you will be attending for the first time, please check in with me for a quick 3 min assessment.

Thanks and hope to see you on the court!

Kathy

Directions:

You may use the parking lot seeing from the photo enclosed Use the left side blue door to go inside. Find us on INSIDE COURT. (outside court is a church group).


Disclaimer: Participation in activities is strictly voluntary and group members assume all risks in connection with activities; organizers and events leaders are released from any and all forms of liability related to events....

Good times for all!
results.name: Dig This Volleyball Open Gym

results.description:
Why just paint when you can Tipsy Paint? That's what we thought too! So put a brush in one hand and a drink in the other, and join us for a unique, colorful way to spend the night out and make new friends!

Tipsy Painting is a step-by-step, group-oriented painting instruction, which is designed to simultaneously entertain and enlighten our members. A professional artist guides you through a featured painting that is yours to keep and proudly display at the end of the night. And don’t worry — no experience is necessary. 

PREPAY ONLY. MUST BUY IN ADVANCE (Space is limited).

*GET TICKET HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/painting/dates/Mar-06-2016_at_0330PM

*$35-$45, price goes up as the event date gets closer. This event will sell out, especially for women. Tickets not sold at the door.  

What's included: 

• 2+ hour course lead by an expert artist to teach you the art of mixing colors, blending and painting techniques. 

• 12x16 pre-sketched canvas, acrylic paint (water based), and all painting supplies (brushes, aprons, easels) supplied

• Drink & Food Specials (1 drink min, can be non-alcoholic)  

 • Great Music At Right Volume For Mingling 

• Free Raffle & Prizes 

*Get Tickets At This Link (no door sales) -  https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/painting/dates/Mar-06-2016_at_0330PM

*These events sell out quickly so don't wait to get your ticket!

This event is being co-organized by several other groups. The # of RSVP's here are not reflective of actual attendance. Based on presales, at least 25 members will be attending! 

Can I still attend If I don't know how to paint? Yes, no experience is necessary. 

Can I come alone? Yes, 80% attending come on their own. 

Is this age/ethnic/age specific? No, this event is not meant to be age/ethnic specific or gender balanced. All are welcome, 21+. 

How do I attend? RSVP w/ group and purchase ticket here - 

https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/painting/dates/Mar-06-2016_at_0330PM
results.name: Tipsy Painting Party - Mix, Mingle & Paint! (Prepay Only Event)

These classes will be dedicated to intermediate speakers. Each member of the group is encouraged to participate. We will focus on pronunciation, sentences with simple structure and different ways to express the past tense.

Each class is $15 per student. Please don't just show up assuming there is space, always RSVP either through email or the Meetup page. This class has a maximum capacity of 10 students and is on a first come first serve basis. Priority goes to students that pay online.

I hope to see you there!

Ciao,
Federico
http://nycspeaksitalian.wix.com/speak-italian

results.description:
What's up guys! One of the most common challenges I encounter with clients is the nervousness and hesitation to approach an attractive stranger and strike up a conversation.

I understand the difficulty, because I've been there myself many times.

I want to share some of my insights on how I overcame this challenge and what I've seen with others who have improved.

We will also have time for an open discussion/ Q&A.

Ripley-Grier Studios

520 8th Ave

Room 16W

See you there!

Justin

http://JustinAttraction.com

http://NaturalAttractionNYC.com

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****

Meet on field 8!!!

We are meeting at 3:30. There is a tournament going on this weekend. Kickoff will be after 4. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.
results.name: Sunday Pick-up Parade Grounds 3:30 PM

dear parents of 6-12m explorers :) would you like to visit us for a play and sing date, where will be 1.5 hours of fun musical tunes, songs and little muppet theatre.. as well as tea and cake for the parents.

we do have space for strollers, up to 5 strollers can be left in a secure area in the corridor behind the apt door. 

GROUP IS LIMITED To 8 places, but will repeat soon for those who aren't able to get it.
results.name: sing along play party!

group.name: New York UWS Manhattan New Parents 6-12m babies Meetup

results.description:
“According to our tradition, the history of the Jewish people began as the history of one family, the family of Abraham and Sarah. Over the years, going all the way to our own time, each generation has added a new chapter to that family history.” (TCC Bar/Bat Mitzvah service)

Starting with the pre-history that describes the origins of the world and the human race, we’ll speed forward giving an overview of the different major periods of our history. We’ll end up with a review of the different phases of emigration to America and save time to share our own family journeys and stories.
results.name: Adult Perspectives - A Whirlwind Tour of Jewish History

group.name: The City Congregation for Humanistic Judaism

results.description:
Let's see "Lady in the Van", an uplifting film based on a true story.  Critics write this performance is awards worthy.

We'll see the 4:00pm show.  Anyone interested can join us for a bite afterwards at Puck Fair (terrific Irish pub).  I highly suggest you purchase your tickets ahead, especially if you'll be arriving too close to start time.

Go here to purchase tickets and watch trailer:

https://www.angelikafilmcenter.com/nyc/film/the-lady-in-the-van

Truth is stranger than fiction in this comedy-drama based on the real-life tale of a homeless woman named Miss Shepherd (Maggie Smith), who parks her van in the driveway of a house owned by playwright Alan Bennett (Alex Jennings) and lives there for 15 years. Over the course of her stay, the two form a unique friendship.

Puck Fair menu:  http://www.menupages.com/restaurants/puck-fair/menu
results.how_to_find_us: Meet in the lobby no later than 3:45, just inside the ticket purchase booth
results.name: Watch "Lady in the Van" at the Angelika Film Center

group.name: Bay Ridge Book, Game and Social Club

results.description:
Join us for a Brunch at Ponty Bistro in Gramercy. We're visiting the south of the Mediterranean. This  North & West African  French restaurant is known for their Victorian Lac Salmon, Moules Africana, and Longlet Al Echalote (grilled steak and yucca mash potatoes)


You can start your Monday with a smile. This will be fun at a laid back local place with good food. Menu <a href="http://www.piccolacucinagroup.com/new-york-city-spring-street.htm"></a>

We meet at 3:45 and sit at the table at 4:00 promptly.


Please pay attention before you sign up for the event

Dining Rules:

This is not family style ordering. (individuals will order their own)There is only what you ordered, plus gratuity & NYC tax: Meal + 20% + 8.875%. No one should be responsible for anyone's meal.  Please bring cash 

This allows it to be easier on staff

Pay attention

Please note that an email will be sent the Sunday prior to the event - please reply to the email if attending.Those who do not reply to the email will be replaced by EWNYC members on the waiting list.This is why we encourage people to sign up if the event is full!

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EjrZxHGqKek

This will take place at the Harlem Location


Thank you


Olisa Fowlin


[masked]

ellen

group.name: Westfield Dinner and a Movie Meetup

results.description:
Hey guys - My oversight - I scheduled this on Super Bowl Sunday ..I've changed the date. 

Hey All,

It's that time of year..It's good practice to review our personal budgets at least once a year.  So I figured, why not do it at the start of the year with  a little support and beer by our side to keep us motivated through the process!

No worries - There won't be any sharing of personal details.  SIMPLE Worksheets will be handed out that you can use to individually work out your budgets.  I will be there to answer questions and briefly discuss key personal finance  topics like Debt to Income ratio etc.

If RSVP list is less than 10, the event will be cancelled.

Details of the bar:

 http://www.tryonpublichouse.com/
results.name: Budgets & Beer

results.description:
Ah, Spring! Rebirth, creativity, the old made new! Join us on this lovely Spring afternoon and celebrate your own creative spirit by enriching the world with your wonderful drawings!

We've got one terrific nude model offering short and long poses in a comfortable, quiet, studio environment. We get a great audience of artists of all levels of ability from total beginners to seasoned pros. There's no instruction and no pressure to share your artwork, unless you want to (If you're looking for classes with instruction, check out some of our other sessions).


Bring your own art materials and expect to have a great time! (a medium sized pad and some pencils, charcoal or even crayons if you're not sure what to bring).

All ages are welcome
Bring your own art materials
No photography

Conversation language practice all levels, groups of 4-10 people
Languages & Culture groups we will separate into
English - Spanish - French -Italian - Portuguese - Chinese - Japanese - Korean - Russian - German - Arabic - Hebrew

SCHEDULE
4 pm-4:30 Introductions by the bar!
4:30 pm Language sections are placed out
7 pm event ends, people go to dinner in groups

CHECK-IN
$3 before 5:30pm / $4 after 5:30pm / $5 after 6pm.

**This event is for members of Language Exchange NYC & guests only. If you are not on the list it will be $6 to join. Waiting list people will be allowed in if there is space. We will turn away people at the door if they are not members or a guest**

Happy hour pricing for the group, beers $3-$6
Burger sliders for $3

RULES
• RSVP, Buy a drink, tip the bartenders
• We take attendance so notify in a timely manner. 3 strikes rule.

**No business promoting, or dating group behavior will be tolerated**
We REMOVE members that break our rules, are rude, aggressive or socially inappropriate towards our members at an organizer's discretion

LIKE OUR FACEBOOK PAGE! www.Facebook.com/LanguageNYC
results.name: Language Exchange Sunday

results.description:
This is a class in technique although, when you've conquered a song technically, then I will coach musicality and performance. Class size is limited. Fee is $20/per. You may audit the class once for $10. Let me know when you sign up if that's your intention.

Room assignment will be printed on the electronic billboard opposite the elevators on floor 16.

People at the front desk are helpful and friendly and the Cafe on the floor has great latte and cookies, sandwiches, <a>pizza</a>, etc.

I've been asked to post this:


Dear Members:  I am Mr. Harrington's agent/rep. Mr. Harrington teaches privately coaching established actors and singers. For years his private rate has been $120/hr for this service. He started teaching through Meetup earlier this year and has as his goal to bring professional level instruction to the public at a rate that leaves no one behind. This demands tight scheduling of both his time and the room rental with Ripley-Grier Studios.For these reasons, I will be insisting to him that "no shows" be dropped from the group. The policy is this: If you RSVP you better show up. If you cancel you better do this by 4:00 pm the previous day.A word to the wise...Michael T. Harvey
results.how_to_find_us: Room assignment is posted on the 16th floor electronic billboard.
results.name: Voice / Singing Class -- Sunday afternoon

results.description:
For 40+ years WFMU DJ Irwin Chusid has tried—and failed—to launch a calypso revival.


His campaign invades Union Pool in Brooklyn on Sunday, March 6, when he spins a two-hour calypso set from 4-6 pm.


Come celebrate four decades of failure with platters by Mighty Sparrow, Lord Kitchener, Duke of Iron, Mighty Zebra, Wilmoth Houdini, Two Gun Smokey, Lord Melody, and others. Union Pool stocks the following rum: Sailor Jerry, Malibu, Gosling’s, Bacardi, and Flor de Caña. (Irwin highly recommends 1, 3, and 5.)


The party continues when WFMU’s Dave the Spazz commandeers the turntables at 6 pm.
results.name: WFMU Calypso Invasion at Union Pool

results.description:
This is a fun & unique event where you can go back in time and relive the days of the American Gangster. At the same time, make some new friends, meet some singles...and maybe more!

We will meet for a pre-mingle at 4pm at a local bar/pub near the museum, where we will hand out the tickets and head over to the museum at 5pm for our 5:30pm private tour.

The pre-mingle location will be sent to the email address used to buy ticket, closer to event date. Food/drink will be available for purchase at pre-mingle. This event is not meant to be a gender balanced or age/ethnic specific. All are welcome.

Package for the tickets & pre-mingle - $29.75 to $39.75 (depending upon how early you purchase your ticket). 

Get your tickets ASAP at this link - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/gangster/dates/Mar-06-2016_at_0400PM

Must Prepay to attend. An RSVP alone will not hold your spot. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FiRbqNyVskg

About the Museum: 

Housed in a former speakeasy, the Museum of the American Gangster isn’t obvious on a casual stroll down St. Mark’s Place. If visitors know to look for number 80, though, they pass through a black gate and up a flight of stairs, where a plethora of artifacts and exhibits awaits. 

The museum focuses on American organized crime through the decades, which includes profiling mob bosses, Prohibition-era gangsters, serial bank robbers, and dastardly Scooby-Doo villains. 

The New York Times praised co-owner and tour guide Lorcan Otway as "so encyclopedic that touring the rooms takes hours," as he expounds upon America's unique relationship with hedonism and straight-laced morality. 

In the Wall Street Journal, correspondent Alexandra Cheney mentions noteworthy finds including the museum's genuine Tommy guns, vintage whiskey bottles, and old copper stills. 

Why my RSVP says +30? This is a multi-Meetup and we'll have 30+ members from various groups attending. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.

The museum focuses on American organized crime through the decades, which includes profiling mob bosses, Prohibition-era gangsters, serial bank robbers, and dastardly Scooby-Doo villains. 

The New York Times praised co-owner and tour guide Lorcan Otway as "so encyclopedic that touring the rooms takes hours," as he expounds upon America's unique relationship with hedonism and straight-laced morality. 

In the Wall Street Journal, correspondent Alexandra Cheney mentions noteworthy finds including the museum's genuine Tommy guns, vintage whiskey bottles, and old copper stills. 

Why my RSVP says +30? This is a multi-Meetup and we'll have 30+ members from various groups attending. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  

Prepay only at this link - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/gangster/dates/Mar-06-2016_at_0400PM

results.description:
Concert with Harry Bolick, Sunday, 6 March, 4-6pm


Tap your feet to the tunes of master fiddler, Harry Bolick, in concert, co-sponsored with The <a>Good Coffeehouse</a>. We're at the charming, historic Old Stone House in J.J. Byrne Park, 336 3rd St. between 4th & 5th Aves., Brooklyn. The music commences at 4:00pm, doors open at 3:30. Your contribution at the door, a mere $10! Questions? Call[masked]-3195.

Born in Mississippi, Harry has focused on the classic fiddle tunes of his native state. Other states share many tunes and approaches to playing, the Mississippi tradition stands out for its unusual melodies and rhythms. The University Press of Mississippi has just published his book, co-authored by Stephen T. Austin, "Mississippi Fiddle Tunes and Songs from the 1930's." Because of Harry's efforts, Mississippi tunes are starting to show up more consistently at fiddler's conventions and gatherings.

Bolick has 8 recordings to his credit and performs in the "Wahoo String Band", leading duos and bands under his own name. He also teaches fiddle and mandolin. Hear samples of his playing, traditional tunes and some originals on his website: http://harrybolick.com/

Trains: D, N & R at 9th St.; F & G at 9th St.
results.name: The Good Coffeehouse Concert - Fiddler Harry Bolick

results.description:
We are happy to announce that the 4th installment of Cupcake Wars in now scheduled for Sunday March 6th[masked]pm.  A Young Mother's D.R.E.A.M. is continuing our effort to raise money for scholarships.  This year the goal is $5000 to help 5 young mothers in pursuit of their education. Please come out and support our DreamChasers!

Cupcake Wars is a competition where contestants will bake 2 different flavors of cupcakes each and compete for the Grand Prize of $500 and a special prize for the People's Choice Winner.  The attendees get unlimited cupcakes and the opportunity to vote for their favorites.  Every year we have a great turn out and our sweet tooths are more than satisfied.  Join us!!

Katra 217 Bowery NY NY 

https://cupcakewars4.eventbrite.com


A Young Mother's D.R.E.A.M. is a 501c3 non-profit organization. Our mission is to assist young/teen moms, 16-23yrs old in completing their education through a one-on-one mentorship program. To motivate them to become more accomplished individuals. To instill determination, resilience and excellence as core characteristics for these mothers. To work together to decrease teen pregnancies by promoting healthy choices, goal setting and education.
results.name: Cupcake Wars 4

If you are on the list and do not show up or cancel the day of meetup and dont pay, you will be banned from the group.

results.description:
Acclaimed pianist Emir GAMSIZOGLU is performing classical recitals at historic Caffe Vivaldi, known by movies of Woody Allen & Al Pacino.

Every Sunday from February 28 - April 3, 4:00pm

During the month of February and March we have the most favorite works of Frederic Chopin in the concert program.

TICKETS: $20 : www.chattypianist.eventbrite.com

"Every Sunday afternoon, this veteran pianist plays to a crowd at Caffe Vivaldi. Beyond tickling the ivories, he shares fun facts about the music he plays and the composers who created it. Not a classical music connoisseur? Trust me, you don't have to be. It's nearly impossible not to be captivated by the music, let alone his charm and passion. Plus, the performance is truly spectacular, and the level you'd hear in a concert hall for a fraction of the price" Read more about the Chatty Pianist Sundays at "Tracy's New York Life" http://www.tracysnewyorklife.com/2016/02/new-york-chatty-pianist-caffe-vivaldi.html


Caffe Vivaldi offers a great brunch/lunch menu, coffee/tea selections, desserts & full bar; www.caffevivaldi.com

PROGRAM:

Frederic CHOPIN [masked]) 
Op.69, No.1 - Waltz No.9 in A Flat Major, “L’Adieu” 
Op.53 - Polonaise in A Flat Major, “Heroic”
Op.67, No.4 - Mazurka No.45 in A Minor
Op.28 - Prelude No.15 in D Flat Major, “Raindrop” 
Op.66 - Fantasie-Impromptu in C# Minor 
Op.Posth. - Nocturne No.20 in C# Minor

INTERMISSION

Op.23 - Ballade No.1 in G Minor, “Konrad Wallenrod“ 
Op.28 - Prelude No.4 in E Minor, “Suffocation“
Op.10, No.12 - Etude in C Minor, “Revolutionary” 
Op.Posth. - Polonaise in B Flat Minor, “Adiéu” (1826) 
Op.68, No.4 - Mazurka No.49 in F Minor, “Last work“ 
Op.27, No.2 - Nocturne No.8 in D Flat Major 
Op.64, No.2 - Waltz No.7 in C# Minor
results.name: Chopin @ Caffe Vivaldi

Meet at the wooden gazebo located at the 48th St. side of the park at the lower level by the water. It's located not too far from the bathrooms near the street ramp. You can also click the location link near the meetup date & time for a Google Earth GPS view of the meetup location.

The walk will take approximately 45-60 minutes depending on how much we walk. We can walk more if the group decides to. I'll wait around 5 minutes before walking. If you're running late, post a notification and we'll wait. 

Please update your RSVP if you can't make it. We will not walk if it rains. Also, I recommend wearing sneakers to the walks. If you have any questions/comments/concerns, you can post a notification or email me through the meetup site.

Welcome back Fun Gamers!

First, thank you all for joining our MeetUp Group, "Fun & Games".  

[[ NOTE -- 

Why not bring someone new this week & introduce them to our little family of friendly gamers?...  ;-)

-- NOTE ]]

Come & have some fun!!!

I look forward to seeing you all there!...

FYI for the new meeples, we're averaging a solid 20 ppl per week now (just not everyone RSVPs...)  Speaking of RSVPs, I know MeetUp has a cut-off for RSVPing if you decide to show late so please don't let that hold you back...  I'd love for you to all RSVP, but it's definitely not a requirement (the only requirement is to come and have fun!)

Which Panera?... How to find us?...

• http://www.meetup.com/Fun-And-Games-Meetup-Tenafly-Northern-New-Jersey-NJ/messages/boards/thread/48006932

George

results.description:
All you love is gone. The Stilt-Sands, a floating city you have called home since birth, was torn to pieces before your eyes. Ensorcelled before the disaster, you could do nothing to save anyone but yourself, watching the horror as if it were nothing but a bad dream.

Your refuge is the Salty Cormorant, an odd amalgamation of pirate and Navy vessel. There, you came fully back to your senses, and are filled with nothing but rage and pain. And you aren’t the only one. You, and the other 300 survivors, have been robbed of home and health, and there are others who would see it righted, or avenged. You are told that you sail for Precipice Port. A fortnight cannot pass soon enough. Until then, you will find out everything the crew of this strange ship knows, to find some clue about the terrible beast He. However, you are not alone in this pursuit. The evil that trapped your minds has followed you, and it is not done with you yet. 

Stilt-Sand Survivors is the first chapter in the new WildPig Exclusive Campaign "Vengeance at Sea" by Noah Anderson, set in the “Ten Isles” setting developed by Noah Anderson in association with the WildPig community. All players are welcome. Characters are 1st level, with a limit of 8 players per session. There will be time for character creation a half-hour before the first session. Seats are limited, so please register ahead of time.
results.name: D&D 5E: Vengeance at Sea Chapter 1 - Stilt-Sand Survivors

5:00-5:15: Requisite fifteen minute schmoozing.
5:15-6:15: We write for an hour, a la the "Shut Up & Write" meetups.
6:15-6:25: Replenish mind and body after intense and gratifying writing session via the ordering of food and drink.
6:25-8:00: We critique, in a a supportive way, two pieces from group members. The two pieces will have been designated the previous week. These files are available through the "Files" section on this site.
8:00: Sad farewells, until next week.

We look forward to seeing you at the Sunday AWG Meetup. Any questions, please feel free to contact us through this site.

PLEASE NOTE: You must attend at least one meetup before submitting a piece for review.

PLEASE NOTE AGAIN: It's probably a good idea to bring headphones and a music player, as it's unpredictable what sort of background noise is going to be going on during the writing session.

All files to be critiqued on Sunday are available from the "Files" section, which is under the "More" Menu at the top of the page. The direct link to the "Files" page is:

results.description:
Happy Super Soul Sunday! Kick off the week on a fun and positive note with a group of awesome people! We really hope this start of a weekly tradition. The whole intention of this group was to have a place where we could meet and inspire one another, so this meetup is going to be less of us "teaching" and more of a relaxed community get together--just like-minded individuals solving each other's problems, motivating one another, or just chatting about common interests. Whether the conversation goes deep or shallow, it's gonna be a great way to spend an early Sunday evening. Please bring a small appetizer, (quasi-) healthy snack, or a bottle of wine! And feel free to bring a friend, even if they aren't on Meetup.com.

What you could bring:

-Vegetable tray

-Fruit plate

-Chips and salsa/guac

-Chicken wings

-Bruschetta

-Shrimp and dip

-Chicken kabobs

-Vegan options

-Sparkling water/alternate beverage 

Julie is bringing her fab home-made sangria and Stephen's bringing pita bread and hummus :-D

123 East 18th (btw Park Ave South & 3rd)
Sunday, March 6th
5:30pm optional drinks, 6:30 pm dinner
$71 Includes 3-course dinner, gl wine tax/tip

Please ignore the RSVP headcount here, all of our events average 20-40 members of my dinner group, The Single Gourmet. Please go to this link and prepay, you must prepay in order to join the event as we seat by demographic and I guarantee headcount to restaurants.
http://thesinglegourmet.net/event/paul-jimmys/
We are a members-only dinner group and for 34 years have been dining in restaurants in NYC and worldwide. As a meetup member you can join a dinner before signing up. We dine at 50-60 restaurants per year and do not list many of our other events on here.

For 66 years this red sauce ristorante has filled the bellies of New York's Governors, Mayors and celebrities from musicians to actors to sports stars. According to Zagat, “they know what they’re doing at this family owned Gramercy Italian, supplying solid, old school staples.” A true immigrant success story, Cosmo Azzollini started waiting tables here in the 1950’s, borrowed to purchase the restaurant, handing it on to his son and current owner Lois Azzollini, whose son Gregg is the executive chef. Chef Azzollini, started his restaurant experience as a child working next to his father and grandfather, studied at the Institute of Culinary Education and worked with Mario Batali at Lupa Osteria before moving to Tuscany to focus on the finer points of traditional Italian cuisine at Ristorante Tonino. Paul & Jimmy’s was awarded “Five Star Diamond Restaurant Award” by American Academy of Hospitality.

results.description:
TNYA Water Polo is an LGBTQ friendly team with practices at John Jay Sunday from 6:00 – 7:30 pm, and Tuesday 8:00 or 9:00 - 10:00 pm at the Chelsea Rec Center (for Rec Center  members only). For full information on the team, please go to 

www.tnya.org

The first practice is free and we love getting new players! Please let the coach on deck know if it's your first time with us and feel free to message Alex Barclay ahead of time if you have any questions. You will need to bring a swim suit appropriate for water polo, a towel, goggles and a lock. If you would like to practice with us regularly, you must become registered with US Water Polo at the silver level and pay our annual membership dues. 

We ask that any practice participants have some prior experience playing water polo and be able to swim a hundred yards in a row in less than two minutes. If you have a swimming background and are interested in learning water polo, please read the pdf below thoroughly and contact Alex Barclay. The coaching is typically geared to an intermediate level of play and we do work on basic skills at every practice. Everyone should be familiar with the basic rules and concepts of the game, as outlined in this pdf: 

http://www.tnya.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/Polo_Beginners.pdf

Practices typically include a swim set and some conditioning at the beginning, drills, and scrimmaging for the last 30-45 minutes (it's also ok to sit out and watch for the scrimmaging portion if it's your first practice). The first and third Sundays are geared towards scrimmaging and the second and fourth are more focused on skills and/or conditioning. Bob or Jeff are the typical coaches. We strive to create a positive and welcoming environment and do not tolerate any unsportsmanlike conduct. There are at least four tournaments we compete in each year and practices will adjust in the weeks before the tournaments to prepare participating players.
results.how_to_find_us: Walk in. Pool is straight ahead. Tell the desk you're there for water polo.
results.name: TNYA hosts All Level Water Polo

results.description:
You will leave this seminar knowing how to manage your breath and entire body in singing so you can sing without tension. Also, you will learn tips and tools to use to "flow" your body through specific vocally challenging phrases. We will start with a full diaphragm and body warm-up. All body balance, movement, physical release and diaphragm training now come together as your entire voice improves and is more dynamically expressive. Now, singing feels easier!
This workshop will be filmed to be turned into an e-course product and for your participation you will be given access to all 6 workshops for your continued study. Bring a song or aria you know well but are having a challenge singing.
The tuition for this workshop is $35. If ordered here. Registration is limited. Book your seat now by clicking here that you will attend. The system will lead you through registration. If the system does not take your registration you can register at this link at eventbright...
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/putting-it-all-together-in-the-music-tickets-22129157907
please contact me if you have any other questions.
Singers, voice teachers, actors and speakers are invited to come and gain an appreciation about why this work is setting a new standard for vocal support. And, it also increases your expressiveness and joy!
results.name: Putting it all Together in the Music

results.description:
The Dead Rabbit Grocery and Grog embodies the conviviality of Old New York and the Irish-American tradition.


Their ground-floor Taproom offers an informal setting for the enjoyment of craft beer, bottled punch, and whiskeys of the world.

Upstairs, their sumptuous Parlor focuses on small plates, communal punch, and 72 historically-accurate cocktails dreamed up by the nineteenth century’s most celebrated bartenders.

They sport the title of World's Best Bar 2015, and countless other bar accolades over the past few years, so the drinks are sure to be GREAT! :-D

For those interested in eating, in addition to their dinner menu they offer daily specials. On Sunday they offer Roasted Prime Rib with Yukon gold whipped potatoes, Yorkshire pudding, brussels sprouts, carrots, jus. YUM!

As if the food and drink isn't enough to lure you on Sunday, they have a live Irish music performance during 6:00 - 9:00pm.

Please confirm with Irina Z if you are interested in having dinner. As they don't take reservations, you will assemble early at 6pm to get a table, and added folk can join later in the evening by the bar to enjoy music and cocktails.

Have fun! :-)
results.name: The Dead Rabbit - Irish Music, Cocktails & Food (Optional)

results.description:
Please join The Animals’ Battalion in protesting Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus. at the Barclays Center arena- LET’S SHOW THEM THAT ANIMAL ABUSE IS NOT WELCOME IN NEW YORK!

www.ringlingbeatsanimals.com



WHEN: Sunday March 06, 2:00PM – 3:00PM,  6–7PM

WHERE: In front of Barclays Center, 620 Atlantic Ave., Brooklyn, NY 11217 accessible by the 2,3,4,5 trains (See this map.) http://goo.gl/maps/IVX0G

Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus is known for its long history of abusing animals. In 1929, John Ringling ordered the execution of a majestic bull elephant named Black Diamond after the elephant killed a woman who had been in the crowd as he was paraded through a Texas city. Twenty men took aim and pumped some 170 bullets into Black Diamond's body and then chopped off his bullet-ridden head and mounted it for display in Houston. Ringling Bros.' cruel treatment of animals continues today.

Elephants in Ringling's possession are chained inside filthy, poorly ventilated boxcars for an average of more than 26 hours straight—and up to 100 hours at a time—when the circus travels. Even former Ringling employees have reported that elephants are routinely abused and violently beaten with bullhooks (weapons that resemble a fireplace poker) in order to force them to perform tricks.

To learn more about Ringling's lengthy history of abusing animals, check out PETA's factsheet. http://circuses.com/pdfs/RinglingHiddenTruthFSetc.pdf

There will also be protests every day Ringling's will be at the Barclay Center.
results.name: The Animals’ Battalion: Ringling Brothers Circus Protest @ Barclays Center

Each week following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity dozens of people get together following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity for socializing, eating, beverages and connecting.  It is a fun and casual way to meet others in the group in a fun and relaxed setting.

You can meet the group on the steps to the church following mass and walk over together or you can meet the group at the bar.  It is easy to find us.

St James Gate is a very casual Irish Pub.  Grab a seat at the bar or you can sit at a table to eat and drink.

Pay as you go for food and drink. A full menu is available

Can I come alone? Yes, many of those attending come on their own.

Do I need to be a member of Holy Trinity to attend? No, people come from all over the tri state area to our events.

Do I need to go to the 5:30 mass to go to the gathering?  No, you can attend your home parish and join us for the party. 

How long does it last?

Usually around 9ish

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
#drinkingaboutmuseums #NYC improv comedy theatre edition! Wait, what!?!? That's right, improv comedy theatre edition. Please join us for a social gathering at The Love Bar and performance at Peoples Improv Theater, aka The PIT. Follow The PIT on Twitter and Instagram (@thepitnyc). 

We'll gather Sunday March 6, 2016 starting at 7PM at The Love Bar. Come into the bar and look for the group. The Love Bar has small personal pizzas, bags of chips and pretzels available if you want snacks before the show. All drinks and food items are à la carte, so feel free to order anything you'd like individually or by starting tabs. 

At around 8:00PM-8:15PM we transition to the entertainment portion of the night with "At The Museums with Mulll and Neville." The show begins at 8:30PM at The PIT Underground. In this Siskel & Ebert style review show, Tracy Mull (@sandwichJOY) and Wiliam Neville (@WillyBNev) analyze various New York City museums that they go to as the #museumbuddies. Special thanks to William Neville for reaching out to our meetup about the performance! 

IMPORTANT TICKET INFORMATION!

RSVP via Meetup for our group, but please purchase your tickets in advance for the performance, here. Tickets are 5 dollars. First 5 RSVPs on Meetup will receive complimentary tickets. For complimentary tickets message me directly via Meetup with your name, title and professional affiliation once you've RSVPed. 

Tweet @nealstimler or @RadtkeDrew. Contact us via Meetup with your concerns or questions.

This meetup is for those in the arts, culture and entertainment industries, particularly designers, developers, entrepreneurs, museum professionals and creative technologists. Note: Please only RSVP if you are coming to the event. 

It is important we keep slots open for those committed to attending. Having an accurate count of attendees is also important to our relationships with event partners. Come ready to be social and introduce yourself to the group.


Again, for this event you must purchase a ticket for the performance at The PIT prior to and separately from the Meetup page. The PIT Undergound has limited accessibility, as it can only be accessed by stairs in the basement.
results.name: #drinkingaboutmuseums #NYC "At The Museums with Mulll and Neville"

ASIA $999 - 14 Day, 4 Country Group Tour

We'll be joining GEC travel club members from all over the US and Canada on this super affordable (yet NO hostels!) 14 Day, 4 Country, Asia Group Tour for just $999!

Travel March 6 - 19, 2016 on this Super Affordable Global Expeditions Clubsmall group tour through Asia: 14 days, 4 countries, and starting at only $999! During this trip you'll have a chance to visit the ancient temples of Angkor Wat (7 Wonders of the World runner-up), the stunning beaches of Thailand, the Taj Mahal (7 Wonders of the World recipient), & the exotic and exciting city of Kathmandu, Nepal.

-----------------------------------------------------------------

Pricing and Booking:

PRICE: $999 plus air & optionals

CLICK HERE for details & to book your space on this tour.
(NOTE: a meetup RSVP does NOT reserve your space.)

-----------------------------------------------------------------

GROUP TRIPS:  are typically 10-15 +/- people and they tend to sell out 1 - 3 months before departure, so be sure to book your space soon.  These small group trips are open for anyone to join. You can sign up as a solo traveler (roommate matching is free) OR join with friends, a spouse, or other family members. All are welcome!  

GET THE SCOOP! Want to see what GEC travel club members are saying? Then check out the Global Expeditions Club's Testimonial Page.

-----------------------------------------------------------------

Included in the awesome adventure:

* Expert English speaking local experts for select tours
* Global Expeditions Club Leader
* Small group tour of Asia
* Global Expeditions Club Trip Leader Start to Finish
* Expert English speaking local guides for select tours
* 13 nights lodging in excellent affordable hotels (NO hostels)
* Airport transfers during trip
* Option to purchase the following add-ons
  - Angkor Wat Day Tour
  - Boat Tour to the Floating Villages of Tonle Sap Lake
  - Thai Cooking Class
  - Koh Phi Phi Islands Boat Tour
  - Delhi Highlights Tour
  - Taj Mahal Day Tour via Train
  - Kathmandu 2 Day City, Temples & Valley Tour

Need help booking your airfare?  Just email me or give me a call at[masked]

Click Here For Complete Details and to Book Your Space on the Trip.

>Places Visited: Asia Group Tour, Angkor Wat Cambodia, Tonle Sap Lake, Phuket, Koh Phi Phi, Delhi, Taj Mahal, Kathmandu

----------------------------------------------------------------

The Global Expeditions Club is a group of fun-loving travelers looking for other like-minded people to travel the world with.  The travel club started 8 years ago with just a handful of meetup members, but has grown into one of the largest travel clubs in the world.

Check out the Global Expeditions Club's Testimonial Page to see what others are saying about these trips.

Of course, if you have any questions you can always contact me or one of the other organizers through meetup message or via phone at (617)[masked]

Make Friends. Travel the World.
