results.description:
ICELAND: Northern Lights Group Trip

CLICK HERE to book your spot.

The wait is over.  Hunt for the Northern Lights on this group trip to Iceland!  Join your fellow travel club members from all over March 6 - 10, 2016 on this exciting group tour to Iceland! 

NASA recently predicted that we are in the peak years of an 11 year cycle for the Northern Lights.  So that we don't have to wait another 11 years for them to max out again, we're going hunting for the Northern Lights this March in one of the world's best destinations, Iceland!  Join this group tour as we seek out the Northern Lights and while there why not join the group and visit the famous Blue Lagoon spa, walk on glaciers, see the famous and spectacular waterfall of Gullfoss, watch geysers spouting, visit a volcanic national park, and so much more!  And all with a group of fun, like-minded adventurers.

-----------------------------------------------------------------

Pricing and Booking:

PRICE: $899 (airfare additional)

CLICK HERE to book your spot.

NOTE: a meetup RSVP does NOT reserve your space. For prices, details and to book your space on this tour, please CLICK HERE

----------------------------------------------------------------- 

PLEASE NOTE: trips are typically 10-15 +/- people and they tend to sell out 1 - 3 months before departure, so be sure to book your space before they sell out!  These small group trips are open for anyone to join. You can sign up as a solo traveler (roommate matching is free-OR you can get your own room) OR join with a spouse, friends or other family members. All are welcome!

GET THE SCOOP! Want to see what other club members are saying? Then check out the GEC Testimonial Page.

----------------------------------------------------------------- 

Included in the awesome adventure:
* 3 star hotels
* Small group tour of Iceland
* Northern Lights tour
* Global Expeditions Club Leader
* Expert English speaking local experts for select tours
* 4 nights lodging in an excellent 3* hotel
* Breakfast daily
* Optional Blue Lagoon Hot Springs
* Optional Golden Circle Waterfall Classic Day Trip
* Optional 12 Hour South Iceland Day Trip and Northern Lights Hunt

Need help booking your airfare?  Just email me or give me a call at[masked]

Click Here For Complete Details and Booking.

Places Visited: Group Tour of Iceland, Northern Light group tour of Iceland, Reykjavik, Optional Blue Lagoon, Nesjavellir power plant, Thingvellir volcanic park, Waterfall of Gullfoss, Seljalandsfoss waterfall, Solheimajokull glacier walk (Myrdalsjokull), Reynisfjara black sand beach, Skogafoss Waterfall, pouting hot springs of Geysir and Strokkur, northern lights (weather dependent)

----------------------------------------------------------------

The Global Expeditions Club (GEC) is a group of fun-loving travelers looking for other like-minded people to travel the world with.  The travel club started 8 years ago with just a handful of meetup members, but has grown into one of the largest travel clubs in the world.

Check out the Global Expeditions Club's Testimonial Page to see what others are saying about these trips.

Of course, if you have any questions you can always contact me or one of the other organizers through meetup message or via phone at (617)[masked]

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on your Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually attending from all the groups participating.  If you have questions regarding this event contact the host directly at [masked] or call[masked]-2256.

THIS EVENT IS NOT EXCLUSIVELY FOR MEMBERS OF ANY PARTICULAR POLITICAL PARTY, IT IS OPEN FOR ALL TO ENJOY.  Our gathering is first and foremost a Happy Hour for people to come together and socialize.  Secondly, it is a great way for everyone to keep tabs on all the current candidates and thirdly a great way to see the debate if you don't have access to the channel it is on that night!!   Arrive at 6:30pm for socializing and cocktails, grab a bite to eat then sit back and catch all the action on dozens of large monitors. This will be the Republican Debate.

This event is meant to be a fun and interesting way to kick off the political season. If you attend all we ask is that if you feel strongly about any candidate you keep your comments educated and dignified.  If you feel like you may get too passionate and cause arguing we would appreciate if you watched at home!

Do I have to be a Republican to attend? NO. NO. NO! This event is open to all to get an idea of what the candidates are all about.  We will have parties for the Democratic Debates as well

Can I come alone? Yes, 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

What should I wear?  Most people are coming from work so they will have on their work clothes, business casual

Is there food available?  Yes they have an awesome menu, separate checks no problem.
results.name: Presidential Debates Viewing Party

results.description:
https://youtu.be/SY7l51L1eQM

★★★★★ ‘Theatre at its most seductive’ Evening Standard
★★★★ ‘Heady and intoxicating. A brilliantly revived adaptation’ Daily Telegraph
★★★★ ‘An evening to richly savour’ Guardian
★★★★ ‘Electrifying. Funny, moving and uncomfortably provocative’ Sunday Times
★★★★ ‘Janet McTeer is absolutely magnificent’ The Times
★★★★ ‘West is great as Valmont, a booming, lusty bounder’ Time Out

Following the hugely successful broadcasts of Coriolanus and King Lear, National Theatre Live brings the Donmar Warehouse’s highly anticipated new modern-dress production of Les Liaisons Dangereuses to cinemas - broadcast live from the Donmar’s London home. 

Directed by Josie Rourke (Coriolanus), the cast includes Elaine Cassidy (The Paradise), Janet McTeer (The White Queen) and Dominic West (The Wire).

In 1782, Choderlos de Laclos’ novel of sex, intrigue and betrayal in pre-revolutionary France scandalised the world. Two hundred years later, Christopher Hampton's irresistible adaptation swept the board, winning the Olivier and Evening Standard Awards for Best Play. Josie Rourke’s revival now marks the play’s thirty year anniversary.

Former lovers, the Marquise de Merteuil and Vicomte de Valmont now compete in games of seduction and revenge. Merteuil incites Valmont to corrupt the innocent Cecile de Volanges before her wedding night but Valmont has targeted the peerlessly virtuous and beautiful Madame de Tourvel. While these merciless aristocrats toy with others’ hearts and reputations, their own may prove more fragile than they supposed.

IMPORTANT TICKETING INFORMATION

Tickets are $24 and can be purchased here.  To receive the discounted price on this and other National Theatre Live screenings, you are invited to join The British Film and Television Meetup Group.

I will be hosting another event in the same venue earlier that day, so will likely be snacking in the area in between.  Details to follow later.

Be sure your communication settings allow you to receive updates to this event.  

Originally posted 2/22/16
results.how_to_find_us: Details to follow; watch this space.
results.name: NTL Live:  Les Liasons Dangereuses

results.description:
Hi I’m Debbie and I wanted to share more about myself and why I created this group. I know firsthand the difficulties in letting go of a toxic relationship. For me, my mind was saying one thing - to let go - but my heart was saying something else. Even though I knew in my mind the relationship I was in was toxic, my heart just could not break the ties and I was determined to do whatever it took to hold on. Thankfully, with the support and encouragement of like-minded community, like this group, I was able to let go and move onto healthier relationships. Today, I no longer need an intimate relationship to make me feel whole. I became a certified addiction recovery coach and created this group to share all that I have learned and to create a space for us to connect.  In this group, we will support one another in making healthier choices, which attract healthier relationships, and be in community with people, just like you & me, who are looking to heal from toxic relationships and take back our lives. 

In this meetup, we offer more than just talk. This group is a safe and supportive environment for sharing fun, experiential activities that will facilitate healing and help you develop a deeper connection to yourself, which is the key to creating health in all your relationships.

Some of the questions we will explore at the next meeting will be: 


What or who are you looking to draw closer to you?

What or who are you attempting to let go of?

Toxic or Unhealthy relationships can be experienced with intimate partners as well as with friends, parents, siblings, children or work relationships. Come share about the effects of unhealthy relationships in your life. We will also share about what a healthy relationship looks like and how we can begin to have a healthier relationship with ourselves.

Meet others struggling with the same issues. Have fun, while experiencing meditation, deep sharing, role-playing, educational readings and structured exercises within a safe and supportive environment.

Members will learn how to: 

Attract people who are available and capable of treating you with the love and respect you deserve 

Make healthier choices and heal from toxic relationships

View your relationships in a new and different perspective

Group will meet 1-2x month on Sundays 7:15PM - 8:30PM 

Introductory Rate $10 per Session

Facilitated by a Certified Addiction Recovery Coach, Certified Addiction Peer Advocate, Life Skills Coach and Independent Health Coach

This week's special-bring a friend get half off the next session.

 This group is more than just talk. It is all about support, sharing and encouragement. Please come join me and lets support each other.
results.how_to_find_us: Side door facing Kohl's
results.name: Heal From Toxic Relationships

results.description: We meet every Sunday night from 7:30-8:45 pm at South Mountain Yoga. We do a 20 minute guided meditation (usually one of Thich Nhat Hanh's), walking meditation, and a 20 minute silent sitting. Jean also picks a reading. At the end, there is time for sharing (optional) as a way to practicing listening and speaking about issues of mindfulness in our week, sittings, and daily lives. No experience is necessary.  There is a suggested donation of $10. Please try to arrive on time and refrain from wearing fragrances.  Cushions and folding chairs are available or you can bring your own. Please note: many sangha members attend the group without responding here on meetup.
results.how_to_find_us: Next to the Chase Bank; next to the sound garden. One flight walk up to 2nd Floor. Parking on street or in parking lot behing the buiding. No meters on Sunday.

results.description:
New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street

 with  Spencer Weisbond

Six week, progressive session : Jan 24, 2016 - March 6th
Sun
7:30PM - 8:30PM & 8:30PM - 9:30PM
# of Sessions: 6
Except:  Feb 7th No class!
  102: Advanced Beginner -  7:30 -8:30pm Advance in Jitterbug and East Coast Swing by learning more involved patterns with harder footwork. Build your dance vocabulary and partnering skills. This class is the prerequisite for Lindy Hop (level 3), which is the grandfather of all swing dances and has 8-count patterns. No partner needed


  103: Lindy Hop﻿ Pre-Intermediate 8:30- 9:30pm
Bring all your moves together into complete sequences. Learn new eight-count patterns to make your dance more intricate and expressive.  

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]
Level one is now on Wednesday nights!
  Register and pricing below:

  Level 102:  http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=643452342</a><a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=631564381">

Level 103: http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=643452358</a>

<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=625351562">

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3400 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. www.SwingRemix.com </a>

<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135408">

results.description:
5v5 indoor gym soccer

With a smaller field and fewer players on a team, the quick-paced indoor soccer game helps players keep in shape and sharpen skills during the cold winter months. 

Why play with us:

Teammates are highly supportive & everyone gets involved in play.Play is at a good level, but not too competitive. No rough playing is ever tolerated.It's a friendly & diverse group. Meet new people and make new friends.   Share a laugh, conversation, and talk about your favorite soccer player. It's a fun workout indoors. We sometimes go out after our games.

Play according to your own schedule! Frequency of games make it simple. Unlike soccer leagues, there is no commitment for a season.
results.name: Indoor gym soccer-Fleetwood

results.description:
I want to thank everyone who came out for this. there wasnt alot of us as typically at this meetup but it was good to see everyone. The comics were a full top Comedy Central line up too. For those of you who havent been to this, This is a special Meetup, we finally got a deal with Stand Up New York the hottest club in New York City to let us in free of charge and see comics like Amy Shumer, Godfrey, Kevin Brennan and top names, this is NOT an amateur show like alot of the meetups. I just ask that everyone who Rsvp's really do their best to show up AND MAKE IT ON TIME. as you know I dont charge for this meetup so come out see the hottest comedy show and maybe even make some new friends. this sundays line up includes the below.

Host: James "Maddog" Mattern brings you: Mike Cannon (Guy Code), Nore Davis, Greer Barnes (Chappelle, In Living Color), Sam Morril (Last Comic Standing, Comedy Central), Damien Lemon (MTV Guy Code) and pretty much any comic you see on Comedy Central these days drops by and shows up on the lineup who knows who might drop by usually its Amy Shumer or Judah Friedlander.

An Organizer will be at the front end of the bar by the iphone charger as usual to meet with everyone and give you tickets for free admission and have everyone sit together so we can all share laughs. Try to be early the show starts at 8 and everyone sits at same table but i do this earlier so all of you can meet your fellow meetup members. This is a 2 show ticket typical value $40.00, Drinks are half price before the show. so if you show up for the 8 you can stay for the ten also which has a different but also comedy central lineup. Or if you would like to come for the 10 you can just say meetup at the door and they will point you to me.
results.name: Comedy Central Meetup at Stand Up New York Free, Half price drinks before show

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
Watch the Debate #7 with us!

Theater in Asylum, with the NYC chapter of the Democratic Socialists of America, is preparing to create theatrical adaptations of the Democratic Primary Debates. With a small army of actors, designers, dramaturgs, and support staff, we will watch and analyze the debates, devise a piece, and present it live in NYC. Join us for the first step: watching the debate live on TV.

This Debate starts at 8pm but get there early for a good spot!!

Learn more about the theater project: http://www.theaterinasylum.com/debates.html
results.name: Debate #7 Watch Party

results.description:
10,000 PB&Js is a volunteer led organization meets each week in White Plains & the lower east side to make and assemble several hundred meals and then distribute them in small teams throughout Manhattan to the homeless. 

The PB&Js and Hershey Kisses are their starting point: a means to begin a conversation, to listen and lay the foundation of trust necessary to offer more substantial help.

This event is for PB&J DISTRIBUTION:


Volunteers gather on East 11th for orientation, then break up into teams of 3 or 4 volunteers who distribute food, clothing & toiletries on pre-assigned routes. Finish times vary by team: some will be done before 11 pm and other teams might work until midnight. 

THIS IS A RECURRING EVENT!
10,000 PB&Js typically feeds a couple hundred neighbors each Sunday and would be thrilled to extend a up to 6 distribution spots for our group each week!


TO JOIN
Please email P.J. directly at [masked]. Or check out their Meetup group: www.meetup.com/10000PBandJs
results.name: Volunteer with 10,000 PB&Js

Hope you are all well and enjoying the Fall.

I am offering an Energy Transmission on Sunday Nights at 10PM, especially for weight loss!

Good nutrition is the core, for good health and successful weight loss, and good energy nutrition is important as well.

This will help you to relax, recharge, replenish, and will help you with stress eating, cravings, and to keep focused, and to feel better about your body and yourself.

A special and delicious vitamin essence, will fill you up with good nutrition, which will help you fill up with the good stuff, therefore you will feel more satisfied with less food, and helps you to absorb the nutrients your body needs.

This will also relax and strengthen your adrenal glands, and help to revitalize all of your glands and organs.

I really hope you enjoy this gift, and if you have any questions  concerns, please let me know.

Jae

*** If you haven't joined our Facebook group yet, make sure you do! That's where a lot of the action happens: links to our photo albums, extra workouts, happy hours, random funny meme postings, you name it!

facebook.com/groups/therisenyc

----------------------------------------------

This one workout will keep you amped up all week long. Seriously, give it a try and you will be hooked!


The exercises may change from week to week, but it is always a Tabata-style interval workout: 20 seconds of high intensity work followed by 10 seconds of rest. Then repeat! Exercises include sprints, burpees, squats, situps, box jumps, step ups, pushups, dips, and other “no-frills” exercises.


Warm up beforehand by running, biking, or walking. We start promptly at 6:30 AM and the workout only lasts 31 minutes. Show up a few minutes early to meet people and get yourself pumped up.

results.description:
Every week we will have a different prompt for our weekly photo project.  This week’s theme is Express Yourself

Each week beginning early Monday morning, you can begin uploading your photos to our meetup album for the week’s theme.  The group won’t actually meet for this event, it’s an individual online challenge for each of you to get your creative juices flowing, share photos in the group, comment and critique each other’s shots, and above all have fun. 

Albums will remain open, so you can upload photos any time after that Monday morning start time but you’ll get the most feedback during the initial week the theme is posted.  You also don’t have to restrict yourself to photos taken during that week for the theme, they can be from past shoots you have done or the weekly prompt can be used to motivate you to shoot something new.

Please consider sharing your project photos with our other chapters on our Facebook group.
results.name: Weekly Photo Project - Express Yourself

During fall and winter, ACT Programs offers the Indoor Playstation, for children five years old and younger. Playstation offers the chance to continue the fun experiences of the park in A.C.T. warm and spacious gymnasium, complete with child-size equipment that includes slides, balls and places to crawl, all on a safe mat area. Parents or caregivers must accompany and stay with their children at Playstation. Come meet with old and new friends. The Playstation is open Monday through Thursday from noon to 3 PM. results.description:
* THIS MEETUP IS THE FIRST SESSION. REGISTER SEPERATELY HERE FOR THE THURSDAY SESSION.

ICANN's 55th Meeting takes place this week in Marrakech, Morocco. ISOC-NY, in partnership with Civic Hall, will host a NYC remote hub for the two Public Forum sessions. The hub will be fully interactive, with 2-way video, and refreshments will be supplied. This is an important opportunity to participate in the Internet Governance process at a critical time in ICANN's development - not just the finalization of the IANA transition, casting off the reins of the US Government, but also other critical issues, such as the further advancement of the TLD expansion, what to do with the millions of revenue from same, how to resolve the conflicts between privacy and transparency in determining a new WHOIS framework, and much more. The issues will be broadly defined at the first Public Forum session (Noon-1:30pm EST Monday March 7) where there will be some time for clarifying questions, and then fully discussed at the second Public Forum session (8:30am-11am Thursday March 10). You will be able to address the entire ICANN Plenary from the remote hub. Please join us at Civic Hall and have your say!

What: ICANN 55 Public Forum NYC Remote Hub
Where: Civic Hall, 156 5th Ave NYC, 2nd Floor (at 20th st)
When: Public Forum 1 - Monday Mar 7 noon-1:30pm EST
Twitter: #ICANN55 + NYC
results.name: ICANN55 NYC PUBLIC FORUM REMOTE HUB MON

results.description:
Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

"That was absolutely amazing! I don't think I have ever fully let go and quieted my mind like that before. I feel so inspired. By the end of the session I was filled with so much love - love for myself, for others, and love coming from Source. Unconditional, pure love. Thank you." C.L.

"Instead of the 'knowledge gained', I find it appropriate to give a 5 star to 'raising my vibrations' during the meditation.... the energy of the group was Amazing and ZINGING! Thanks... " - S

"Thank you Tracy for a wonderful start to the day. Amazing calmness capturing everyone's energy on the class. Look forward to attending the next on-line class. Thank you." - B.J

"Very enlightening and a positive way for those that can't make it physically to do so remotely.""Thank you, the second section moved me the most. I had a real moment of knowing who I was, am and always be. results.description:
Want a job at your dream startup?  Come join Byte Academy students for a presentation given by Vettery, a tech hiring market place.  Only launched a few months ago companies using them include:  Uber, Blue Apron, Hinge, Jet, Casper and more of the hottest, fastest growing startups.  You'll get the latest tips and tricks from the experts. Please sign-up in advance, as a limited number of spots will be open to community members.


About Vettery:  Based in New York City, Vettery is a trusted hiring marketplace built to help tech candidates find their dream job. They take the best from the recruiting and technology worlds by connecting employers and talent through a curated marketplace of vetted candidates.  Sign-up as a candidate is free.  This is a highly valuable resource for engineers in particular.


 About Byte Academy : Byte Academy offers intensive full and part-time courses that emphasize full-stack programming using Python and industry-oriented programs such as FinTech (financial technology), Data Sciences and MedTech.  Byte Academy is the first coding bootcamp in the world to offer a Financial Technology (FinTech) program and the first in New York City to teach full stack Python. Small classes, career services and placement including access to top industry professionals and events are included in the program.  Byte Academy offers comprehensive financial aid and all women receive $2,000 scholarships. Byte Academy accepts applications on a rolling basis for all courses which start every 4 weeks.

Byte Academy was just nominated for the Benzinga FinTech Awards, please vote here to show support http://bit.ly/1Ljq2DJ
results.name: Want to Work for A Startup? Tips & Tricks from Vettery

group.name: Byte Academy: FinTech, Data Science, Python Coding Bootcamp

results.description:
SIGN UP HERE


Join us for a special panel event moderated by 25 year photographer representative, Frank Meo, as he sits down with Joe Lombardo (photo rep at ETC CREATIVE) and Andrea Kaye (Art Production Manager McCann New York) as they discuss the best ways for photographers to promote themselves. These pros will discuss the process and ways to break through the clutter and see positive results. Why does one promotion work better then others? What type of follow-up works best with an Art Producer and Creative Director? Who should you target with your promotion and how often? These questions and more will be answered by this panel of pros!


Frank Meo is Director of Found Folios, an online global search engine that markets and connects photographers to art buyers, editors and clients. For 25 years, has represented photographers that include Pulitzer Prize winning photojournalists in securing highly valued commercial assignments. He has worked on hundreds of company photo libraries and campaigns for clients such as American Express, Acura Motor Sports, US Coast Guard, Xerox, ESPN, Citi, Nike and others.


Joe Lombardo of ETC CREATIVE is a representative with 15+ years of experience and based in New York City, has a diverse background as an agent in both the commercial advertising and fashion worlds. 


Andrea Kaye, VP Executive Integrated Producer and Art Production Manager McCann New York, has been working as an Art Producer/Art Buyer at large New York advertising agencies for over 30 years.
results.name: Successful Promotion: Art Producers Reveal Their Preferences

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

results.description:
As a business owner, you need to continuously network and always be making new connections. It’s how your business grows—relationships are at the very core of any business. But sometimes, that’s not as easy as it sounds.

Cold calling is hard, and introducing yourself to strangers on the street doesn’t sound like a good idea. So where do you look?
Right here with us! that's where :)

Before joining, there are a few things to know about unique to the organization.

Only one service professional is allowed in our group in each specialty so there’s no competition for referrals.
You can only represent your full-time profession (no part-timers allowed).
Every member is required to participate and offer referrals.

results.description:
Come join Bi+ and Bi-friendly people from the greater NYC Area in a lively topic-oriented discussion at BiRequest's famously open, non-judgmental, safe space. If you can't make it to the meeting, feel free to join everyone afterward around  "eight-fifteenish" for dinner.


2016 Scheduling Change:  Starting in January 2016, we're adjusting our discussion meetings to accommodate our late shift workers and evening class students.. Hopefully if you have class on (the first) Monday, you can make it on (the third) Thursday of any given month.    

About us: Thanks to the dedication and hard work of many good bisexual folk, BiRequest continues the work of hosting biweekly discussions and monthly social gatherings serving the New York City metropolitan area; we've been rocking our bi selves since January 1994. We provide a safe space for bisexuals of ever stripe (bi, fluid, queer, pan, omni, sapio, and so many more).  And we welcome bi-friendly people to gather and discuss issues of importance to us.

We're a co-ed group for adults from 18 to 80-plus who meet twice a month every 1st Monday and 3rd Thursday evening at NYC's LGBT Center in the West Village. The meetings are moderated and focused on a discussion topic but not limited to that week's topic.

After the discussion we go to dinner at a nearby, reasonably-priced restaurant for socializing and more informal discussion.  We also have occasional social events such as movie nights, parties, and much more. Join us for a meeting or event and find the community you've been looking for!

People who can't make it to the meeting are invited to join our private online group BiRequest on Yahoo or on our Facebook Page BiRequest on Facebook.
results.how_to_find_us: "check the front desk for "BiRequest" meeting room."
results.name: 1st MONDAY !   BiRequest Meeting

group.name: NYC's Bisexual, Non-Monosexual & Queer Meetup Group

results.description:
To RSVP, please send an email to: LindaEwen at nyc dot rr dot com, with your first and last name.
Cloud Computing has become an accepted technology, with companies large and small adopting it to run their businesses. What is it? What types of Cloud Computing are there? How can it help me in my business?
Daniel Lewis, tonight's speaker will answer these questions and tell you about the services New York Cloud Systems offers. Tonight, will not have much Microsoft Access, but basic questions are welcome... just email them to Linda before the meeting, so she can prepare an answer for you.
We plan on meeting on the 1st Monday of every month, but occasionally there are changes. You should receive an email, if there's a change. I suggest you print out any email response you receive, even though it's not required. The Conference Center's security department, requires your first and last name, so please include your full name, within the body of your email. A photo ID is mandatory. Sometimes, the map on this meetup link above, is incorrect, so please write down the address. If you don't get an email back from anyone, within a day or two, please send a 2nd request.It's OK, to be half an hour early and use the free coffee machine. Try to go early, if it's your first time, in case you are not registered properly. If you arrive, and the the security personnel informs you of a registration problem, don't be alarmed, they will assist you. Please be patient. For those who sent their first email request, on the day of the event, this process may take half an hour, and the cut off time for confirmation is 7:00 PM.
results.name: MICROSOFT ACCESS - special cloud presentation

results.description:
Route to be determined that day.  This is a fast paced workout, less of a social event due to the cooler temps and darkness, therefore will be limited in size. Everyone goes on the waitlist. Please read the event in it's entirety and respond to the questions asked when you rsvp.

Make sure you have a copy of the map and a headlamp If you fall behind during the hike, you must be prepared to finish on your own. Faster hikers are not obligated to wait for slower hikers. You must feel comfortable hiking on your own should you fall behind. We would love to have everyone join but due to the nature of this event we can not make accommodations for those who are unable to hike independently. This is not mean, it is for your protection as well as the safety of the group. We will hike a minimum of 4 miles and 1200 EG. If you are unsure whether or not this is for you, please email me with any question.


Heavy rain may cancel and would be determined that day if necessary.

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike

results.description:
Fireside chat with Jenna McAuley who serves as Mercer's Chief Information Security Officer. She is responsible for establishing, executing and maintaining the enterprise vision, strategy and program to ensure that Mercer’s physical and digital information assets and technologies are adequately protected. 

Prior to joining Mercer in June 2015, Jenna served as the Northeast Regional Lead for Ernst & Young's Cyber Threat Management practice. In that role, Jenna delivered comprehensive security solutions for a wide cross-section of industries. Jenna has designed and delivered security monitoring and operations functions, secure application development and lifecycle programs, penetration testing and vulnerability assessments, incident response programs and integrated threat intelligence capabilities.  

Jenna has been a featured speaker for several conferences, including the 2016 LegalTech Conference on the topic “Cyber Security Threat - Are Mobile Apps and Internet of Things Gateways to Security Breaches?”,  2013 North America Information Security Risk Management ISACA Conference, where she spoke on “ Responding to Targeted Cyber Attacks” and the 2012 Annual Information Systems Security Association (ISSA) Conference, where she delivered a presentation entitled "Active Defense-- is the best defense a good offense?"

Jenna is an active participant in several industry associations, including Infragard, the partnership between the FBI and the private sector and the Executive Women's Forum, an association of women in the fields of Information Security, Risk Management and Privacy.


Mason Harris, CCIE #5916, is the Chief Solutions Architect at vArmour, a cloud security startup based in Mountain View, CA. He is responsible for all enterprise and platform architecture in both private and public cloud deployments.

Previously he was a Technical Solutions Architect for Cisco focusing primarily on security architectures in the data center. Mason has more than 24 years in systems architecture and is one the few individuals in the world that have attained five CCIE certifications. He also holds the CISSP, GPEN, and GCIH certifications.

When not thinking about security topics, Mason can be found backpacking on long trails or at home with his family. A lifelong UNC Tarheels fan, he holds an undergraduate degree from UNC-Chapel Hill and a master's degree from NC State University, with a minor in Arabic.

Did you know that your employees are a bigger threat to corporate data than hackers?

Compaas

is new age cybersecurity software that helps businesses secure their data in the cloud. Our dashboard allows IT to implement policies and monitor activity across all of their storage solutions from a single spot.

Adam Moisa is the Co-founder & CEO of Compaas Labs, a “Compliance as a service” new age cybersecurity software that helps businesses secure their data in the cloud. Adam is a serial entrepreneur in the software industry and advises for many early-stage startups. 

Additional Agenda: TBD

Event Description

On March 7th, join cigar and scotch aficionados from across the tri-state area for a special flight tasting featuring two cigars from Ventura and a personalized flight tasting of scotches from Deanston, Bunnahabhain, Ledaig, and Black Bottle. Guests will also receive additional special gifts from Ventura. 

For 24 hours, tickets are just $40. After that, $50 online / $60 at the door. 

Dress code: business casual. Bring business cards for our raffle for free scotch!

Scotch Selection

Choose Your Flight of Three

Journey with us as we trek across the Scottish country-side, from the rolling Highland regions to the famed Islay region.  For your flight tasting, choose three of the following scotches.

Deanston Virgin Oak

Bunnahabhain 12

Bunnahabhain 18

Bunnahabhain Toiteach

Ledaig 10 Year

Black Bottle (or Black Bottle Old-Fashioned cocktail)

Cigar Selection

Guests will receive two of Ventura Cigar's most highly rated cigar lines, the Psyko 7 which we debuted in 2015 at The Carnegie Club, and the 805 Natural, along with other cigar swag.  If you haven't experienced the Psyko 7 or the 805 Natural, this is an event you cannot miss. Both blends are comprised of tobaccos rarely used in cigars. 

* You must be 21 or older to purchase tickets to this event. Those under 21 will not be allowed entrance into the club.

**By signing up for this event, you give FineTobaccoNYC permission to send future cigar event invites via email.
Refund policy: a full refund in the form of credit toward a future Fine Tobacco NYC event is available until 24 hours before an event.

RESERVATION ABSOLUTELY NECESSARY TO RESERVE YOUR SEAT!

http://www.veganizernyc.com/upcoming-pop-ups.html


About Pagani:

Pagani is an italian hot spot loved by many. The cuisine is italian inspired by Executive Chef Mark Barrett. The menu is very meat and fish centric which exotic sauces.

Veganizer's head chef, Hadara Slok, has worked one on one with Mark to veganizer every dish.

About Veganizer:

Veganizer takes each restaurant's menu and serves it exactly as is on the evening of the event, however, it is in vegan form. Veganizer works one on one with the Executive Chef to create a mouth watering one time experience like no other. These events sell out fast because NYC is craving new and healthy cuisine outside of the traditional restaurants that we all know and love.

About Chef Hadara

Chef Hadara has a resume longer than most and Veganizer is thrilled to be doing their first event collaboration. She has traveled throughout the entire US as a chef and consultant. Her recipes can be found in Whole Foods, TGIF Fridays and more. Her favorite cuisine is Mexican as she has spent much time studying Latin cuisines. She is also the founder of Rawclates, the raw, organic and vegan premium chocolate company. She is a mother and entreprenuer and anyone who tries her cuisine will love every bite.

Monday, March 7, 2016 from 6:00 PM to 10:00 PM


WHERE


289 Bleecker St - 289 Bleecker Street New York, NY 10014

results.description:
Come enjoy eats at one of NYC's newest veg spots as NYC Vegan EatUP's head herbivore Demetrius Bagley dons his astrologer hat, and reflects on what's happening with the stars above (and thus the Earth below). 

Make your way back to the party room, find a seat, place your order, and start eating around 6:30. Sit back and listen 7 to 8. 

This month, he'll discuss the energies of Aries! 

Note: this session is intentionally geared for astrology beginners. 


Attendees must buy at least $10 worth of food and/or drink from VSpot Organic, this event series' gracious host. Everyone will receive their own bill. A suggested donation of $5 is requested for the speaker. 


Demetrius Bagley is an award-winning movie producer (Vegucated), and nationally recognized events producer. He’s godfathered projects like Vegan Street Fair, SoCal VegFest, Veggie Conquest, and many others. Since 2004, he’s led NYC Vegan EatUP, one of the world’s largest vegan Meetups. Recently, he wrote about being a 20+ year vegan in “Letters to a New Vegan”.

Demetrius is also an internationally published astrologer who wrote Vibe Magazine's celebrity horoscope column 2010–2011. He published and sold customized annual Personalized AstroDatebooks from 2007–2013. In 2012, he project coordinated the anthology book, “Astrology: The New Generation”. He is the marketing & design dude for the annual State of the Art (SOTA) astrology conference.

results.description:
***NOTE*** This group is currently full and we are not accepting new players.

INTRODUCTION:


The truth about the Keys of Power has long since been discarded as just so much myth and legend. But one of those Keys has just resurfaced and numerous factions are dead-set on possessing it. This means certain doom for the poor souls who've stumbled upon it.

Are these unfortunate souls mere pawns in a greater game? Do they even know of that which fate has cast their way?

If they are truly unaware of the significance of that which they now possess, it would be to their benefit to become aware of it. Fate and destiny have converged upon them and, before long, many will vie to possess the item they hold. Many will seek to become the Keeper of the Keys and our intrepid adventurers stand in their way.

BACKGROUND:

"The Keeper of the Keys" is a home-brewed, Dungeons and Dragons campaign. I am looking to run this campaign as part of the Edison MeetUp group. However, I cannot run/attend a weekly game. My schedule simply does not allow for it.

So I'm setting this group up as a bi-weekly game; sort-of. Specifically, I will schedule a recurring MeetUp for the first and third Monday of each month beginning with February 15th, 2016. I will also schedule a bonus MeetUp for the fifth Monday of those months that have five Mondays. This means our first four meetings will be February 15th & 29th and March 7th & 21st.

I am looking for a group of players willing to commit to the schedule I propose; players whose attendance will not be an issue. These players also need to be ready to be involved in a long-running game.

Each time I've run "The Keeper of the Keys", it's encompassed almost the entirety of the PC's lifespan as adventurers. In other words, if you join and stay in my game, you can be fairly certain it won't end until your character has reached the maximum level of experience.
results.how_to_find_us: We meet at the top of the "up" escalator inside the Barnes & Noble store.
results.name: The Keeper of the Keys

results.description:
Our weekly Meet Up will take place at Scotty's Steakhouse and Comedy Cove in Springfield, just a bit off of exit 9B on Route 24! The address is 595 Morris Ave, Springfield.


There is a world of gaming outside of the traditional Monopoly, Scrabble, Risk, etc. Whether you're looking for something new and different, or you're a seasoned gamer, you'll find a friendly and welcoming bunch of friends to game with.  Be adventurous , come learn some new games or play your favorites!

We begin gathering around 6:30 pm and are fully underway by 7pm.

Because the event takes place at a restaurant that serves alcohol, there are strict rules against gambling of any form.  Guests under 21 are welcome, as it is a restaurant. Since they are letting us use the space for free, they expect that we will order food and drink, so there are some rules:

1.  No outside food or drink, not even bottled water.

2. Please plan on ordering food and/or drinks.  Support the venue.

3. Tip the waitstaff generously.  15% is standard, but 20% is even better. We want them to love having us there, and in this case, money does buy you love.


4. If you plan on attending regularly, please consider a small contribution to cover The Tipsy Meeple's costs for using Meetup.

We bring some of our games, but feel free to bring your favorites, or learn one of ours! And don't be shy about learning new games, we are more than willing to teach a new player! Can't wait to see you there.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be around the corner from the bar!
results.name: Game Night!

results.description:
Panel discussion on "Big Data - Small Devices" 

The amount of digitally recorded information in today's world is growing exponentially. Massive volumes of user-generated information from smart phones and social media are fueling this Big Data revolution. As data flows throughout every sector of our global economy, questions emerge from commercial, government, and non-profit organizations interested in the vast possibilities of this information. What is Big Data? How does it create value? How can we as digital consumers and producers personally benefit? While Big Data has the potential to transform how we live and work, others see it as an intrusion of their privacy. Data protection concerns aside, the mere task of analyzing and visualizing large, complex, often unstructured data will pose great challenges to future data scientists. We invite you to join us for an exciting discussion on the technological developments and sociological implications of this Big Data revolution. 


Please register here
results.name: Join us for an event on "Big Data - Small Devices"

results.description:
NOTE: HUI Central™ is our new name (formerly NUI Central).


6:30PM - 7:00PM - Networking

7:00PM - 8:00PM - "Express Yourself" Extracting Emotional Analytics from Speech


Affective computing is a flourishing branch within the digital realm that recognizes, interprets, and even fosters human emotional interactions. Typically analyzed by facial imagery, Beyond Verbal has developed a specialized approach by evaluating human voice.

The extraction, decoding and measurement of emotions introduces a whole new dimension of emotional understanding, which they call voice-driven Emotions Analytics. It has the potential to transform the way we understand ourselves, our emotional well being, our interactions with machines, and most importantly, the way we communicate with each other.

This talk will describe Beyond Verbal’s patented technology that analyzes emotions from a speaker's voice in real-time, as they speak, as well as details about the company's API, so you can add Emotions Analytics to your apps right now.

Yuval Mor, Ceo and Founder

Leading the Beyond Verbal team, Yuval has more than 25 years of experience in managing early stage, hi-tech companies and taking them to successful exits - four in total. Yuval studied computer science and economics in Tel Aviv University and has a MSc. in management from Stanford.

Bianca Meger, Director of Marketing

Born and raised on a farm in beautiful Namibia, Bianca acquired more than 14 years’ experience in establishing businesses in a variety of different countries and verticals. With a BA in Marketing Bianca has won more than 9 distinct marketing awards. Being extremely detail orientated, execution focused (and emotional) Bianca joined Beyond Verbal to take control over our marketing operations and strategic accounts management. 


8:00PM - 8:30PM - Hang Out - Network

Share this event:   @HUICentral  @BeyondVerbal

http://bit.ly/HUICen-32

Join HUI Central.com

"Express Yourself" (check out the song video)

IMPORTANT : If you come to the event and you are not registered on the Meetup site by 4:00PM on the day of the Meetup, you will have to wait to the side to see if there's room to accommodate you. If so, you will have to pay $10 to be admitted, else you will have to leave.

CODE OF CONDUCT

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

results.description:
Startup Discussion Workshop Night NYC


In our 10th event, we've worked with Japan's METI (Ministry of Economy, Trade & Industry) to bring 6 startups from Japan to our community in NYC. After introducing our guests, we'll hold breakout group discussions to learn more about their businesses and to exchange ideas with one another.

This is a fantastic opportunity for cross-cultural learning with entrepreneurs in our greater community. We'd like to invite new founders, established startup leaders, and people thinking of starting their own company here in NYC to join us to share wisdom and information across borders.

Learn about cross-cultural business and markets, discover new technology, and meet other founders and technologists. Join us at Pivotal Labs and hang out afterwards at a bar nearby!

Agenda: 

-6:30pm  Door opens/ Networking 
-7:00pm  Opening Remarks        
-7:10pm   Elevator Pitches - Crowd Reality, TRINUS, ES Corporation, Machizukuri Gift, Waris, Hanasuke 
-7:30pm   Group Discussions for the six Jpn startups & JPNYC Startups members 
-8:15pm  Announcements & Open Networking

Guest Startups from Japan 

Crowd Realty is a crowd-funding platform particularly focusing on both domestic and global real estate. Aiming for not only connecting global investors and wide range of demands for fund raising, relevant with real estate such as commercial property and revitalization of unused land by private companies but also creating a new capital market of secondary deals between investors. http://crowd-realty.com/global/

TRINUS, Inc. - Providing the platform where superb technology and sophisticated design come together, developing product concept as own companies' product and selling them on e-commerce site based on crowd funding securing customers and investments. TRINUS structures a new value chain for open manufacturing. https://trinus.jp/

ES Corporation - Laxus is a new paid rental service that costumers can borrow bags of worldwide brands with the membership of 6800 yen per month. Delivering cost is free and any scratches are subject to guarantee. You can borrow as many bags from Louis Vuitton, Hermes to Chanel as you want for an unlimited period. Whenever feeling bored with your bags, you can quickly replace them with new and popular ones. http://laxus.co/en/

Machizukuri Gift - We plan and develop products with regional resources of rural areas in an attempt to make sustainable economic community and recycling society. In addition, we help to make promotional video of the region as well as offering own unique marketing techniques to bring more turnouts to the region. The value of our service is to "find" "improve" and "deliver" the attractiveness of rural regions in Japan.  http://goo.gl/Ii5my

Waris, Inc. - For those who wish to work without any restriction by leveraging own knowledge and experiences or who wish to change the working standard that people work full time 5 days per week, Waris will help these women to meet companies encouraging flexible working style such as working three days per week or working remotely. Seeking to establish the society that every single person can take advantage of own ability and continue to pursue excitement in their work.  http://waris.co.jp

Hanasuke - Flower concierge from Hanasuke gives advices on choosing flowers as a gift and delivers the best flower from selective flower shops throughout Japan. Our new products and services that were inspired by needs of individual consumers create new ways of giving flowers as a gift. Flower concierge is more reliable than flower shops in your neighborhood and more convenient than any other flower networks.  http://www.hanasuke.jp/

A special thanks to Pivotal Labs for providing us a space for our event!

We hope that this event will be a place where Japan & NY people can come collaborate. Looking forward to seeing you all!

Masa, Yu & Toby
results.how_to_find_us: Take the elevator to the Second Floor.

results.description:
Java reflection allows us to peek inside objects that we don't know, find their classes and then call methods and set fields.  Great, but how can we use this practically in the "real world"?  In this talk,we start by showing how we find performance bottlenecks in Java using a profiler.  We check the profiler has found the mother lode by looking at the objects with reflection.  In our first example, we profile an open source tool that exhibited CPU bound performance issues.  We discover atypical bad coding paradigm and use Java reflection to test whether this bottleneck could be eliminated with a better hashing mechanism.  Our second example is a look at the new Java 8 hash function inside HashMap.  Debuggers hide the gory details of a HashMap from our prying eyes, so we use reflection to output the contents of the array of buckets.  This shows us essential data about the effects of the new hash function.  Java 8 HashMaps can perform 3x slower than previous versions!  Using reflection we show why that is.  This talk is mostly live coding, with a few slides explaining how we find performance bottlenecks quickly.


Presenter: Dr Heinz Kabutz writes the popular "The Java Specialists' Newsletter" read by tens of thousands of enthusiastic fans in over 134countries.  To sign up, visit http://www.javaspecialists.eu

Pizza and soda provided courtesy of Chariot Solutions.
results.name: Using Java Reflection to Debug Performance Issues

results.description:
Join us for dinner at the Whole Foods in Jericho on the first Monday of every month at 6:30 pm. What a great way to start off the week!

This VLI gathering is a casual event. Show up at 6:30, or later than that. It's fine to drop in when you can. The store closes at 10.

The food bar is vegan-friendly (vegan items are clearly labeled, ingredients are listed). You pay by the weight of your food. (A typical total is $10-11.) Please fill your bowl with vegan fare and skip the non-vegan stuff, in keeping with VLI event guidelines. Thank you!

(At VLI meetups, the food is always vegan, and everyone is treated with kindness. In other words, we expect everyone to enjoy a vegan meal together, even if you or your guests don't think of yourselves as vegan yet.)

Want to go greener? Whole Foods offers durable bowls, but not durable utensils. So you might bring utensils for yourself. You could bring your own water bottle, too.

RSVPs: even though this gathering is more casual than other restaurant outings, we still ask that you keep your RSVP up-to-date. That way, we know whom to expect & how many seats to save. Thanks!

Hope to see you!

results.description:
You are invited to join us for a data science study session. On Monday, March 7, Paul Siegel, data scientist at Brandwatch will present "Community Detection in Large Networks".


Summary:

Networks lie at the heart of many important tools in data science: recommendation engines, text graphs, stochastic processes, etc.  A key challenge is that the size and complexity of the networks which arise in real life make many of the standard graph algorithms impractical.  One strategy is to intelligently partition the network into smaller pieces ("communities") and apply the desired algorithm to each piece.  This can achieve dramatic improvements in computational complexity and enable the use of asynchronous processing frameworks such as MapReduce.  In this presentation, Paul will describe some useful partitioning algorithms and their applications.


Biography:

Paul earned his PhD in mathematics from Penn State in 2012.  His thesis was on topology and operator algebras.  Paul was a Ritt Assistant Professor in the math department at Columbia University from 2012 to 2015, and in August 2015, joined Brandwatch as a data scientist.  He is interested in the large-scale geometry and dynamics of social networks, with applications to social media marketing / PR.

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.


Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous.

results.description:
A gentle introduction to the changes that Angular 2 brings, how they compare to Angular 1, and provides an understanding of the architecture and how the core concepts work together to build applications. You will learn how your Angular 1 skills translate and prepare you to build Angular 2 applications. Code samples focus on specific features including Angular 2 components, templates directives, data binding syntax, modules, dependency injection, routing, Http, pipes, and services. All samples are written in TypeScript and run live on the web where you can see and edit them with a click of a button; no setup required.

About The Author: John Papa is a Google Developer Expert, Microsoft Regional Director and MVP, author of 100+ articles and 10 books, and a former technology Evangelist for Microsoft client teams. He specializes in professional application development with technologies including HTML5, JavaScript, CSS, Angular, Gulp, Knockout, C#, and ASP.NET. He can often be found speaking around the world at keynotes and sessions for conferences such as ngConf, Build, MIX, PDC, TechEd, VSLive and AngleBrackets. John is a co-host of the popular Adventures in Angular podcast and formerly was the host of the show Silverlight TV on Channel 9 and hosted many events including the MIXer and Open Source Fest at major conferences. He currently enjoys authoring courses for Pluralsight. You can always find John at johnpapa.net or on twitter at @john_papa.

Meeting Agenda: We have reserved the room starting 6:30 pm. Discussion about this month's  book will begin at 7:00.  Please come early if you would like eat and socialize first. You are welcome to attend even if you have not read the book.


 Dues: please remember to bring $1 for dues, so we can maintain the meetup.com site, thank you!

Book Description:

From GoodReads.com
With the publication of her first novel, The Heart Is a Lonely Hunter, Carson McCullers, all of twenty-three, became a literary sensation. With its profound sense of moral isolation and its compassionate glimpses into its characters' inner lives, the novel is considered McCullers' finest work, and an enduring masterpiece.

At its center is the deaf-mute John Singer, who becomes the confidant for various types of misfits in a Georgia mill town during the 1930s. Each one yearns for escape from small-town life. When Singer's mute companion goes insane, Singer moves into the Kelly house, where Mick Kelly, the book's heroine (loosely based on McCullers), finds solace in her music. Brilliantly attuned to the spiritual isolation that underlies the human condition, and with a deft sense for racial tensions in the South, McCullers spins a haunting, unforgettable story that gives voice to the rejected, the forgotten, and the mistreated--and, through Mick Kelly, to the quiet, intensely personal search for beauty.

Book Details:

results.description:
Gold coins! You love them. We have them in a stellar lineup for this GeoNYC. Not only do we have the Mayor's Office of Technology & Innovation (MOTI) and NYPD, but we also dive into some serious transportation issues – and then cap it off with mapping of the trials and tribulations of everyone's favorite Italian plumber.

We are excited to share pizza and chat with you at CartoDB in Bushwick (very short jump on the L-train to Morgan), where we will then more-than-likely talk about what our commute will be like if the L-train shuts down next year. 

OUR LINEUP:

> Jeff Merritt, Director of Innovation, Mayor's Office of Technology and Information (MOTI)
> Carson Qing, Transportation Analyst, AKRF
> Alex Chohlas-Wood, NYPD
> Stuart Lynn, Map Scientist, CartoDB
> Matthew Stevenson, Fathom Creative

----------
SPEAKER BIOS:

Alex, Chohlas-Wood, NYPD
Alex Chohlas-Wood, Director of Analytics for the New York Police Department's (NYPD) Office of Management Analysis and Planning, where he is implementing predictive algorithms and building a team to leverage the tools of data science in operations and planning. Previously, Alex directed short documentaries on urban infrastructure and led digital projects for the sculptor Tom Sachs. Alex holds a master's degree in Urban Informatics from NYU's Center for Urban Science and Progress and an undergraduate degree from Carleton College.

Stuart Lynn, Map Scientist, CartoDB
Stuart is a Map Scientist with CartoDB a company that specializes in beautiful online geospatial visualizations and location intelligence. He initially studied mathematical physics at Edinburgh University before deciding astronomy was prettier and easier to explain in bars and obtained a Ph.D. in astrophysics. He perviously worked at the Adler Planetarium as the technical lead of the Zooniverse: the largest collection of online citizen science projects. He is passionate about getting everyone involved in doing real science, collecting and analyzing data and making real discoveries about themselves and the world online.

Jeff Merritt, Director of Innovation, NYC Mayor's Office of Technology and Innovation
Jeff Merritt is an expert in the design and implementation of innovative civic engagement and good government programs with more than 15 years of on-the-ground leadership in the US and abroad. In 2014, he helped to establish the Mayor’s Office of Technology and Innovation, where he has led a range of technology efforts including the launch of the .nyc top-level domain and announcement of LinkNYC, New York City’s plan to build the largest and fastest municipal Wi-Fi network in the world.

Carson Qing, Transportation Analyst, AKRF
Carson Qing is a Transportation Analyst in AKRF’s Transportation Group, and joined the firm in 2013. Mr. Qing is responsible for transportation-related technical work, including data analyses, travel demand projections, traffic, transit, and pedestrian studies, and GIS applications. Mr. Qing has a multidisciplinary background with technical work experience and has supported transportation planning and economic analysis projects while at AKRF. Prior to working at AKRF, Inc., Mr. Qing was a research assistant at the NYU Rudin Center for Transportation, where he conducted research on topics such as emerging commuting patterns and the daytime population of Manhattan. 

Matthew Stevenson, Creative Director, Fathom Creative
Matt is the Creative Director at Fathom Creative. He also designs dorky minimalist video game art in his (rare) spare time and can’t wait for his 6-month-old son to pick up his first controller to join him in a round of Smash Brothers. On the internets he is known as DCMJS. Moving effortlessly between the realms of advertising, marketing, interactive and presentation design, Matt is a creative leader and expert visual communicator. With over 15 years of experience he has carefully cultivated the ability to bring out the best in design teams by giving them the spark needed to produce the highly effective campaigns necessary to propel clients’ brands in today’s media-enriched culture.

OUR SCHEDULE
6:30PM: The Mingle: doors, beer, pizza, people, etc
7:00PM: The Wonder: presentations followed by Q&A
8:30PM+: The celebrations.

The winner will be announced when Eszter and Alfred travel to New York City to address the Italian American Museum <a>on Monday, March 7th</a> on the situation in Sicily, their TV show and programing that they are doing, on “You Me & Sicily!" and of course, progress on the Sicilian Project. 

Please make a donation to our tax exempt organization and help our mission by simply following the link below and donate and based on the amount you will be automatically entered into our raffle. All proceeds go to our 2016 summer cams for kids in Sicily!

Click here to donate—> http://www.thesicilianproject.com/donate.html

When you RSVP, let me know if you will have dinner with us. We will have dinner after at the Grotta Azzurra Restaurant at <a>177 Mulberry St.</a> Our reservation will be set for <a>8PM</a>. Below are menu and price details. 

Menù: $35 plus Tax & Tip

Includes soda;  Does not include wine, tax or tip!

Hope to see you there!

Note: This Meetup is full... waiting list is open!                                      

                                    CLUB CINEMA FRANCAIS 

                              présente SOIREE CINEMA FRANCAIS !

                                  LUNDI 7 MARS 2016 @ 7:00 pm 

                            "La Cage aux Folles" 1978 Comédie

                the original French movie! (with English subtitles)

                        Spots available:  15  Waiting list is open.

                           Pour tous les niveaux.... for all levels. 

                Après la projection nous allons discuter le film.


SYNOPSIS: "La Cage aux folles" est une boîte de nuit qui présente un spectacle de travestis, dont la vedette est Zaza (de son vrai nom Albin). Il forme avec Renato un vieux couple homosexuel. Ce dernier a eu auparavant un fils, Laurent, qui lui annonce son futur mariage avec la fille d'un député. La rencontre avec cet homme politique très conservateur s'avère inévitable...
Michel Serrault obtint le César (equivalent to Oscar) du meilleur acteur en 1979. Le film a remporté le Golden Globe du meilleur film étranger en 1980.

Renato (Ugo Tognazzi) and Albin (Michel Serrault) are happy that their son, Laurent (Rémi Laurent), is getting married. Unfortunately, the bride's father (Michel Galabru) is a die-hard conservative -- and Renato and Albin are rather conspicuously gay. To ensure that the marriage goes off without a hitch, Albin uses his skills as a drag performer to play mom for a meeting with the in-laws. But, before long, both men learn that playing it straight isn't as easy as it seems!
results.name: CLUB CINEMA FRANCAIS !

results.description:
Men's Pick-up basketball in Hunters Point, Long Island City.

The cost is $10.75 for this session. 

Once you RSVP to a specific session, no refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before committing to that session.

It is a regulation sized court, but we divide it into two games simultaneously with each playing 4x4. We will do our best to break up the teams evenly at the outset, after which it's the luck of the draw based on who's sitting and who shoots in from the losing team. There will be a sign-up list for each court, and players from the losing team must shoot foul shots to play next, not be chosen by those already sitting.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. No fighting, rough playing, or screaming allowed. You will immediately be asked to leave the gym.

No food or alcoholic beverages allowed into the school. Save it for after the game.

All games must end by 8:45pm

From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson. Walk straight back towards the River to Center Blvd(in the direction of the city).

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

<a href="http://www.meetup.com/frenchies/events/172371032"></a>
results.name: French Monday's @ Cellar Bar
