results.description:
• Awaken your body and mind’s innate healing powers
• Develop healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Learn to work constructively with your own emotions
• Stimulate your minds innate problem solving capabilities
• Develop new resources and capabilities
• Become clear about your life’s purpose
Develop your intuition by tapping into the innate intelligence that resides within your body and mind
Our bodies communicate with us all the time. Many of us are so over stimulated and stressed out that we cannot hear what our bodies are saying. We age faster and suffer many health problems when we do not know how to listen to what our body is telling us.
Discover the amazing wisdom that resides within your own body. Ben will show you how to develop your sensory awareness. Learn to truly listen to your body and care for its needs.
Stimulate the mind's creative problem solving capabilities by learning to "digest" issues, emotions and stresses
Many of us have never learned how to work with difficult issues and emotions. We tend to push these things down inside of ourselves. Undigested thoughts, issues, emotions and the stresses of daily life create a residue that accumulates within the tissues and organs of our bodies. That creates a great deal of additional stress upon our body and mind. These stresses can arrest our process of development, disconnect us from the divine creative intelligence of the universe and shut down our intuition. It also causes our bodies break down at a more rapid pace and that accelerates the aging process.

Learn to use your body-mind's innate healing power to "digest and assimilate" your thoughts feelings, emotions, issues and life experiences. You will begin to release the stresses that are held within the body and to heal the painful emotions associated with anxiety, depression and emotionally traumatic experiences. You will also learn to go right to the source of the issues to bring about a resolution that allows you to really move forward in your life.
Working with these practices helps to increase your intellectual and emotional range, improve memory, initiate new cycles of growth, awaken inner passions, spark creativity and deepen intuition. You will develop the strength and resilience that will make it easier for you to adapt to the demands that life places upon you.
Discover the passion and power that resides within you
Chinese Martial Arts Masters emphasize the development of a base of power known as the "dan tien". The stress of living in such a fast paced world can cause us to disconnect from our foundation. Undigested food, emotions and the stresses of daily life begin to accumulate within the abdomen. We may experience bloating and suffer from various digestive problems. Some of us begin to lose touch with our drive, passion, inspiration and the sense of knowing that reveals our true purpose as our instinctual base shuts down.

You will learn to become fully present within your body, to develop greater personal power, and to awaken the inner passion and sense of knowing that will bring give you a greater sense of clarity about your life's purpose.

Activate the healing intelligence that resides within the body and mind
We all have a powerful healing intelligence that resides within our bodies and minds. This innate healing power helps to mend our bodies any time we suffer an illness or injury. Our innate healing powers are often compromised by the stress and toxins that accumulate within our bodies.
Learn to activate the generative healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Awaken the consciousness of the individual organs. Access and heal the emotions and core issues that are held within the body. These practices are very effective for healing digestive and respiratory disorders and a wide range of other health issues.


Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

I'm working out in the field much of the time and I have very limited access to the internet. Please call me at (913)[masked] if you have any questions and are interested in attending. I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can awaken the healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.

Please only YES RSVP if you are coming to the group

Sign up for my free monthly internet journal at http://www.doiohm.com...

results.description:
• Heal the emotional wounds of past relationships
• Transform deep seated patterns of abandonment and rejection
• Let go of unhealthy dysfunctional relationships
• Develop the ability to remain centered in the core of your being
• Become truly loving and accepting of yourself
• Develop a warm magnetic presence that will draw others to you
• Cultivate inner beauty
• Increase your capacity to give and receive love
• Attract a healthy and loving partner
• Create healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Develop a stronger connection with the higher power
• Learn to evolve spiritually through your relationships


My friend Sema was telling me about how she had fallen for a man, but he had not called her in some time. Sema told me that she felt this man would come back to her somewhere down the road. Yet she also acknowledged that on another level she was experiencing a fear of loss and that she didn’t feel that there was much hope for the relationship. Sema told me later that evening that she could never seem to hold onto the men that she truly wanted to be with.

Sema was obviously strung out on the man, but she was very disconnected from the underlying pain that was driving her. Sema’s head was just spinning in circles as she analyzed everything the man said or did and why he wasn’t with her at that time. I could see that the hurt buried within Sema was keeping her attached to the man in a very unhealthy way…

Does this sound familiar?

Many of us are struggling to find love. But no matter what we do, love always seems to evade us.

I’ve been there myself and I didn’t know if I would ever find the love that I desired. But I persevered because I was very determined to heal and have someone special in my life. I discovered a series of practices that have enabled me to heal the emotional wounds and to develop a magnetic presence. These practices are making it possible for me to attract more loving partners and to create healthier and more fulfilling relationships. I have now decided to share these practices and understandings so that others can also create more love and intimacy and to attract someone truly special.

Open Your Heart by Healing the Emotional Wounds That Carry Over From Childhood and Past Loves
Most of us are still carrying the emotional wounds from our childhood and our past loves. We try to block the hurtful feelings and memories out of our awareness. But these feelings and experiences remain trapped within our body and mind. We then give off a vibe that causes us to attract and become attracted to dysfunctional people who create even more confusion, pain and suffering in our lives.

Learn to “digest” the emotional baggage that keeps you trapped in unfulfilling relationships. Transform the deep seated patterns that cause you to attract people who are negative or abusive or who do not have the capacity to truly love you and be present with you.

Heal the loss of past loves. Heal the shame and the feelings unworthiness, rejection and abandonment. Become clearer about what you really want in life and in a companion. You will naturally attract and find yourself attracted to healthier people as you heal the wounded parts of yourself. More and more love will flow to you as you begin to experience true love and acceptance for yourself. Working with these practices will make it possible for you to cultivate inner beauty and to develop a presence that is very healing to others.

Develop the Kind of Warm Magnetic Presence That Will Attract a Healthy and Loving Partner
Many of us have learned to disconnect from our emotions and are not very present within our bodies. The stresses, emotions and life experiences that we fail to digest accumulate within our body and mind. These stagnant energies and emotions can extinguish our inner fire and passion. Stagnant energies decrease our desirability which makes us less attractive to others.

A body that if full of vital life force is infinitely more desirable. Become powerfully present while remaining centered within the core of your being. Exude warmth, passion, sensuality and desire.

Develop Your Intuition and Sensory Awareness
Heightened intuition and sensory awareness lets us know when it is safe for us to open up to another person. It helps us to understand where people are coming from. Our intuition also guides us to the people that we are meant to be with.

Use Your Relationships to Evolve Spiritually
Healing the hurts and resolving the issues awakens the part of the soul that resides within your body. Awakening your body-mind will enable you to develop a stronger connection with your higher self and the universal consciousness.

Develop Chi Power
Many systems of Chinese martial arts emphasize the development of the dan tien, which is our base of power in the lower abdomen. You will learn specific chi gong practices that will enable you to continually cultivate the chi/shakthi in the dan tien. Developing Chi Power enables you to create a powerful magnetic presence that draws others to you.

Create Healthier and More Fulfilling Relationships
Relationships have a way of bringing our core issues to the surface. Buried emotions and unresolved issues create barriers between ourselves and others. Our love grows stronger and our understanding deepens as we learn to “digest” our emotions, resolve important issues and express our feelings and needs in a healthy way.

Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

I'm working out in the field much of the time and I have very limited access to the internet. Please call me at (913)[masked] if you have any questions and are interested in attending. I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can heal from the loss of a love and develop a more attractive presence. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.

Sign up for my free monthly internet journal at http://www.doiohm.com...

Please go to http://www.facebook.com/healthyandlovingrelationships

and click on the LIKE button at the top of the page to join the community and gain access to new articles.

This session is open to all levels. Open to the public.

<a>Let us know you're coming.</a> 


We operate on a first come first served basis. Arriving by 6:45 is a good way to guarantee a seat.

• Bring your own drawing supplies.


• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break.

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp!

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes.

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there.

Simon
results.how_to_find_us: Ask for the drawing class on the second floor.
results.name: Live Model Drawing - National Arts Club

results.description:
Event Host: Sergio, http://www.meetup.com/Mere-Christianity-by-C-S-Lewis-Meetup/events/229185181/

Trinity Grace Church East Village is starting a 4 week book study on Mere Christianity by C.S. Lewis. The thought behind the book study is that we have a healthy discussion. The hope is that the discussion won't be a debate, but more of a safe space for people to say their point of view and raise questions. We will talk about big life questions, such as: "how do we define our moral laws?", "how can God be good if He allows suffering or how can we say that God exists because there is suffering?" and other topics. ***You do not have to have read the whole book to come. We will focus on a couple pages/topic per week, and there will be printouts available. However, if you fill out the form below, you will receive the reading/topic over email before each Monday.*** |When: Mondays (Feb 29, March 7, March 14, and March 21) |Time: 7-8:30pm |Where: First Ukrainian Assembly of God New York City (59 Cooper Sq, New York, NY 10003) |*Wine and cheese will be provided each week! |Form to fill out: http://bit.do/merechristianitystudy

About the Event Host:  Sergio is a members of Trinity Grace Church East Village, and he loves having philosophical discussions about topics we all think about - morality, the existence of God, the meaning of life, etc. He loves hearing others thoughts about these things.
results.name: Discuss 'Mere Christianity' by C.S. Lewis - Host: Sergio

results.description:
COME CHECK IT OUT FOR ONLY $5 BUCKS!

WRITE YOUR SCREENPLAY 

A Screenwriting Workshop With Award Winning Screenwriter Jacob Krueger

Whether you’re a young writer picking up the pen for the first time, or an old pro looking to inject new life into your writing, this exciting eight week workshop will teach you a whole new way of looking at the fundamentals, and help you integrate your artistic goals into your real world life. Jacob’s groundbreaking approach to feedback fosters a close-knit community of fellow writers, whose only goal is to support you in yours. Together, you’ll discover a new form of feedback that keeps the focus on what really matters: your story and how you want to tell it. Learn more.

About Jacob Krueger

Throughout his career, Jacob Krueger has collaborated with all kinds of writers, from Academy Award Winner Michel Legrand to Tony Award winners Alain Boublil and Claude-Michel Schonberg (Broadway’s Les Miserables).

Now, he brings his groundbreaking techniques directly to you, with unique Workshops, Master Classes, and Private Coaching designed for writers of all levels with an interest in writing.

Build the writers life you've been seeking today

"Jacob Krueger is a true collaborator, totally dedicated to the project, leaving his ego behind, but nevertheless demanding the highest standards because of his sharp dramatic sense and intuition."
--Claude Michel Schonberg / Composer, Les Miserables

MORE INFO:  http://www.writeyourscreenplay.com

MEETUP MEMBERS CAN JOIN AT ANY TIME.

NORMAL COST: $350

MEETUP MEMBERS:  Check out the first day of this workshop for only $5 bucks with no obligation!  (New Students Only!)

Class Size is Strictly Limited To Allow All Students The Opportunity to Workshop And Receive Feedback On Their Writing. You MUST RSVP to attend this event.

You'll LOVE this workshop or your money back!

results.description:
Let's head to Saltaire Oyster Bar in Port Chester on Monday March 7th for Hudson Valley Restaurant Week. We'll get a three course meal for $29.95 plus tax, tip and drinks.  I made a reservation for four people starting at 7pm -- we'll be seated at 7:30 and your $3 will secure your spot. I will post the HVRW menu when it is up. 

From the NY Times: 


Port Chester’s beautiful old granary warehouse, last occupied by the Willett House restaurant, has been repurposed once again, this time into Saltaire Oyster Bar and Fish House, a stylish, bustling restaurant and bar. The décor is uncluttered and smart, with nautical maps on one wall and heavy loading ropes with serious hooks filling in a corner or two, all leaving room for the luxury of well­spaced tables. With its many mix­and­match possibilities — a raw bar, small plates, seasonal specials, entrees and sides — the menu is designed to satisfy all appetites and wallets. 

Bobby Will, the restaurant’s creative executive chef, has pulled together unexpected yet harmonious flavors, and his culinary ideas are nowhere better presented than in the witty desserts: bitter, silken dark chocolate crémeux is soothed and enhanced by salted mascarpone, sweet golden raisins and (surprise!) a heady basil gel; chunky caramel­apple compote and brown butter crumbs that adorn a dome of pumpkin­spiced, evanescent cheesecake; and a cup of heavenly cappuccino whipped cream alongside miniature sandwiches (the ice cream kind). You get the idea.

From the raw bar, eight to 12 oysters are offered. Currently , they are mostly from the cold waters of the East Coast — Glidden Points, Fishers Islands, Beau Soleils, Moonstones, the infamous Maine Belons — and full of the salt­sweet personality developed from their terroir. Take your time, note the shell, chew to release more flavors, wait for the aftertaste. A number of interesting sauces are available, but they could overwhelm the oyster’s clarity. We take ours neat, the exception being Maine Belons, said to need lemon to counter their intense funkiness. Clams are also on board, and diners interested in sharing should check out the seafood “towers,” which also include lobster, shrimp, oysters, mussels and crab claws. 

Saltaire has even more to offer in small plates. Just when you thought there were no new flavors under the sun, charred octopus arrives wafting the cardamom and nutmeg of ras el hanout. Mussels are scented with fennel and tarragon, and, even better, Maine steamers (plenty for sharing) are bathed in a delicious, drinkable broth of celery and leek. Roasted pork belly mingled with cider­braised cabbage, pickled cauliflower and tangy mustard could have made a light supper; and a dollop of fig chutney awakened a soup of celery root and apple. 


Entrees, listed under both seasonal specials and Top of the Catch, seemed to overlap. The seared or grilled fish on the latter allow diners to choose a sauce and two sides. But this chef has such a knack for making old flavors new and exciting that we wished that all entrees came with garnishes already in place, like the bargains from the specials menu. Those included thick butterpoached hake with a zucchini and barley salad, tomato pesto and an unlikely but brilliant lick of creamy truffle ricotta, as well as the gently seared yellowfin tuna with a zingy olive tapenade, sunchokes and roasted carrots on the side. Five big, juicy shrimp came from Top of the Catch, and nothing was amiss with our pick of a roasted squash medley and a brown rice pilaf, or with wild king salmon, but we couldn’t help wondering what garnishes Mr. Wills would have chosen.
results.how_to_find_us: Please find us at the Bar
results.name: Let's go to SaltAire for Dinner in Port Chester for HVRW!

results.description:
Back By Popular Demand:  We are headed to Veganized Pagani!

This italian hotspot LOVED having a restaurant full of vegans and wants to have us back again...and again...and again...(They want to do this EVERY month!) 

We worked hands on with the kitchen for 3 weeks to teach the staff how to turn their menu 100% vegan and the first event got rave reviews. Now we want to invite all those who didn't have a chance to come out the first time!

The dishes are your classic pasta and meat dishes. We've done our best to make even BETTER vegan versions of each dish, including a cashew cheese plate :)

This is our chance to encourage Pagani to make this part of their everyday menu! 

• There is NO entrance fee for this event, however there is limited seating and RESERVATION is required :)

• Call[masked] to make a reservation using CODE WORD: "Veganizer"


About Veganizer:

Veganizer takes each restaurant's menu and serves it exactly as is on the evening of the event, however, it is in vegan form. Veganizer works one on one with the Executive Chef to create a mouth watering one time experience like no other. These events sell out fast because NYC is craving new and healthy cuisine outside of the traditional restaurants that we all know and love. 

About Pagani:

Pagani is an italian hot spot loved by many. The cuisine is italian inspired by Executive Chef Mark Barrett. The menu is very meat and fish centric which exotic sauces. 

About Chef Hadara:

Chef Hadara has a resume longer than most and Veganizer is thrilled to be doing their first event collaboration. She has traveled throughout the entire US as a chef and consultant. Her recipes can be found in Whole Foods, TGIF Fridays and more. Her favorite cuisine is Mexican as she has spent much time studying Latin cuisines. She is also the founder of Rawclates, the raw, organic and vegan premium chocolate company. She is a mother and entreprenuer and anyone who tries her cuisine will love every bite. 

About The Food and Drinks:

Here is the official ALLERGEN STATEMENT for all Veganizer events! 

On the night of the event, here is the menu that will be #OfficiallyVeganized. The food is A La Cart! 

Pagani is a stylish restaurant with a sheek and vintage look.

Some of Chef Hadara's Dishes

results.description:
Those Who Do Good Find Good

Sura 16, Verse 30

 And when it is said to those who are conscious of God, “What is it that your Lord has revealed? They say,” what is good”.

For those who do good there is good in this world, but the reward in the hereafter is better still; for how excellent is the abode of the God-conscious!

 This aya points out that those who are conscious of God find goodness that is in revelation, in contrast to those who interpret words of revelation in ways that cause personal unhappiness and social injustice.

The second part of the verse says that those who do good find goodness in this life, thus overturning the widespread belief that pious people are miserable here but find rewards in the next world.

The implications of these insights for our daily lives will be discussed in our meeting.

You are welcome to bring healthy snacks to share after the meeting.


Our discussions are based on the book 'The Quran and The Life of Excellence.'

  Notice: The attendees will be requested to contribute $ 5 each to help with the cost of renting the meeting room.
results.name: Quran Discussion in Manhattan-Those Who Do Good Find Good

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
and 12 – 1 pm before monthly Miracles in Manhattan lectures (usually 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

results.description:
How to be unconditionally happy?

A mind that is calm, without anticipation and agitation is the birth right of all individuals. A mind that is in the present moment will be happy.

What can get you to that state?

The rest you gain by reposing in yourself is deeper than the deepest sleep. The deeper your rest, the more dynamic your activity is. By being peaceful and happy you can turn your body into a power-house by generating an inner source of energy.

Meditation is simple and is a practical way to recharge and rejuvenate; empowering you to do more of the things you love.

Come join us for free guided session and experience the power of meditation.

Workshop Contents:

- Understanding the nature of the mind
- Relaxing Breathing Techniques
- Guided Meditation
- Introduction to the Happiness Course and Sudarshan Kriya

results.description:
Add some variety to your running -- do some speed work on the track! Think you're slow? This is the best way to get faster. Nobody is too slow to try a track workout. This is how you will improve.

We encourage runners of all ability levels to join. You are not too slow! If you are a even a little bit intimidated by the thought of running laps at the track we want to challenge you to come join us and find out just how awesome it actually is. You will feel great (and exhausted) at the end of the workout. Guaranteed!


The East River Park Track is just across the FDR highway at the end of 6th street. Just walk across the pedestrian overpass and the track will be right there.


NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. We pile all our stuff together and are (relatively) nearby for the duration of the workout. We have never had a problem with theft, but that doesn't mean it won't happen.


After the workout join us for beer at ABC Beer Co. at Ave C between 6th and 7th.

results.description:
Lupus patients and supporters get together to discuss lupus life in a loving environment with kindhearted people who understand what you are going through.

This time we will talk about positive mindsets and its affect on our health. Can we really move mountains with our belief, hopes and dreams? How do we stay positive when times get hard and we feel trapped in our sick bodies?

Finding the courage within to let go of the negativity, be grateful for where are you are today, and taking a winner's attitude to move forward. You can do it - and we are here to help. 

Also, we will have a couple of guest speakers stopping by to give us some heads up on what is happening in our new NYC chapter of Lupus Foundation of America. 

Beverages will be served. Feel free to bring snacks and friends/family members (21 and older).


There is no charge for this event. IT IS FREE TO ATTEND. 


People with other autoimmune diseases with similar symptoms like Lupus should feel free to attend, too.
results.name: Gratitude & a Winner's Attitude in Lupus (Support group)

results.description:
PLEASE READ:

Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7-7:05 - chat

7:05-7:30 - introductions (please be on time for intros)

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

See you there.
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

results.description:
Dearest Beloveds,

I am deeply honored and grateful to share this 10 month journey of The Path Of Light with each of you. This course will help you manifest and create the life of your soul with the love, support and guidance of the Ascended Masters. 

This journey is about expanding our consciousness and aligning to the truth of who we are. The path of self mastery assists you in healing those parts of you that no longer serve you. You will create a deeper and intimate connection to your spirit. You'll manifest your highest potential, and release fear, limitations and judgements. Your relationships will improve and reflect the love and honoring of self. 

Let us walk the path of Oneness!

Much Love and Gratitude,

Julie

The Path Of Light course was channeled by Ishtar, an embodied Ascended Master channel from Australia. Please visit her website: by clicking here 

"Be the change you wish to see in the world". ~~ Ghandi

results.description:
The Gong works on all levels, from the physical to the mental-emotional and spiritual to heal and transform. The almost tangible to the touch sound waves of the Gong can promote immediate and great positive change in the listener. 

These sessions start with very light stretches and pranayam-breathing exercises at the beginning and may include some meditation or chanting a mantra. The sounds and vibrations of the gong create deep relaxation and state of meditation by altering brain waves from a Beta (waking state) to Theta & Delta (deep meditation). Science teaches that during these brain frequencies we access our deeper subconscious and superconscious and they are key states for healing.
Many people have noticeable experiences during a Gong Bath. People can feel their bodies twitch (as the energy meridians are cleared & balanced), have insights, bursts of creative ideas, see splashes of color behind their closed eyes, out of body experiences, or simply experience feelings of total peace & connectedness.

Gong sound can be used to rebalance the physical, emotional and spiritual bodies. It has a profound affect on our cardiovascular, endocrine and immune systems. It is an excellent therapy for stress related issues, depression, fatigue, anger and hostility, feelings of separation, loneliness, and fear along with many other conditions related to lack of balance and harmony in the body.
results.name: Sound Healing-Gong Bath Meditation

Real Self Defense is Offensive in nature. 

KravMaguy offers a true, authentic Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) training experience emphasizing hand-to-hand combat, tactical and warrior training for both men and women. The Head instructor was featured in the History Channel – The Human Weapon- a documentary about Krav Maga in Israel. His last assignment was as Tactical Security Team Leader working off the coast of East Africa. 

In this basics class you will learn to defend yourself and survive knife wielding assassins, sexual assaults or any would be attacker looking to take your life using the basic principles of kravmaguy level one system. In the end only your are responsible for your own protection. You cannot rely on others when split seconds count.

Topics covered in Level One 8 week course:
Jab cross 
Fighting Stance
Weak body spots
Hook uppercut
Basic footwork
Punching jab cross
Elbows regular
Knees
Groin strikes- knees, shin to groin, groin jab (lead leg)
Knife hands
Escape- RNC
Escape guillotine
Escape schoolyard headlock (requires matted area)
Physical requirements to pass level one:
20 pushups
35 sit ups
30 squats
Level 2 training prep


check out this youtube video to see kravmaguy knife defense in action, these techniques are used by murderers and terrorists to kill countless innocents and knowing these basic defenses can save your life and the ones you love

results.description:
We will be discussing the contents of The World Peace Diet, Chapters 3 and 4: "The Nature of Intelligence" & "Inheriting our food choices"

• Chapter 3: The Nature of Intelligence; 

“It should not be believed that all beings exist for the sake of the existence of man. On the contrary, all the other beings too have been intended for their own sakes and not for the sake of anything else.” —Maimonides. Despite all the efforts of theology, science and art, do we really know ourselves better now than a 1000 years ago? Who knows what e really are. As such, how could we possibly know what it is to be an eagle, a dolphin, a lion, a stallion, pig, bull or chicken. Who are we to dis-regard their importance, and the value they place on their own lives?

• Chapter 4: Inheriting our food choices "

“This is dreadful! Not only the suffering and death of the animals, but that man suppresses in himself, unnecessarily, the highest spiritual capac- ity—that of sympathy and pity towards living creatures like himself— and by violating his own feelings becomes cruel.” —Leo Tolstoy. Who decided your tastes? was it you? Your parents? Your culture. The commercials you watch? is our diet natural, and is the food we are told is good for us really in our best interests.

The World Peace Diet provides a transformative perspective on the multiple consequences of the food choices we make (or are made for us)—not just in terms of personal physical health, but also environmental health, cultural, economic, ethical and spiritual well-being too.

If you have read the book, this study group will be a good forum for sharing sections that meant something to you, changed the way you perceive the world or the way you interact with the world, 

If you have not read the book but are an ethical and environmentally compassionate individual, and would like to explore ways to live more in alignment with your values, I think you will enjoy the discussion and be a valuable contributor. 

Remaining chapters will be discussed in the following weeks.

results.description: The purpose of this group is to establish a safe place where people can deal with the pain and isolation brought about by the ending of a significant relationship. We are not a singles group or a dating network. Instead, we are a family where it is safe to be ourselves. The goal of the meeting is to help members to develop into healthier, more complete, independent, loving men and women. We hope that by being together, listening to each other, and by sharing our experiences, strength and hope, we will learn to see the value of life in a new context. For the first hour of each meeting members share their experiences. The second half of the meeting is reserved for a guest speaker relating to either the legal or emotional aspects of separation/divorce. We meet every Monday eveing at the Church in the Highlands, 35 Bryant Ave. White Plains, New York. We are a mixed group of men and women. There are about 50 members, with approximately 20 attendees per meeting. There are no fees, new members are welcome, no reservation is necessary. We pass a basket at each meeting and suggest a five dollar donation per meeting to cover the cost of the meeting place and coffee/cookies served at the meeting.
results.name: Separation and Divorce Recovery Group Weekly Meetup

results.description:
Wake up to whole new relational spaces and touch into parts of yourself that bring a deep nourishment and inspiration.

REGISTER: https://circling.eventbrite.com/

For experienced Circlers, the evening will begin promptly at 7:30 pm.
On select evenings, Beginners are invited to join us at 6:30 pm.

See the schedule below:

Feb 8 - 6:30 beginners, 7:30 everyone
Feb 15 - 7:30 Experienced Circlers
Feb 22 - 6:30 beginners, 7:30 everyone
Feb 29 - Community Circling Night 7:30- 10:30 EVERYONE
March 7 - 7:30 Experienced Circlers
March 14 - 6:30 beginners, 7:30 everyone
March 21 - 7:30 Experienced Circlers
March 28 - Community Circling Night 7:30-10:30 EVERYONE

Please be punctual and check-in prior to start time in order to support the flow of the evening. Late arrivers may need to wait until the second circle to join if the first circle has already begun.

Each Circling Lab will be facilitated by a trained Circling Facilitator.

Participation is limited
Registering guarantees your spot

***NOTE: if you are new to Circling you must attend an intro session before participating in a Circling Lab. Intro sessions are offered one Monday each month from 6:30-7:15 and the last Monday of each month at our Community Circling Nights during the 7:30-10:30 pm event

Upcoming dates are listed below!

What’s it like to experience Circling?
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KmIhCf06Osg

What are the benefits of Circling?

Circling is a fresh way to develop presence and richer connections with those around you. It can provide fundamental and often unseen insights that, once seen, create new and exciting opportunities. It provides a doorway into flow experiences and breathes life into sometimes vague spiritual concepts and ideas.

Through Circling individuals can start to develop trust in a deeper intelligence in themselves and others. Part of what makes it special is that, although it is based on complex ideas, it is simple and empowering to take part in. We believe it to be one of the richest tools for human development in the world today because it works on so many levels.

What is Circling?

Circling is a practice where the attention of a small group is skillfully focused on an individual. This person gets to feel the impact of being supportively seen by others while also experiencing their honest in the moment feelings. The process revolves around connection, understanding and a deep authenticity between people. It involves bringing a greater awareness and appreciation into our connections with others and can be considered a relational meditation because of this. It is a paradigm-shifting practice that is supported by wide ranging research in how adults learn and develop. For more about information about Circling visit AuthenticWorld.com or www.circlingeurope.com

In order to secure a spot, you must pay in advance on Eventbrite. $20 per session or $55 for 3-sessions in one month $70 (does not include Community Night) for 4 sessions in one month  (does not include Community Night)

https://circling.eventbrite.com/

Walk-in registrations may be accepted if seats are available. Walk-in registrations: $25

Game description:

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field!

VERY IMPORTANT:

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


“Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play.

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous.

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game.


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

You will be asked to pay $9.25 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.25 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

* The Meetup is cancelled

Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Will Miles (Comedy at the Knitting Factory)
and you*

*SUBMIT TO THE “BAD WRITING” CONTEST!
Just bring 150 WORDS (MAX) of "awful” prose, “terrible” plays, or “garbage” poems to the show. We’ll let you get up onstage and read it. The “worst writer” wins $10 (just like A REAL AUTHOR) and a six-month-old copy of The New Yorker (never read).

$FREE$
THIS IS A 21 AND OVER EVENT.
shitlitcomedy.tumblr.com

results.description:
• Description :Let's meet and have a great time dancing in One of NYC's Top Dance Parties as featured in Timeout New York Magazine, celebrating their 6th year @ Taj Lounge!
Great dinner and dancing experience, live music, performers and guest DJ's. 

• RSVP: To enjoy the reduced admission , Mention the code that you will see in the comment section, it is different every week !!

• Price: $10 if you RSVP on the meet up. 

• Time:  8 pm- 2am ( Salsa Lesson at 7.00pm)


• Address: Taj Lounge, 48 W 21st St, New York

• What to wear: Dancing is about movement and enjoyment. We recommend wearing comfortable clothing that allows you to be flexible and relaxed. In order to be able to move comfortably across the floor, we advise that you do not wear rubber-soled shoes.

• Do I need a partner ?: No, you don’t need to bring a partner. We rotate during the group class, It will give you the opportunity to dance and meet different people.
results.name: Salsa dancing with Salsa New York @ Taj Lounge: Live Music + Performances

results.description:
What if accessing your desire is the thing that can truly give you fulfillment? What if real health and deep intimate relationships only comes from a life lived in accordance with what your body wants? Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC? We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact [masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us
results.name: Intimacy and Communication Games @TurnON Bushwick

results.description:
TurnOn - yourself, your relationships, your sex. This is the place to excavate what you truly desire. Have you wondered how to create the relationships you want? Experience the intimacy you crave? Where you can say the honest truth to your partner, your family, your lover and yet stay grounded in yourself?

We believe that no matter what type of relationship you desire, human connection is at the basis of genuine relating. We play a set of intimate communication games that let you sharpen your relating skills and hone your attention. You get to shed off the layers that keep us from being seen, be vulnerable and feel more alive. We play 3 games (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). It's a refreshing change from the typical “Hi, how are you?” conversation. You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can work towards having the intimacy you want.

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://youtu.be/8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: TurnON Games @ Tribeca

Monday Night Volleyball is intended to be for more advanced, fast paced volleyball geared toward players capable of defending against a hard spike, playing within a structured offensive and defensive system. Some nights we will set up a separate net for more advanced players. This will be up to the discretion of the organizers.

No beginners, or lower skilled players please.

Please consider your safety and the safety of others when signing up. In faster systems, please realize that being out of position can result in injuries.

results.description:
This is a meeting for people who have, or who have had at some point in the past, a good grasp of Latin grammar. If you had a few years of Latin in high school 20 years ago, chances are you'll be able to catch up without too much trouble. If you're just starting out, it might not be your cup of tea.

For next week, read lines 1-150 of Capitulum 40 of Lingua Latína II: Roma Æterna, and, if you like, reread Capitulum 2 of Familia Romana. Texts are downloadable at Lingua Latina per se Illustrata or for sale at Focus. Other resources are available at the website with videos and the flashcard website.

Macte virtúte!
results.name: Grex Intermedius

group.name: Circulus Latínus Noveborácénsis (New York Latin Circle)

results.description:
Guys, This meetup is to talk about the issues we each face. Some of the things that cause a lot of trouble: Problems with the ex. Harm to the children, and how to reduce it. If you have visitation and not custody, there are visitation problems we all deal with. Everyone pays child support. My idea is to kick around our problems and experiences, and see if that helps in dealing with the issues. I have changed the location for the meetup: at TGI Fridays 826 New Jersey 3 Clifton. This is a pretty nice TGI Fridays, and it is easy to get to.

Please come on time, and bring a friend with you. And please be ready to listen as well as ask questions.  This is a bunch of us who have been through it.  It is a good group!

see you then,

Bob Davies
results.how_to_find_us: You will see me at a table with a couple guys, sitting, talking, drinking a beer and relaxing!
results.name: The Divorcing Man's Support Group Monthly Meetup

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.

Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, get a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)
results.name: Monday 8:15pm Tron Ball - Night Soccer @ LIC (7v7 x2 games) for PS2G

results.description:
Hey movie fans, the French language comedy/drama "Marguerite" doesn't officially open in New York City until Friday, March 11. But members of this group (and certain others I organize) are eligible to preview it four days before that - for FREE!  

What's the catch? Well, there are two. First, it's on a Monday night and the movie doesn't start until 8:45 pm. And second, we have been allocated exactly 100 seats, and they ALL need to be filled if we want to get more offers of this type. The instructions at the bottom of this page were designed to accomplish that goal, so please read them carefully.

Loosely based on the life of the American socialite and incredibly awful soprano Florence Foster Jenkins, "Marguerite" tells the story of a woman whose dreams are a lot bigger than her talent.

In Paris in the 1920's, wealthy Baroness Marguerite Dumont (Frot) has a passion for music, especially opera. She deludes herself that her horrible singing is beautiful and gives private recitals for her friends and family. No one ever has the guts to tell her how bad she sounds, not even her husband (Marcon) or their butler (Mpunga). But after a young reporter (Dieuaide) sneaks into her benefit for war orphans and gives her a "rave" review, Marguerite decides that it's time to go public....


AWARDS 

Nominated for eleven Cesar Awards and winner of four, including Best Actress Catherine Frot.


Director: Xavier Giannoli 

Starring: Catherine Frot, Andre Marcon, Denis Mpunga, Michel Fau, Christa Theret, Sylvain Dieuaide

Length: 128 minutes

Country: France/Czech Republic/Belgium (2015)

Language: French, with English subtitles

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6XB3bB7ktMI


HOW TO GET FREE TICKETS 

1) As stated above, our group has a good chance of receiving access to additional free screenings, but please remember that every empty seat makes this less likely. Please do not take a ticket unless you will actually be seeing the film.

2) Starting at 5 pm on the day of the screening, tickets will be given out at the Trump Atrium, located at 725 Fifth Avenue between 56th and 57th Street.

3) From the main lobby, take the escalator down to the restaurant area. I will be somewhere near the waterfall, wearing a Meetup badge. 

4) Keep in mind that RSVP's for this event (across several groups) may be far more than the 100 tickets I will have. A cap is impractical because of the high no-show rate on Meetup. Therefore, distribution will be on a strict first-come/first-served basis - NO EXCEPTIONS. Try to claim your ticket as soon after 5 pm as possible.

5) I will leave the atrium at 8:15 pm or when the tickets are gone, whichever comes first.

6) If you would be arriving significantly after 5 pm, call (917)[masked] before heading over. I will NOT answer but the voicemail greeting will tell you whether any tickets are still available at that moment. 

IMPORTANT: This is not a smartphone and has no Internet access, so emails, comments posted on this page, or messages sent through the Meetup site (or app) will NOT reach me.

7) Calling beforehand still does not guarantee a ticket, since it is possible that the supply will run out between the time you call and the time you get there. This cannot be helped.

8) Guests are allowed but they must come with you to get their tickets. 

9) The actual screening will take place at the Paris Theater, 4 West 58th Street at 8:45 pm. This is approximately 2 blocks away from Trump Tower.


See you there!

Milton
results.name: FREE Preview Film Screening: "Marguerite"­­­­­­ (Earlier Ticket Pickup Required)

Nominated for eleven Cesar Awards and winner of four, including Best Actress Catherine Frot.


Director: Xavier Giannoli

Starring: Catherine Frot, Andre Marcon, Denis Mpunga, Michel Fau, Christa Theret, Sylvain Dieuaide

Length: 128 minutes

Country: France/Czech Republic/Belgium (2015)

Language: French, with English subtitles

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6XB3bB7ktMI


HOW TO GET FREE TICKETS

1) As stated above, our group has a good chance of receiving access to additional free screenings, but please remember that every empty seat makes this less likely. Please do not take a ticket unless you will actually be seeing the film.

2) Starting at 5 pm on the day of the screening, tickets will be given out at the Trump Atrium, located at 725 Fifth Avenue between 56th and 57th Street.

3) From the main lobby, take the escalator down to the restaurant area. I will be somewhere near the waterfall, wearing a Meetup badge.


4) Keep in mind that RSVP's for this event (across several groups) may be far more than the 100 tickets I will have. A cap is impractical because of the high no-show rate on Meetup. Therefore, distribution will be on a strict first-come/first-served basis - NO EXCEPTIONS. Try to claim your ticket as soon after 5 pm as possible.

5) I will leave the atrium at 8:15 pm or when the tickets are gone, whichever comes first.

6) If you would be arriving significantly after 5 pm, call (917)[masked] before heading over. I will NOT answer but the voicemail greeting will tell you whether any tickets are still available at that moment.


IMPORTANT: This is not a smartphone and has no Internet access, so emails, comments posted on this page, or messages sent through the Meetup site (or app) will NOT reach me.

7) Calling beforehand still does not guarantee a ticket, since it is possible that the supply will run out between the time you call and the time you get there. This cannot be helped.

8) Guests are allowed but they must come with you to get their tickets.


9) The actual screening will take place at the Paris Theater, 4 West 58th Street at 8:45 pm. This is approximately 2 blocks away from Trump Tower.


See you there!

Milton

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
